Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay for little ones”
Reviews.Author: Joycenwk
Reviews.Content: Nothing exceptional of that of an expensive hotel. Hotel caters to young guests with special programmes like story telling and games in a playroom. Kids can request for stickers of Disney characters from staff at souvenir shops, front desk, butler etc. it was like a sticker collection game. Disney characters joined for breakfast, which must be pre booked. There is a frequent shuttle to and fro Disneyland throughout the day which makes it convenient.

Reviews.Title: “I would expect more ...”
Reviews.Author: MakSir
Reviews.Content: This is celebrating my daughter birthday. The decoration of hotel is great and it is not easily see this in other hotels. It is just because it is theme park hotel. The room is a bit out of my expectation. I would expect more characters in the room but not :(. I feel the room is a bit out-dated or old. The baby bed is prepared well, it is clean but again seems old. It is usually 2 days 1 night stay and still a good choice if you visit Disneyland.

Reviews.Title: “must visited hotel”
Reviews.Author: SurVeyKhan
Reviews.Content: we went here during our honeymoon on April 2010, the room is quite neat although a lil bit small just like the most hotel room in hongkong, the service is excelent but the bathroom is too small i guess :lol For a disney fans (like us) its a must visited hotel when we're back to HK some other time.

Reviews.Title: “staying is a must”
Reviews.Author: chchchchch
Reviews.Content: similar to other reviews, i would also stay here again if i come back to disneyland. 1. had 2 youngs kids who take naps in the afternoons, so the proximity of the hotel allowed us to go back to the room when the kids felt tired. was able to go back in the evening to see the fireworks. 2. location not suitable if you plan to spend some time in the city for some shopping and lug everything back to the hotel unless you take a cab or hire a car . closest shopping would be the citygate outlets in tung chung, which is one or two mtr stops away. 3. room service was very quick and efficient but pricey. chinese restaurant is very good but also pricey. closest supermarket is also in tung chung. 4. no other channels on tv except the disney channels, so very boring for adults to watch tv.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here to enhance your Disney visit”
Reviews.Author: speeddolphin
Reviews.Content: It's a great hotel, and really makes the trip to Disneyland much better. I would stay here again if I returned to Disneyland HK. Here's why: 1. Proximity and multiple day tickets: The free shuttle service makes it possible for my little son to nap in the afternoon, and return the park later in the evening. It also meant we could stay till the park closed at night, and not worry about the long lines on the MTR and going back to the hotel. The shuttles were fast, and moved us back quickly. 2. Little Disney-themed souvenirs: my son loved the bedroom slippers (with mickey logo) and spotting the mickey logo at various places in the hotel. The toiletries and bathroom mirror were Snow White and the dwarfs. Cool. 3. Breakfast with Mickey: at about S$50 per person, this was totally worth it. Guaranteed sightings of Mickey and gang, who ensure time spent with each child (and adult), and lots of photos. Stay till the end of the 1.5 hours - Mickey and gang came round again to say good bye to those who were still around, so my son had extra time with them. Oh, and the food is quite good too - big spread, decent quality. Beats standing in line in the hot sun to take a quick picture at the park itself (although we did that too). 4. Great service: staff there are "cast members", like in the park itself. They were always helpful, polite and friendly. It made the hotel feel like an extension of the park experience, which was great, especially when you return from a crowded, hot park.

Reviews.Title: “A must do if you're going to the park”
Reviews.Author: Chingfordian2012
Reviews.Content: Saves on travelling time to get to the park. The bus picks up here first before the other hotel so you get on the bus and don't have to wait around. A great hotel. Great pool. However, it's expensive as is the food but as previously mentioned - that's Disney! The only problem is that you can't charge purchases in the park to your hotel room (which you can do in Orlando) and you can't get your park purchases delivered to your hotel either (also done at Orlando).

Reviews.Title: “Put some extra magic in the Magic Kingdom”
Reviews.Author: JRinChina
Reviews.Content: When we booked to stay at this hotel it was primarily for the easy access to Disneyland. Given the fairly reasonable hotel rates, we weren't expecting too much out of the hotel stay itself. But the hotel was beautiful -- in the Disney-themed way. Service was exceptional -- as one would expect from the producer of so many smiles. Book in advanced for the breakfast buffet. The food quality was great and a fun way to start the day with Disney characters wandering around for photos with the kids. We will definitely stay here again with the kids -- even if we have more time in Hong Kong and plan to explore beyond the theme park.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoy....”
Reviews.Author: MickeyLoveTravel
Reviews.Content: We really enjoy our stay here especially kids... Check in very smooth. We arrived in the morning, hotel are helping us to store our luggage since our room will be ready after 3noon. Nice hotel, all staff are very friendly and helpful. Room really big and spacious, clean& comfortable, can fit for 4 adults. Must have your meals in their restaurant if you go with kids, they will enjoy with all Disney characters, food taste good too. They also have Disney gift store in the hotel itself, can have last minutes shopping before leaving.

Reviews.Title: “Kids love it, but the place operates to drain your bank account”
Reviews.Author: lockey1979
Reviews.Content: Nice clean hotel, but small room with small beds not conducive to staying with three small children. The children enjoyed the experience, but for me it would have been easier to sign a blank cheque on arrival. The Chinese restaurant was good; Walt's was average on quality but high on price. Drinks were ridiculously priced. Service was mediocre, which really annoys me given te prices charged. The place is handy for the park but if I did go to the park again I would stay in HK.

Reviews.Title: “Memorable stay”
Reviews.Author: puja_gupta18
Reviews.Content: i stayed for 2 nights with my daughter on her Birthday . Rooms are fantastic , breakfast was elaborate and nice . The disney store offers several memoirs . Free shuttle to Disneyland . View is good from the sea. Staff was courteous . Must stay if you plan to visit Disneyland . A memorable stay !

Reviews.Title: “when you have kids gg to disneyland, its worth it”
Reviews.Author: melaniechrisholm
Reviews.Content: jus came back from Disneyland hotel HK. stayed jus one night with my husband, mum and my daughter(2 1/2 yrs old). as mentioned check in is at 3pm so we left our bag at the bell services and at the same time I decided to get us upgraded to the Kingdom club which in my opinion was definitely worthwhile. went visiting Disneyland first before heading back hotel in the evening to enjoy the club. You also get priority passes for "Golden Micky" shows (1st slot of the day show only) and some other rides too. the feeling is just great to know u dun have to wait in the long queue during this hot hot summer time in HK. As you join the kingdom club, drinks (of any kind ) and light dinner (eg. wine, beer, cakes selections and canapes from 6-8pm), snacks (thou nothing fancy, eg. fruits, gummies and biscuits) , breakfast (cereal, bread, porridge, noodle, sausage,scramble eggs and even cold cut ham and cheese and fruits) was considered sumptuous to us. I love the breakfast!! not forgetting you get ya child gets entertained with coloring session and story telling at night. and to end it off, you get to hug Mickey in his PJs. My daughter was just delighted the whole time. Pros: if you enjoy service and have young children (2-8yrs old), go for the Kingdom. Ill definitely be back at the Kingdom again. Cons: Check out latest is at 12pm(even for Kingdom club). no mall or amenities anywhere nearby. expensive but tasty room service overall good stay if you are going to Disneyland. if ya not gg to Disneyland, then i believe there are many more options.

Reviews.Title: “Never fails to amaze my kids!!”
Reviews.Author: kyee23
Reviews.Content: It's our 3rd time to visit hk, my kids always wanted to stay in this hotel. This is were they are most comfortable than hollywood hotel. Stayed for 2nights, kids as always enjoyed the pool. My son looved the food and my daughter took the chance to get all the stuff she wanted frm their store at the lobby. Our room was quite big, we were on the 5th floor with pool view. Staff were always pleasant. Definitely will come again!

Reviews.Title: “Fun place to stay when visiting Disney”
Reviews.Author: PDelaSingapore
Reviews.Content: If you can possibly stay at the Disneyland Hotel when visiting Hong Kong Disneyland then it is a must. Not because it is the most amazing hotel but for the fun of it for your kids and ease of it of getting to and from the park. We arrived early in the morning, having stayed in Kowloon for a few days, and the staff were all very friendly and the hotel clean and actually better than I was expecting. We then left our bags, as it was to early to check into our room, and jumped on the shuttle bus to the park. At the end of the day we collapsed in our room (we had been upgraded which was great) which was a fantastic Fantasia room and had a jacuzzi bath in it. It was perfect after a long day at the Park to collapse so close by. The rooms were comfortable and my five year old son loved having his own smaller pair of slippers and bathrobe to wear! We had room service that night which was good but not cheap but then you expect that. Book in for the breakfast on your stay - it is crazy and busy and noisy but a good buffet selection but more importantly you can have pictures taken with the characters who come round to each of the tables - it was fun and my son loved it! It is not cheap staying at the hotel, hence why we stayed just one night, but it was worth it as Disney is such a magical place and if you are going to experience it you might as well go all out!

Reviews.Title: “Disneyland magic in Hong Kong.”
Reviews.Author: Rochelle H
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the kingdom club on level 7 for three nights with our two year old son. Everything at this hotel was magical a dthe staff went out of their magic to make it magical. Our room had an amazing view of hong kong island and the south china sea. Room sizes were great and my.ittle one especially loved the tv in the bathroom. The breakfast was small but when you consider the number of guests in the kingdom club it was perfect. Huge range of food which continually came out. We loved meetingminnie, Minnie and the princesses in the. Lib. A highlight was aurora reading a story to my son. Well worth every cent and it made for a truelly magical Disney experience.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive hotel”
Reviews.Author: amit4717
Reviews.Content: I went with my family and stayed 2 nights when we went to disney land. Its quite an expensive hotel because of the location. The rooms were comfy with basic facilities. The food was good over all we had a nice time.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience to stay in Hong Kong Disneyland Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sunitakat
Reviews.Content: If you want to meet all the Disney characters like Micky, Goofy, Minnie and Pluto at your breakfast table then this is the place to stay in Disneyland.The hotel is really nice and just a ten minutes drive to Hong Kong Disneyland theme park with free shuttle services every 10 minutes. The hotel has great rooms and a very nice pool. The hotel also offers you a view of the sea and also very nice lush green gardens. The food served at the restaurant is amazing and the variety is really too large with dishes from all cuisines. The hotel service staff is also great and overall this is the place to stay when you are in Disneyland.

Reviews.Title: “Very sleek but you expect something special for this price”
Reviews.Author: ozgirlinnz
Reviews.Content: We (2 adults and 2 kids aged 5 & 3) spent 2 nights here so we could make the most of our time at Disneyland. I was a bit sceptical especially because the price was so high but it was a pretty special experience. The first room we were allocated reeked of cigarette smoke so we requested a new room. They really need to have non-smoking sections of the hotel because while our new room was fine, the corridors around the room were filled with smoke. Our other complaints were that the rules at the waterslide were ridiculously strict and we weren't allowed to go down with our children on our laps or catch them at the bottom and the food a the poolside bar was very bland. Take insect repellant if you plan to use the pool in the afternoon. The character breakfast was a highlight for all. Arrive early to get a good table in the middle of the room. The characters were good at sharing the love but those seated at the edge of the room got less access to the characters. We also enjoyed the live music in the lobby each evening and the gym facilities were good. It was nice to not have to travel far to get home each evening. Very convenient shuttle to the park. We would certainly recommend to others but it's unlikely we will stay there again. For the price you pay, it's really a once in a lifetime experience. It feels so cut off from the rest of the world too.

Reviews.Title: “DISNEY MAGIC!”
Reviews.Author: vindav
Reviews.Content: Our experience was just “Disney magic’. We stayed in this hotel for 3 nights when were visiting Disneyland hong kong , The room tariff and the food were expansive but I feel it was worth it as you pay extra for the Disney magic! The Victorian styled lavishly theme hotel with beautiful landscaped gardens, nice pools one outdoor and one indoor, amazing breakfast with Disney characters kids loved it. Buses leave the hotel every few minutes to Disney Park and the same from the park to the hotel. I would highly recommend this hotel compared to nearby Disney Hollywood hotel.

Reviews.Title: “It's Wow”
Reviews.Author: s_de_gurgaon
Reviews.Content: Well we just loved the stay in hotel disney land . Right from teh entrance with two statues of Mickey and Miny to the Piano in sitting area , the view from the room , the garden maze , the sea every thing was just Wow. One thing not to be missed is "Enchanted Garden" Breakfast Buffet . It is simply amazing . Mickey shaped waffles was a great hit for kids . And yes the best attaction is the visit of characters . We could meet Goofy , Mickey , pluto and daizy . Kids just did not wanted to come out . Next day we had breakfast in waltz cafe and it was a bif off . Not value for money . It is better to pay a little extra for Enchanted Gardens . Room Highlight : Slippers and bathrobe for kids Service Highlight : Buses every 15 miniutes to Disney Park

Reviews.Title: “Where Dreams Come True... STILL”
Reviews.Author: nic_homeaid
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this particular hotel/resort twice. Price is on the higher side, but you pay for the novelty of it - obviously. You can catch some of the characters in the lobby, if you know what time they arrive, you can easily cue in line for photos. Restaurants are not worth it in my opinion, so best to dine at Disney Hollywood Hotel, it's cheaper there. Accessibility is still great, well you're in HK, so every place can be reached via MTR. Kids' face (3 and up) priceless

Reviews.Title: “A Magical Disney Experience”
Reviews.Author: Ramam95
Reviews.Content: The overall Hongkong Disneyland experience was truly magical. While we have visited Disneyland Los Angeles as youngsters, this was a first Disney visit for my 5 year old daughter and 4 year old niece who thoroughly enjoyed themselves and still have stars in their eyes when they see the photographs, over and over again. The hotel is very classy and old world and certainly worth staying in. The shuttle services to the park back and forth were very convenient. Even though the Disneyland Park itself is smaller compared to the one in other countries, our stay over 3 days helped us to pace visiting the attractions and to plan the visit without stress considering our child was still small. The overall stay and service was very good though we did have some issues with finding Vegetarian food and specifically Indian food which is not very prominent on the menu. Thankfully a chat with the chef (room service helped us with that) and and giving him some suggestions on vegetables he could use got us a "Jeera Aloo" to go with our Rice. We were happy that the staff took that extra step to make sure we got something we wanted (quite badly!!) By chance, we happened to see a newspaper article before our Hongkong trip that mentioned Indian Vegetarian food in the Tahitian Terrace (at the Disneyland Park) and that was really a fabulous find. The Thali is no fuss and quite filling and wholesome. Two things that are organized by the hotel that we opted for were fantastic: (1)The breakfast with the characters, a must if you have children in the 4-10 age group accompanying as they just love the whole experience and come back with fantastic memories. (2) The Princess dress up though a little steep is a must do for little girls (ideally 3-8/9). My daughter just loved the whole dressing up experience from the make-up, hair-styling to the photo shoot and came away feeling like a true princess. Overall a great experience, would love to repeat it!

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Stay”
Reviews.Author: Dwgoldengrove
Reviews.Content: Took our Little 4 Year old boy and our Big 17 year old girl! Not sure which one had the most fun? Great family stay we stayed 2 nights . Stayed in the Kingdom room which gives special extras which we must recommend. Firstly the Kids Story reading is well worth it. They get Bed time stories around 8 Pm my little one was so excited. Then the icing on the Cake was when Mini Mouse did the rounds before bed time in the private kingdom lounge. They sneak in without warning and to see the look on the little ones face is priceless. Nothing is too hard for the characters there is plenty of opportunity to get a Photo with them. The pool area is also great with a water slide. The rooms are a bit on the small side we had a balcony overlooking the MAZE garden. The little touches make the stay like Kids Mickey Mouse Dressing Robes (can be purchased) and the complementary Mickey mouse slippers. The little touches for the kids make it wonderful ,like We had dinner in the lounge and my 4 year old whom is normally a fussy eater ate every one of his Carrots because they were shaped like Mickey mouse! go Figure. 2 Days would be enough you need that to do the theme park properly. Wouldn't stay much longer though as its not exactly luxury for adults. Shuttle busses to Park were regular and Prompt. Very clean and very well run. All day snacks and beverages with the kingdom lounge is a must. Only negative of the whole hotel was running water noise above our room seemed to go on all night. Sounded like someone flushing the toilet all night made for bad sleep. But I can live with that for only 2 nights for the positives far out way it.

Reviews.Title: “No need to stay overnight! The park is small...”
Reviews.Author: HongKongStars
Reviews.Content: This hotel is opened for few years only but already getting old and outdated. Check-in process was smooth with nice staff. The room had a very cold ambiance and atmosphere, and for the price that you are paying (same than a Peninsula or Mandarin Oriental Hong Kong) you are expecting more than this. At least a welcome note from the management in the room with some amenities… But not at Hong Kong Disneyland. As we are in Hong Kong, we have ordered a typical Afternoon Tea sets. What a terrible food and experience, the food was not freshly made and was very industrial. If you have had experienced Disney in Orlando and Paris, this hotel is a scaled-down version of the Grand Floridian. If you’ve never been to Disney World, then think Holiday Inn (in terms of room and food quality) meets old age home (in terms of décor and the smell of the awful air freshener that they seem to use everywhere) There is no need for you to stay at Disney Resort in Hong Kong ‘cause the park is so small that 6 hours are more than enough to ride all the games and attractions. Stay in Hong Kong and enjoy a day trip in the Park (but once again, remember that it is extremely small, don’t expect the same format than Walt Disney World, it is even smaller than Disneyland Paris).

Reviews.Title: “First Disney experience for the kids”
Reviews.Author: HamidDelhi
Reviews.Content: Downside : Our flight landed at 9 AM in Hong Kong and we went straight to the Disneyland Hotel Hong Kong. The hotel has a policy of 3 PM Check-in. They couldnt give us any room then. So went to the Disneyland Park straight away. After a 5 and a half hour flight, I think it was too much for the kids. But they enjoyed themselves in the fantasy of the Disneyland for a full 5 hours, before calling it a day. Upside : The Hotel had a free shuttle to the Disneyland Park every 2 minutes. The toileteries were Disney-brand packed, however lacked quality. The breakfast and dinner with the Disney characters was thoroughly enjoyed by the kids. The indoor and outdoor pools give you an added option.

Reviews.Title: “Be a part of the Disney experience.”
Reviews.Author: SyedNoorMShah
Reviews.Content: I went to the disney land hotel with my family. Two daughters and wife . I visited the hotel on the 23rd of June 2012 . I stayed there for 3 nights. I took the hotel because i wanted to take my children to Disney land for 2 days. The Hotel is a real 5 star property. The rooms were spacious, clean and the housekeeping was great. We got a basket of things every day ( soaps, shampoo etc) in disney boxes. There is a Mickey maze which you can visit outside the hotel. The chandeliers have cindrealla shoe on them. Every wall has a painting of some disney classic. The story telling is done 3 times a day where you can take your children to make them hear a story. The Enchanted garden breakfast is a must where you get a paid meeting with the disney characters (mickey, pluto etc) . You get your pictures , key chains etc. Best of all you are so close to Disney land that getting there and back is so easy. There is a free shuttle which run back and forth to Disney land. The TV in the rooms runs Disney Cartoons the whole day. My children used to enjoy them a lot. I was glad to live at the Hong kong Disney land resort and i will do so again.

Reviews.Title: “Massively overpriced for a novelty hotel”
Reviews.Author: Daniel N
Reviews.Content: It is a decent hotel but very overrated for a 5* hotel. Besides the name, the accuracy of the descriptions of their rooms can be ignored. A seaview room = standing at window and tilting your body all the way until it sticks to the glass door to peep at the edge of the sea. We were extremely upset with the false advertising and even toured at least 3 rooms due to our feedback. The only "seaview" room comes with a balcony and we must top up at least USD20+ per night for that. What's more was that that particular room allowed us to view a full tree while having "unblocked" view through the leaves of the tree of the sea. Needless to say, we had no choice but settled on a partial view of the sea while being conned in paying the price of a seaview room. No apologies were given on the management side nor any form of compensation was offered. Probably showing their indignant attitude to their hotel guests. We can't help but leave this hotel with a feeling of feeling CHEATED. Really regretted booking this hotel. My advice, stay at Hollywood instead as it is much more value for money than this hotel. Better still, stay on any of the hotels around the area and pop by on the MTR.

Reviews.Title: “old world charm”
Reviews.Author: DOCMumbai
Reviews.Content: stayed with family to experience disney at close quarters and was not disappointed . Classy elegant colonial ambience. humongous breakfast with the disney stars an experience unforgettable for the kids and adults alike. Rooms big enough for a family of Four. Only hitch is late check in which hampers movement if staying only for one day.

Reviews.Title: “loving it”
Reviews.Author: Atshaali
Reviews.Content: just got back from HK Disneyland trip. there were 11 of us in this trip. we booked 4 rooms and asked for connecting room and they were kind enough to provide us with rooms that connected and front of each other. the room is big with 2 big bed and fun decoration. loves the bathtub and loves how they provide for the little ones. they provide us with kids size bath rob and kids size hotel's sandals. so cute. my daughter loves it. The breakfast was awesome. Mickey, Goofy and Pluto was kind enough to visit all table and takes pict with everybody. my daughter is so happy. the food r good specially the yummy micky waffle and pancakes. Disney store in the lobby was awesome too. there r always shuttle available to disney. overall very good experience and will stay here again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “A disgrace”
Reviews.Author: Veteranito
Reviews.Content: Stayed there during the easter time. Check-in was not magical at all and I thought I was speaking to a check-in machine. Wanted to store my luggage after registration (since we are not allowed to check-in before 15:00), but the receptionist told us to walk to the right side for storage. Ok, we went to the side which says Concierge, but ha, the Concierge told us to walk out (again) to the main door where luggage are kept! Disney? Can you guys simply keep it and You pass it to the appropriate person to keep, instead of asking your customer to carry that and walk from one counter to another? Of course my wife and my kids looked at me astonishingly and wondering why I didn't leave it to their staffs as if this is my first time to travel and didn't know what is service (well I didn't want to create a drama as this is a family getaway so never mind)... oh and please be a bit professional, give your customers a little smile. (At that point I was imagining I was at a camp or something... ) Ate breakfast at their lobby restaurant, but the place looked filthy as I can see left over foods on the floor and staff don't seem to care much. Room size is good but poor maintenance, as there were many chipped and dented furnitures. For the price paid, you can stay at a luxurious real 5 star hotel at many other places in Hong Kong, I know that its you or the Hollywood Hotel closest to the Disney Park and you take advantage of this on your price, but please at least manage it professionally and be fair in business.

Reviews.Title: “Best for the kids and family bonding …”
Reviews.Author: Miner_DMS91
Reviews.Content: The hotel is of Victorian setting. Disney characters like mickey mouse and his group and princesses frequent the hotel giving opportunity for photo shoots. Of course, official photographers are in tow taking shots for you to buy later at a hefty price. Nevertheless, the kids enjoy it the most having their pictures taken beside their favourite characters. The hotel is up to 7th floor, wherein the 7th floor is reserved for kingdom club guests (need a card to access this floor) and room rates are higher than the usual rates (6th floor down). Aside from flowing snacks, exclusive meetings with Disney characters, bedtime stories, park fast pass, park priority pass, the rooms have a balcony and a separate shower area (not co-mix with the bath tub). Other than that, it is similar to the usual rooms. Disney characters frequent the hotel lobby for picture taking. The hotel have a spa and gym. The grounds have a medium size pool and garden maze. Every ten minutes, a bus service the Disneyland loop from the hotel to Hollywood hotel and the park (wherein a the train station is located and serve as your access to go around Hongkong via train, taxis are quite expensive to go around and takes longer time) Sometimes towels are quite worn out already so just ask for a better one. If your planning to visit the park during summer, just ask for an umbrella on your way out of the hotel (very friendly bell boys). It is really hot in the park.

Reviews.Title: “Best Experience”
Reviews.Author: Vincentsmyth
Reviews.Content: Disney Hong Kong is certainly one of the best hotel we ever been. We love it, the staff was very helpful. rooms were clean and nice. hotel facilities was great. will recommend this hotel to all my friends.

Reviews.Title: “DISNEY EXPERIENCE IN TRUE SENSE”
Reviews.Author: dramitvij
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night and 2 days at the hotel .it was a amazing experience and specially my daughter loved it. the rooms were very spacious and the hotel lobby was beautiful. the disney shop in the hotel was a tempting experience. the buffet had a unique menu covering most of the cuisines. overall a very good experience and il definitely come back whenever i visit hong kong again

Reviews.Title: “Fun Experience, Close your Eyes when Signing the Bill”
Reviews.Author: MPCLDC
Reviews.Content: HK Disneyland Hotel was a great experience for our daughters and our family friends who also stayed in Disneyland Hotel at same time. The rooms are big (for HK standards), clean and nicely furnished. There is a subtle Disney design theme that does not overpower the premiumness of the experience. We liked the breakfast with Mickey & friends, the food and experience was quite good, the staff will take pictures on your camera for you. We liked the room. We liked the large lobby where princesses would show up every so often for pictures. The shuttle bus was never more than a 2 minute wait to or from the park. We did not like the checkin experience, waited in line, Saturday morning at 10am for 45 minutes! This is not acceptable when paying over 400 USD pernight for one room. The breakfast and other meals are quite expensive, I just closed my eyes and signed the bill.

Reviews.Title: “Disney !”
Reviews.Author: ARK09
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights in May 2012 . With 2 kids , both below 3 years . Was a good experience. Staff is helpful and quick . Required changes in reservations , extension of stay , knowledge of hotel facilities was very good. Kids had a great time ! So did we ! Will be back there soon . Expensive , but satisfying . The dinner buffet had Indian vegetarian food too !

Reviews.Title: “Celebration of birthday at HK Disneyland Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Seapig18
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 1 night at Kingdom Suite in early June to celebrate my birthday and my little son's birthday. The Suite is well maintained and v. spacious. Have 1 toilet, 1 huge bathroom plus toilet, big living room, 2 queen size beds plus baby cot. My little son ran around happily in the Suite. The hotel provided all baby amenities which I previously requested upon check-in. Allowed early check-in at 2pm and late check out at 12:30pm. Enjoy the Kingdom Club lounge v.much, quiet and relax. Staff are friendly and helpful. My little son enjoyed the mickey shape cookies at snacks time and mickey shape waffles at breakfast time. Breakfast there is good. At around 8pm, you can see firework at the club lounge. However, we don't enjoy it v.much as all the guests are gathered in the balcony and it's just too crowded. Love to see Mickey in PJs at the Club lounge before sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Disney at its BEST!!!!”
Reviews.Author: nanaguide
Reviews.Content: I love Disney and Disney Hotels. The Hong Kong Hollywood Disney Hotel is beautiful. The grounds are gorgeous, the lobby is tastefully done, the rooms are spacious - the bed is great. The service is superb. Wish I could have stayed longer to enjoy the "magic"

Reviews.Title: “My kids love this hotel...”
Reviews.Author: Liabella
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from June6-10, our first night we stayed in Kingdom Club, we arrived @10am for the early check in on the 7th floor, exclusively for the Kingdom Club guests, while waiting for the check in we are served with coffee, juices & cookies, we are advised to return just after lunch, so we have decided to go to the park, after buying the 2 day ticket, the Kingdom club gave us 4 complimentary fast pass ticket & 4 tickets for first priority seating accommodation in The Golden Mickey Show...great!...no need to line...after a tiring day in the park, we returned and had our snacks in the Kingdom Lounge, we had our appetizers and free wine in the Kingdom Club, while my kids are enjoying the siomai & pastries. We stayed in the lounge up to 9pm because from here you can watch the fireworks @ 8pm, storytelling for the kids @ 825 and @845, Minnie Mouse & Mickey mouse will be their in their pajamas for photo shooting. During breakfast, the are very minimal choice of food, though, my kids just enjoyed the mickey mouse waffle, pancakes & cereals. The room was big with TV inside the bathroom, but it almost the same with our garden view room on the 6th floor, the only difference is the separate shower room & bathtub, TV and there's no lotion available in the Garden View room...=( Over all review, if you have no kids who adores Mickey/Minnie Mouse, better stay in the 6th floor of the Garden View room, you can save almost of 1500HK$....

Reviews.Title: “Disneyland the brand”
Reviews.Author: N0rza
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in the Fantasia Room. We arrived after 3pm with a smooth check in process. The room was dated. The furniture was old & bathroom looked like it required a renovation. (A lot of grout and a funky smell) The lifts in the hotel are disorientated with some lifts not going to certain floors. I hated using the toilet- you would have to use both hands and push the button with all your strength to get it to flush! 4pm onwards is a nice time to visit the park for the afternoon/night time festivities. The price we paid for accommodation, 2-day pass, food & souvenirs was expensive. The price for the quality of room was over priced. We asked if we could extend our check out time so we could go & have a shower before catching our flight. The staff said no but informed us we could use the pool changeroom facilities. It was a 15 minute walk around to get to it due to the pool upgrades going on. By the time we walked back to the luggage storage it defeated the purpose of having a shower. Very poorly planned. The Hotel and Park staff were friendly. No complaints there. In hindsight the $610 HKD for the breakfast for two with the characters was not worth it. Breakfast was nice but they only had 3 characters in the room. Dinner at the Crystal Lotus was yum. Great food and excellent service. Would I recommend it? Yes.. But only if you are willing to go to bed straight after dinner (there's nothing to do after the park is closed) and pay for all the extras like breakfast with the characters. Also it's probably easy walking to the park then catching the shuttle if you don't have kids.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal hotel near Hong Kong Disneyland park”
Reviews.Author: Ahnita
Reviews.Content: I like this hotel simply because its ideally situated near the park, after a long day of walking, just take a bus from the park and you're ready to crash. The lobby is nicely decorated with large crystalized chandeliers, a grand piano, comfy plush seats and mickey mouse statues you'll adore. Playful and elegant. I booked the garden suite and the room is extravagant. My favorite part of the room is the jacuzzi. You can spend just a few hours there drinking wine with a special someone. Just relaxing and indulging after a tiring day. Nicely maintained wooden furniture, a 42 inch tv, a king sized bed and a very nice view of the gardens. Try to eat at the Garden Restaurant, huge selection of food and you get an exlusive chance to take a picture with the disney characters while eating. Food in the restaurant is of great quality like most 5 star hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Surrender to the cheesiness and just enjoy.”
Reviews.Author: dipfamily
Reviews.Content: The hotel was my first Disney experience, and I entered a skeptic and left a convert -- every small detail was Mickey-related, down to the shampoo in the room. The place was spotless and so well maintained. The pool was adorable and so much fun for the kids. Only issue would be how expensive the dining options are, but it was a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “There is no fun in in this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Suvabrata
Reviews.Content: When you relate something to Disney what you connect to is fun, color and high energy. I was surprised to find this place exactly the opposite. Its colorless and drab so much so that the formal wear of the hotel staff is weirdly comical. You would expect that attire in a hospital or a convent but not in a hotel. The staff is extremely rigid to the extent that they would close down the buffet dinner because the time is 10.01pm doesn't matter if your child hadn't had her desert. I was quite taken aback at the rigid and rude behavior at the birth place of modern entertainment. The stay was otherwise comfortable and uneventful.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay for a family”
Reviews.Author: tootti
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hong Kong Disneyland Hotel for one night only on 14/5/2012. There were 7 of us, (Hubby, Mother, daughter 30, daughter 18, daughter 15 son 9 and myself) and we stayed in 2 x Kingdom suites with views of the South China Sea. It was worth the money. It was beautiful. Check-in was a breeze as was Check-out. We purchased 2 day passes on check-in. After a very hot and tiring day at the park we came back the the kids had a swim, it was off to the Enchanted Garden buffet dinner. Expensive but great for a special occasion. It was my birthday and my husband had arranged for a cake when he booked the rooms. Goofy, Pluto, Minnie & of course Mickey was there and come desert time they came out with the cake and sang Happy Birthday. After dinner we went back to the 7th floor to watch fireworks not long after that was story time and then Mickey arrived in his PJs to say goodnight and last photos of the day, a fitting end to a wonderful day! Next morning we had breakfast at the free buffet which comes with Kingdom suite. The arrangement of food was good and after breakfast Sleeping Beauty arrived for photos. Hubby wasn't feeling well so he stayed and checked-out. I had mentioned this to staff on the 7th floor and they said he was free to stay in the lounge area and get some food or something to drink if he liked while we went off to the park. I had also arranged with the Concierge to pick up bags around 3:00pm. When we arrived back to the hotel Hubby was refreshed and feeling a little better and bags were already for pick up and onto the shuttle to MTR. I must add that riding in the elevator was soooo funny to hear Mickey & Minnies voices telling us to have a great day and what floor we had arrived at. There is also a good arrangements of merchandised goods at the Disney store in the foyer. We purchased Mickey & Minnie ears for the whole family .......even Nan to wear to the park. I cannot fault the staff at HK Disneyland Hotel, they were wonderful. Nothing was too much trouble for them. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fine Stay But Some Kinks to Work Out”
Reviews.Author: Mohammedyu
Reviews.Content: We stayed from May 25 to May 28 during a long weekend. This was our first time at the resort and at Hong Kong Disneyland -- we had been to Disneyland in Anaheim jut a month before. I'll try to focus just on the hotel. We booked a Fanstasia Room and received Room 5000. The lobby is on the Third Floor and the Fifth Floor is one floor above (there is a superstition against fourth floors in Asia). The rooms are appointed well and clean. There is no Wi Fi except in the lobby but there is a LAN connection (for a fee). The first impression I received was in the bathroom. There is a bowl with disposable combs, toothbrushes, razors, shower caps, etc. This is very common in many hotels, but each of the supplied items were of such low quality that you wonder why they offer it in the first place. It's almost as if just to try to fit in as a four star or five star resort, they try to supply these items simply so an assessor can check the correct boxes. The shower was set up in an awkward manner -- there is no separate shower booth, you are just showering outside of the tub on the bathroom floor which happens to have a drain. Again, they installed a rain shower showerhead, even though the existing showerhead was just as fine -- I assume all of these improvements ultimately get reflected in the prices we pay. I guess it can be contradictory, but I wished they ditched the above amenities and opted for more practical ones -- such as a universal electricity converter. The only one available was for an electric razor in the bathroom. So we had our iPhones, iPads, laptops all charging in the bathroom taking turns. And free Wi Fi. This is turning into a pet peeve -- hotels really should not be charging for Wi Fi or any internet access. Ultimately, I am starting to develop a rule that for any Disney hotel, the rule should be to get the cheapest room possible. You won't be spending a lot of time there except in the evenings. The Disney store in the lobby had a great selection of products so you can avoid the lines at the park. The front desk was helpful in arranging for the Prestige Tour last minute (highly recommended) as well as transportation. English fluency was not as big an issue as I had feared, everyone spoke decent English. On top of that, if you tip (HK$ 20) to a bell captain or doorman, you will definitely get attention and get better service. It appears the staff is being tested by dealing with all the mainland visitors and they would prefer to help tourists from anywhere else. I ordered room service once -- a hamburger which was just average. One big blemish on the experience. There are two choices for breakfast -- a buffet at Enchanted Sea Restaurant with the characters walking around or a la carte at Walt's Cafe. Ultimately, your kid will win and you will end up at the former, It would take superior negotiation skills with your kid (or your kid's absence) to end up at the latter. As you would expect, you pay for the potential to have Mickey, Goofey, Pluto or Daisey come by your table for a photo and an autograph. You definitely do not pay for the quality of the food. The food was on par with what I imagine they feed the enlisted grunts in the local army barracks. Really blah. The pre-cooked scrambled eggs were a watery goop, the sausages were inedible as was the mueslix. The breads were not bad (the croissants were crap). They know you have no choice but to come (because of the characters) and they know the food does not need to impress (quite scary).

Reviews.Title: “Love disneyland!”
Reviews.Author: Minnie1206
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at disneyland hotel. The kids love the hotel and my husband as well. Buffet breakfast was good plus you get to take pictures with your favorite disney characters! They go table to table to accomodate people who wants to take pictures with them. High speed wi-fi available at the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, hotel does exactly what it says it does”
Reviews.Author: madmot
Reviews.Content: Arrived early, were checked straight in, room as expected. Were in park 30 mins later. Paid for character breakfast which is a must, run extremely well. I had forgotten my camera battery charger - no problem, the hotel had some! Check in, check out all took less than 5 mins - very impressed. We all had a fantastic couple of days. The only minor thing is being charged 40HK for a glass of milk for a baby......

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay..”
Reviews.Author: shyboy14
Reviews.Content: we travelled to HK disney hotel and were very pleased with the first impression of the hotel in green lantau island. though we travelled from india and had requested for an early check in ,it was declined when we landed .After paying top dollar for three nights, i do wish disney would be more considerate to families with young kids. The lobby was full of such families and the rooms were just sitting empty because of standard policy for a few hours. I had taken a sea view with balcony and the room by itself was a stunner. It was spacious and with two twin beds large enough for a family of 4.The bathrooms were spacious too. The lack of wifi in the rooms was a little old fashioned I thought. The breakfast costs were mind boggling and One was always badgered to take photo ops with characters for which astronomical prices were charged. Barring this , It was a lovely experience.the resort to park transfers were smooth.

Reviews.Title: “Disney quality and service!”
Reviews.Author: ppour
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay really makes the whole Disney experience complete for the kids! I realize alotnofmpeople stay there but as new as the hotel is I was a little dis appointed in the condition of the rooms. Furniture was a bit beat up and bathroom tub and sink area had quite a lot of water damage around the wall. Breakfast was good each day. Breakfast with the characters was amazing, book early and go to the early time as well. Be patient the characters are good at coming through the whole room. This is the second time we have stayed here and loved it both times!

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: Summ3rg4l
Reviews.Content: The hotel is clean and pleasant. I love the small playroom where the kids could play inside before we check in. A few things could be improved: 1) Walt's restaurant could provide more kids-friendly food (only 2 choices of food available). We hv difficulties ordering spaghetti carbonara in the restaurant for brunch, they need to order it from room-service dept for us. The reason was "the kitchen didn't have the right ingredient to make it" (imagine that!) 2) They are lacking of good English-speaking "cast members". Isn't this a 5* international hotel? Wonder why? 3) The bell-boy service is a disaster. We waited more than one hour for the luggage to be brought into the room & a little less than 2 hour for us to wait for the luggage to be picked up to check out!

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms and grounds, a little weak on the food”
Reviews.Author: Joe P
Reviews.Content: Our third stay at the Hotel within the past 18 months. The hotel grounds are immaculate. The swimming pool complex is fantastic for families, and the rooms are great. We enjoyed a surprise upgrade to a 1 bedroom suite on the 7th floor, which was over-the top luxurious. The only criticm is the limited food selection, somewhat high prices, and slow service in the restaurant. If you want to have the character breakfast, plan to spend 1.5-2 hrs. Otherwise, take the shuttle bus to Hollywood Hotel and eat there.

Reviews.Title: “It’s Magical”
Reviews.Author: Monegeetta
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Hong Kong and we made the most of the 8 nights. Staying at the Hong Kong Disney was the start of a memorable holiday. From the time we arrived at night till the afternoon when we left, we never stopped feeling special. We had a room overlooking the gardens and it was very comfortable, we would start each day with breakfast down stairs where we would be greeted by a staff member who would show us to a table and produce hot tea or coffee, had to train them to fill the cup and not give us a cup with the tide out, they quickly learnt and it became a bit of a joke each morning, all went towards making a happy start to the day. The hotel is only a 15 minute walk down a very pleasant pathway to Disneyland or you can catch the free shuttle, most days we would walk down and then catch the bus back. The train station is only a couple of minutes further on and for HK$55 you can get a 24 hour ticket and go everywhere, we did this on two days, just hop on and off when we felt like it. On the other days we caught the train into town to go to the different tourist places, very clean trains and only about 10 minutes between trains. Given how far out from HK the hotel is they don’t rip you off, a can of coke was the same price as down town and the food from the restaurant was excellent. We did make pigs of ourselves and to hell with the waist line by going down stairs to the smorgasbord, what a treat, ended up going back on our last night, yep, it took a bit to return to my normal trim, taught and terrific shape ;) Price, well if you are coming this far then you might as well enjoy it, its well away from all the smog and noise of downtown and more relaxed than what we saw at the motels in Kowloon & HK and very nice to come back to at the end of a long day. We are saving to come back to HK again and we will be staying here and getting a three day pass to Disneyland. Visited April 2011

Reviews.Title: “Kingdom Club Rocks!”
Reviews.Author: Islandpotter
Reviews.Content: This was our 3rd visit to HK Disneyland hotel, and as we had a rather long stay of 5 nights with our four kids, this time we decided to try out the Kingdom Club. It was a fantastic decision! Yes, the rooms cost quite a bit more than the regular floors, but it was more than worth it: - nice free breakfast in the club lounge (much more relaxed than the madness in Enchanted garden, great selection of hot & cold food) - cookies and drinks, snacks all day for hungry kids, wine & beer for parents at 6pm (there is nowhere to buy snacks nearby, so this was a huge plus), fireworks viewing from the small balcony - bedtime story, THEN, Mickey or Minnie come to say goodnight in their PJ's - crafts/activities throughout the day - Princesses visit the lounge in the morning too - also great if you see the queues at the park for this! You could also check in/out upstairs, buy tickets and get concierge service at the lounge, which was very convenient as there were always lines at the lobby. They can also book hotel restaurants for you, a must as the Enchanted Garden always fills up!

Reviews.Title: “Quite pricey but worth every penny.”
Reviews.Author: bebele
Reviews.Content: For those young and young at heart, the Disneyland Hotel is the perfect choice when visiting Disneyland in Hongkong. Our family of 5 stayed for 3 days 2 nights last April, in time for my granddaughter's 12th birthday. It was a surprise gift to her, and boy, was she surprised. We had 2 Kingdom Club rooms and we had access to the club lounge. It's definitely worth the extra bucks, the choices for breakfast were delicious, plus we would go there for our snacks, drinks and free wifi access. They even offer a free 5 minute massage, and there were coloring activities to keep the kids busy. The only flaw was that the princesses weren't scheduled to visit on all the days we were there, which was the one of the reasons I chose to upgrade to the Kingdom club rooms. Oh well. The huge chandeliers are an awesome sight. The jazz band playing in the afternoons were good. The pianist was playing some Disney tunes. Of course we also had 2 days in the Disney Park, but it was rainy on all the days we were there so we had the chance to enjoy the hotel a bit more too. The garden view of the maze and of the hotel from our balcony made all of us go oooohhhhh. Highly recommended, but be warned! It is indeed pricey.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect place to stay”
Reviews.Author: yunatravels
Reviews.Content: We arrived here in the morning, the check-in process was fast!, we've just left our baggage, then directly queue for a shuttle bus to the Disneyland. By the time we finished our leisure time at the Disneyland, our rooms are ready,... nice decor, clean, facing to the beach... just perfect. Breakfast time was quite a very tight schedule, since there were lots of guests... so we have to leave the coffee shop very sharp.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: bosagr
Reviews.Content: This place was so great! As we arrived at night it was all lit up like a magical castle and as the kids didnt know where we were going their eyes just lit up.. Had 2 connecting rooms and the rooms were big and had all the soaps shampoos etc in Disney boxes.. At night you can press story time on the interactive phone and a screen lights up and you pick a story to be read to the kids.. Yes breakfast is expensive(as is EVERYTHING in Hong Kong) but the beauty of all the characters oming around to each and every child and cuddling them and getting photos is beautiful.. At Disneyland park you have to line up for this for sometime and it's photo and gone but at the breakfast they sit down and pretend to eat your food etc, it was beautiful.. The delight on the kids face was awesome.. Tvs in room have all the Disney Chanel's etc, no need to purchase movies.. If going to Hong Kong with kids thus is a must

Reviews.Title: “Magical disney experience”
Reviews.Author: Hillenburg96
Reviews.Content: As soon as me and my family walked into the Disneyland Hotel, we knew that this was going to be good. The staff did everything that they could to make us comfortable and just they way that they treated us made the stay so much better. The character breakfast in the morning is worth it, as they have good food and you dont have to wait in long lines to see the characters inside the park. The room size was excellent, as we are a family of seven, and it had a great view of the bay and the maze. Overall, this is a great hotel and I would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “worst hotel ever stayed.”
Reviews.Author: aliredha
Reviews.Content: have you ever stayed on a 5 star hotel? this is one of the lowest service 5 star hotel.. 1) pay so much without breakfast. 2) 50 usd for breakfast per person, child below 3 free. 3) watch movie with money, you have to pay to watch movie. and if you clicked by mistake buy they can not cancel even if you have not watched the movie. 4) they have playbook story for children, but guess what you have to pay for it despite this is part and parcel of the hotel. 5) food we could not eat because only breakfast is 50 usd than how much would it be for lunch and dinner. 6) the location is so far and they do not have even a mini supermarket if you want to buy something. i asked the receptionist is there anywhere near by i can get something.. they are like we are sorry you have to go to town. I WOULD NEVER ADVISE ANYONE TO STAY HERE.

Reviews.Title: “Magical Stay, Great Service”
Reviews.Author: Joyful08
Reviews.Content: We reserved one garden view room with double beds at the price of HK$1936/night (normal rate is HK$2420) for 2 nights and HK$2057 for 3rd night as it was a Friday. The rate was attractive for 4 persons in a room. I paid 1800+ for a tiny room in HK island and for 2 rooms, I paid 3600+, which was more expensive than Disneyland Hotel. Though there is no sea view, we could see Disneyland's fireworks display from our balcony at 8pm nightly. The décor of the hotel is beautiful and classy, so were the rooms. Felt very magical and good staying at this hotel. Service was very good and prompt and staff were very polite, friendly and helpful. The shuttle bus service was frequent and at the end of the Disneyland’s closing, the shuttle buses will be waiting for the hotel guests so literally zero waiting time. Only minus point was the bed is not really queen sized and not big enough for 2 adults. Buffet breakfast with Disney characters at Enchanted garden and lunch at the Crystal Lotus with cute dim sums shaped after Disney characters are highly recommended. It was indeed a MAGICAL and enjoyable stay here!

Reviews.Title: “An expensive but magical experience”
Reviews.Author: deepakgupta5
Reviews.Content: We went to Disneyland Hong Kong for our daughter's birthday and chose to stay at this hotel. Full marks to Disney for paying attention to the smallest of details. We had chosen a sea view room and the view was extremely nice. Shuttle service to the Disneyland Park was The breakfast was the best part of the stay with the Disney characters paying a visit to each and every table.For our daughter, the highlight of the stay was getting to meet the Princess Cinderella character in the hotel lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Full of Disney magic”
Reviews.Author: zanzibar138
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights here as part of our honeymoon. Words really can't describe how beautiful this hotel is! Full of all the details that make Disney such a magical place. I loved looking at the artwork, finding hidden Mickeys, and taking in the old world charm of the place. My husband spent a great deal of time just hanging out in the lobby reading a book, listening to the pianist, and people watching (especially when the princesses were out for greetings). When we first arrived we were swooped upon by bell staff who took our luggage and delivered to our room when we were checked in. The check in process was straight forward and quick. The cast member was also able to activate our annual passes, which it said needed to be done at the park gates - it did take a little while to organise that. The room we were checked into was beautiful, and looked out over the garden to the sea (we had booked a garden view room), however the smell was horrific (I hadn't thought to book a non-smoking room). I called to request a room change and within 10 minutes we were being shown to our new room. It had the same beautiful details, and came with a balcony, but overlooking the carpark. Still, we were happy to have the balcony with fresh air. We ended up having a partial view of the fireworks which was obstructed by a tree. The rooms have a subtle Snow White theme, particularly evident in the well appointed bathrooms, complete with 7 dwarf themed toiletries. We visited Walt's cafe a few times, for breakfast and dinner. Most times we were happy with the service and food, but felt it was a bit expensive for what it was. The butter chicken was the best meal I'd had for a long time. We also had a character breakfast at the Enchanted Garden, which was disappointing. There was a good variety of yummy food, but only 4 characters, and a lot of tables for them to visit. We expected more for the money (and it wasn't just a Disney thing, we felt our character breakfast in Anaheim was much better value for money). The pool was closed for maintenance while we were there, and it was really too cold for swimming anyway. It looked lovely though, complete with waterslide. The indoor pool looked nice too, but is pretty small. We didn't get a chance to try out the spa or anything. The gardens were beautiful and immaculately kept. It was really nice just walking around checking them out and taking in the sea view. It was a 10-15 minute walk to Disneyland along a beautifully landscaped path with Disney music piped in. We only caught the shuttle a couple of times as we found it crowded and really unnecessary given the proximity of the hotel to the park. The only complaint I would have about the hotel was a funny scraping noise coming from above us on a couple of nights. I'm not sure what it was, and it wasn't loud, but enough to keep me (a very light sleeper) awake. Overall, I would say although this hotel is expensive, you get what you pay for, and it's worth every cent if you can afford it!

Reviews.Title: “What a magical place.”
Reviews.Author: yedigovna
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Disneyland Hotel recently and absolutely loved it. We had adjoining rooms which was great. The rooms are great in size and decor. The facilities were great and the kids loved the 3 night stay. Breakfast with the characters was enjoyable and a real treat for the kids. We met Mickey, Daisy, Pluto, Mini and Goofy. Shuttle service to Disney park was every 5 minutes and only took 5 minutes to get there. Service was great and free wifi in the lobby area. Highly Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Go when not crowded - club floor”
Reviews.Author: MaryLeeStenson
Reviews.Content: It's a great idea to stay on the club floor - you get buffet breakfast, snacks all day, wine and beer and appetizers at night and you get to see the fireworks from the balcony at 8pm. Must visit hotel when not crowded. We went twice with no crowds and it was wonderful. Went in April Easter Week and was way too crowded. Buffet food was hard to keep stocked on the club floor restaurant. Room was nice size and clean. Pool and slide were a big hit. Maze is fun. Beautiful view of the ocean.

Reviews.Title: “Nice trip”
Reviews.Author: frankview
Reviews.Content: Very convenient to stay here if you have kids who love all things Disney. We spent 2 nights at the Hotel. Rooms are neat but as you can expect the Hotel is overly crowded. The chinese restaurant is very good but was a bit disappointed that both the restaurants at the Hotel are quite High end from a price and layout perspective. I would had liked to see more kids focused restaurants as well. Could do a much better job at organising some kids events like 'princess dress up " etc as it seemed very disorganised in a makeshift room. Very expensive restaurants for what is supposed to be a kid focused place.

Reviews.Title: “My sons first trip to disneyland.”
Reviews.Author: Stephylovetravel
Reviews.Content: We are a family of 4 and we stayed in Hong Kong Disneyland for 2 nites in March 2012. The rooms comes with 2 queen beds. The rooms are clean and toilet is spacious too. They even have ironing board and iron in the room. The kids room slipper is so cute. The hotel provides shuttlebus to disneyland until 1am at night. We bought a 2 days pass to disneyland and our kids has their first memorable magical experience. The negative points is, when we booked the rooms from zuji. It states that the check in time is 2pm. But we have to wait until 3pm to check in. The hotel breakfast is expensive and they do not allow adult to order kids meal. The kids meals is in a form of mickey mouse waffle. Is so cute that I want to eat that, but they do not allow. And they eye u like a hawk to make sure u are not eating the waffle. Keeping all the utensile from your seats. Other then the resturant. The rest are fine. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “A Magical Experience!”
Reviews.Author: JandT_xlant_Advntur
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed the Disneyland resort hotel! The staff made it a magical experience! We found the team to be very friendly and always willing to help. The house keeping team were wonderful and we were always greeted with a 'good morning'. We had breakfast at the Enchanted garden and got to meet the Mickey and friends daily. My nephew (who is 6 years old) will always remember the game that he played with Pluto. The characters were always willing to take photos and made every child and adult feel very special. Walt's cafe served good meals too. My nephew enjoyed the kids meals, especially how they were presented in Mickey Mouse bowls. We loved the pools at the resort and the Mickey Maze. The experience at the 'Victoria spa' was sensational and would recommend to everyone. They know how to pamper you. The shuttle service to the park was always frequent and quick. We are very happy that we stayed at the Disneyland hotel, it completed the whole Disneyland experience for us.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: FifiLSydney
Reviews.Content: If you are doing Disneyland , this is a great hotel. At breakfast time it is the best opportunity for children to meet Mickey and Co. Hotel has good dining options and the resort is not far from hotel with free bus. We had a great experience here.

Reviews.Title: “It would have been better!”
Reviews.Author: CezCLee
Reviews.Content: It was our first time to stay in this hotel. The irony was that we had our grown up kids with us and they were like asking me why only now. The place is magical especially the lobby. Some staff were really nice and friendly.The place outsidekb the hotel is really magical especially at night. My husband with our kids loved to walk in the Promenade and The rooms we chose were with the balcony,overlooking the harbor. Truly a beautiful view of water and setting sun with the Disney harbor and lighthouse in sight. But it would have been better if they updated the rooms. Repainted and changed the curtain showers. There was this distinct smell so I didn't enjoy staying much in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Consistently Good!”
Reviews.Author: Andrew3889
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Kingdom Club suite with a interconnecting room with family of 3 kids. It was our 3rd time staying there and we are still not tired of it.. The rooms are very clean and spacious. I wonder how did they managed to keep the property and the rooms always like new. The service from the Club are consistently very good. I subscribed to the Disneyland Magic Access and I booked my rooms through the dedicated hotlines. The Magic Access provides free upgrade to a suite and I would recommend that you get it as there are other perks like priority seating in the Golden Mickey Show and discounts in the Disneyland shops. Mickey and the Princesses also make sure they appear in the Club daily. I am sure we will be back very soon!

Reviews.Title: “A bit disappointed....”
Reviews.Author: CarolineJenkins
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews on here and was expecting better, to be honest. My disappointment might be partly because we stayed in the Four Seasons (HK) just prior, and to compare them is only natural! The room was satisfactory, but I expected more of a Disney feel for the kids. The room looked a bit dated, and there was no wow factor for the kids. The staff were nice, and certainly very friendly to the kids. The playroom was a nice idea, but I thought it could have done with more toys/activities. The pool area was fantastic, our daughters spent a couple of hours on the slide, and the pool staff were extremely attentive and very vigilant. I was impressed by their attention to our children's safety, although of course we were supervising them the whole time too. The character breakfast was worthwhile, but the food was only so-so. The characters were brilliant though, and spent plenty of time at each table, and made all the children feel special. A must! The park is only a short walk away, so that's a huge plus. The meals at the hotel were ok, but very expensive. We paid $10AUD for a bottle of water with dinner! My tip would be to feed kids dinner at the park, rather than eat at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A Family Hotel ...”
Reviews.Author: kiko1203
Reviews.Content: Expensive but this is one good resort hotel to "splurge occassionally" with the kids. I'll keep my review as short as that. Plus, our room was perfect located with both the ocean view as well as the mickey maze garden view. Bathroom had a jacuzzi. Best place to be inside the room after a day of walking.

Reviews.Title: “Close to the action”
Reviews.Author: paulksyin
Reviews.Content: As a hotel, I have no complaints at all. Rooms were well-appointed although wear was evident. Excellent water pressure in the shower. Lots of cartoon channels on the TV. Clean, nice view of the maze in the center courtyard. There's a Disney store in the lobby. Hotel is by the sea. There is a cozy cartoon watching area just next to the front desk - great idea to entertain the lil' ones while mommy & daddy handle the paperwork of checking-in & buying park tickets. Disney princess characters are always in the lobby for photo ops. Every 10 minutes there's a shuttle bus that takes you to the park itself (also where the bus & MTR stops are). The deco, look & feel are like American civil war-era grand mansions. The slight letdown was the lack of a consistent Disney theme throughout the hotel and in the rooms. Only the Disney store, characters and after-thought icons on the toiletries boxes maintained some connection to Disneyland. Other than that, you would be forgiven for mistaking this for "just another" good hotel. Like I said, I have no complaints about the place as a hotel itself - just feel that there should've been more emphasis on visuals/onsite attractions to keep to the Disney branding.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and good”
Reviews.Author: BenLYK
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights (over a weekend) in March. The weather was not good, there was a rather cold snap, but can't blame the hotel for that. Very nice Disney themed hotel and if you have no plans to visit the park early, do hang around in the lobby in the morning as Disney characters (usually princesses) occasionally make appearances and this is way of meeting them is much easier than at the park.Rooms are spacious enough for a family of four although one should not expect top notch amenities here. The breakfast at the Enchanted Garden is an opportunity for kids to meet Mickey, Daisy, Pluto and Goofy (no one else, sorry!) without the hassle of queueing up at the park. We ate there for three mornings and although the spread was decent, the variety was getting a little boring on the third day. Bookings are essential for the character breakfast as the hotel was busy even on a Monday. If you are not going to visit the park, dont bother staying here because it is way too far to travel from the hotel to Hong Kong island and back.

Reviews.Title: “A magical stay”
Reviews.Author: buddy08438
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights in march 2012 (me , my wife and my 10 yr old son). We stayed in park view room for 3 days and enjoyed every bit of hospitality the hotel has to offer. everyone in the hotel is very polite and extra helpful.We booked a garden view room and got a very good room with a king size bed. The breakfast was very good with lots of options.The next three days in the hotel just passed as we are in some magical land. room jacuzzi tub was the place where my son spent his evening time. The indoor swimming pool is also very good. The princess at the hotel lobby , mickey , goofy at breakfast time ... just magical .

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Choice for family”
Reviews.Author: Aidanaj
Reviews.Content: Was rather an impeccable stay except allocation of room . we book 4 adult but was assign with 2 super single bed. Quite a feat to have a good rest. Toilet was spacious, you have a stand shower, but tub and still ample space. Design of the room was very impressive; a place to put your shoes, even a little dresser which is not a part of toilet! Breakfast was not very fancy but make up by having Disney character around

Reviews.Title: “Good choice if you only want to visit the Disneyland Park”
Reviews.Author: the_goodsoil_family
Reviews.Content: This time we visited Hong Kong for the Disneyland Park, so easy access was a key factor when choosing a hotel. Moreover, the rooms were large enough to accommodate our whole family with two children: if we had chosen to stay in downtown, we would apparently have needed two rooms with a cost similar or higher than in the Disney hotel. We stayed in a Sea View room, which was quite comfortably large for the whole family with its two double beds.If we had wanted to do other things in Hong Kong, this hotel would not have been a great choice, On a March Saturday afternoon there was no queue at the reception and it was easy to buy the Disneyland Park tickets right there, We booked the room from the hotel web site and breakfast was not included, so we had to buy it at the reception. The breakfast buffet in the "Enchanted Garden" with photo opportunities with Disney characters was reasonable value with a wide choice of Chinese, Western, Japanese and Indian dishes. The room was what we expected based on the pictures in the hotel web site, The tub bath was nice, but the safety box would not have been big enough for a 17" laptop. The very low-key DIsney theming in the hotel was actually something of a disappointment. I would have preferred to see more... Surprisingly the room service menu appeared to have better prices and a wider choice than the hotel restaurants, so we ended up using it for a late supper. The service was quicker than promised, and the food was tasty. The outdoor pools were closed for maintenance from January to March, but the indoor pool was fun enough being heated to 30 degrees Celcius. The life-guard on duty was very helpful, but the overall arrangements with the outside dressing rooms etc. were quite confusing. The prices in the hotel gift shop were surprisingly cheap, and we bought several Disney-branded items from there. Overall this hotel was a bit expensive, but provided what we expected. We stayed in a downtown hotel on our first visit to Hong Kong Disneyland. That was kind of tolerable with one child, but it would have been quite painful with two children - now it was really nice to have a short free bus transfer from the park when the kids were worn out after a long day.

Reviews.Title: “Frightening Wake Up Call”
Reviews.Author: RostrevorMichael
Reviews.Content: The most disconcerting thing about the hotel is its wake up call. When you are there for a conference, the last thing you want to hear is Mickey Mouse on the phone reminding you of what the time is "PAL". Surely there must be a way of not frightening adult guests with Mickey. Otherwise the beds are comfortable, room well equipped, but maybe not the best place to stay for a conference.

Reviews.Title: “Great for 5-year old girls!”
Reviews.Author: EMNason
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for one night during the weekend to celebrate our daughter's 5th birthday. Based on some other reviews I read here, I reserved a room in the Kingdom Club floor with a 2-day Disney pass package. Even though the room is more expensive, but it provides access to a lounge area that provides breakfast (reasonable selection), snacks and drinks, and evening cocktails and appetizers, which is well worth the extra price. We can see the firework from there at 8pm, followed by bedtime story time for the kids (Mandarin, Cantonese, and English). A Disney character (for us it's Mickey) will then come out to let you take pictures with him/ her. There are also "princesses" in the lobby from time to time for pictures. The one thing that our daughter loved is the "my little princess" dress up and photo shoot. We did it the morning of the day we are checking out, and our daughter wore the princess dress to the Disney park the rest of the day and had a blast. People actually waved and took picture of her! The hotel also gave her a birthday batch to wear so everyone was saying happy birthday to her as well. But parents, beware of the expensive photo trap. The dress up package include one 8x10 photo only, and they will try to lure you to purchase additional photos/ album/ keychain at a very high price. So you may want to do this step with your daughter tucked away so they don't beg you to buy them. The hotel has many other facilities (pool, gym etc) that we don't have time to try, as we are spending both days at the park. Our kids had a lot of fun (including our 2.5 year old son), a great family vacation for the kids though it's quite tiring for the parents. Overall, a nice experience!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Day Trip”
Reviews.Author: SheetalKini
Reviews.Content: one of th e major attractions for anyone visiting Hong Kong is to go to DisneyLand. Although not a huge as ones in US, its has all the characters/rides/shows which are landmark. its divided into Main Street, U.S.A., Fantasyland, Adventureland, Tomorrowland and Toy Story Land. The grand parade of toys passes thru main street USA.Has several good oppurtunity for photo-ops thruout the park

Reviews.Title: “A good side-trip if you have children!”
Reviews.Author: Sunflowergirl01
Reviews.Content: We recently spent 2 weeks in Hong Kong and broke up the stay with a 2 night visit to the HK Disneyland Hotel. It was a good move - the change of scene was welcome and it offered the children a good break from being dragged around temples, markets and shopping malls!! After reading tripadvisor reviews we decided to book a Kingdom Club room (I didn't fancy the long check in queues - but actually there were none on the day we arrived - or a fight for a breakfast table!). In my opinion the club rooms are worth it - you make yourself known to someone in the lobby when you arrive and you are immediately taken up to the club lounge to check in with a cup of tea, coffee (very civilised!). The Kingdom Club room price included breakfast, snacks and drinks all day in the Club lounge and in the evening complimentary wine, beer and a delicious spread of little 'bitings' and mini desserts - a wonderful way to watch the 8pm fireworks which, if you are not in the park, can be seen from the club lounge balcony. Also Mickey and Minnie come into the lounge and say goodnight! Rooms were good - all in the Victoriana style (not usually my cup of tea but it's Disney and therefore it works!). Would advise getting the tickets for the park at the Club lounge on arrival - we got a very good deal and they gave us some fast pass tickets too. Also priority seats at the free shows - Lion King and The Golden Mickeys - both absolutely excellent. We booked dinner at the Crystal Lotus - really good Chinese food - one of our best meals in the 2 week stay in HK.

Reviews.Title: “Great Disney Experience at Kingdom Club”
Reviews.Author: kconnies
Reviews.Content: Based on tripadvisor, I upgraded our room to Kingdom Club right before we arrived at the hotel. As a result, we were taken to the 7th floor lounge check in. It was $1000 HK per night to upgrade and totally worth it. I went with my husband and 2 children ages 4 and 6. -Kingdom Club is a lounge open from 7:30am - 10pm. All food and beverage is free. -We ate breakfast there every morning. My kids loved the Mickey shaped waffles. -We also had appetizers and wine every night. Good warm choices with cheese and fruit too. A glass of wine after a busy day was lovely too. -Mickey or Minnie came to the club every night to say good night. My kids got pics with both without having to stand in line. -Also because of Kingdom Club, we got priority seating and fast pass Disneyland. Priority seating at The Golden Mickeys meant front row seating and it was fabulous. -Our room was typical but had a lovely view of the maze and sea -It was spacious and cleaning service was prompt -We walked the first day to Disney from hotel between 10-15 minutes because of the kids. -We took the shuttle too and it was easy but we liked walking. -There was lots of activities for the kids including Prince Eric's room, the maze, the indoor swimming pool plus daily activities at Kingdom Club -Staff was friendly and very sweet to our kids Overall, great visit but I think Kingdom Club made a big difference.

Reviews.Title: “Hong Kong Disneyland Resort, Really Good Fun”
Reviews.Author: Capt_Camper
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Disney Hollywood Resort Hotel. It was a great change from the norm. From the Micky themed shampoo bottles to the Micky Mouse Lift PA system, everything felt so Disney. The Buffet was extremely difficult to get into so book well in advance, we didn't and could not get in. With this said though we found the meals in the Bar superb and great value. You can sit, have a meal, cold beer and watch a Disney movie on the big screen. So if you are in Hong Kong give it a try. It is so easy to get to, just catch the Disney Train. That was a great experience also.

Reviews.Title: “Kids Friendly Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ClarissaBay
