Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights in HK Disneyland Hotel and was quite please to note that true to being a Disney Hotel, it is really Kids Friendly. Checking in took quite a while (about 1.5 hrs) as we have requested for an ajoining room. This is pretty disappointing especially after a tiring flight. However, the lobby was comfy to wait at and soothing as there was a pianist playing beautiful music to entertain waiting guests at the lobby. This probably made waiting more bearable. There is only a mini TV room at the lobby area with beautifully crafted kiddy seats to keep those active kids occupied while waiting. Room is beautiful, spacious and clean. We have booked two sea view rooms and the view is wonderful. Beds are comfy and large as compared to hotels in the main city area. Love the fact that the Disneyhotel is like a haven on its own, away from the hussle and bustle of the city. My 3 year old son loves the Disney Channel, the little bedroom slippers (kid-sized) as well as the bath robe (kid-sized too!!). Bathroom has a nice vintage feel and also feels spacious. Thoughtful enough to have a small stepping stool for kiddos who are too short to reach the wash basin. Toilertries are also Disney themed. Nice. There is also an activity room for kids where little girls can dress up as princess for a day. LIttle boys (like mine) are also entertained by its cute kitchen sets, colouring activities and friendly staff. The garden just outside the hotel is beautiful with colourful flowers and maze made out of neatly trimmed bushes. We had a great time at the garden. The Disneyland Hotel also provides free shuttle toand from Disneyland Park which I feel its excellent especially when you are travelling with kids and elderly. We can always go back to the hotel for a short rest before going back to the park again to enjoy the beautiful fireworks in Disneyland at night. Wonderful. It will be perfect if the hotel can allow earlier check in and provides free shuttle to the nearby malls like Citygate outlets. Overall, it was a good experience staying there and I will probably go back again with my family.

Reviews.Title: “For the kids....yes”
Reviews.Author: andyob
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the first two days of our trip moving into Hong Kong proper after this. This is a great place for the kids because the hotel is an extension of the park. My 8 year old thought it was heaven seeing mickey mouse in the hotel lobby, or shaking goofy's hand as you have a meal. Worth the stay if you are visiting Disneyland for with your kids over two days. Some good deals avaliable.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing experience , scope of improvement”
Reviews.Author: DR_APAC
Reviews.Content: I just finished my 4 days trip staying at Disneyland hotel and have mixed reactions. It's a brilliant location with nice infrastructure and beautiful ambience . What I didn't like was hotel's pity behaviour on not sending more than 1 slice of bread in breakfast in room and charging 15 hkd for 1 single slice .give us a break . 1 slice of bread at 15 hkd while if u go in breakfast t their restaurant , u have no limits on their breads. Crazy , sometime these hotels forget that some great things are ruined by silly attitudes

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for kids!”
Reviews.Author: upariya
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Disneyland Hong Kong Hotel on 11-12 Dec 2011 as part of our 10th Anniversary & Family trip in Hong Kong. We had a wonderful time staying at this hotel as all the staffs were very friendly, polite and helpful. My daughter loved everything about this hotel especially the "My Little Princess" program for kids at King Triton Function Room. She was so happy and bouncy all the time during our stay. Not sure why, but this hotel does not have in-room wifi for a guest which is a bit strange for me since every other hotel we've stayed during our trip in Hong Kong had a wifi for their guests even some of them were just a low budget hotel. Anyway, it's been a wonderful journey for us and we loved the hotel. Can't wait to visit Hong Kong & the Disneyland resort again. Thank you for such a wonderful experiences!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic family holiday here!”
Reviews.Author: MaximusRacing
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Kingdom Club, fantastic experience for my family and meeting the characters without the jostling crowd is well worth the extra premium. Suite size is great for us! 5star bed, 5star bathroom amenities!

Reviews.Title: “Victorian style hotel with breathtaking views”
Reviews.Author: Rainne_T
Reviews.Content: Booked the Fantasia room for one night stay. Fantasia rooms are corner rooms, and thus there's very limited quantity and one should try and book them early. The price does justify the room and the views that come along with it, but I guess only if you are there for special occasions. Reception staff spoke lovely English, and every one of them sported a warm, friendly smile. Indoor pool looks lovely, but we didn't have the time to try it out. Our room was very lovely and extremely spacious, with excellent sea views. The bathroom has a jacuzzi bathtub - everything was working fine. The TV remote, however, was not working, and we had to resort to pressing the buttons manually on the TV set itself. Not that it really matters - the satellite signals were bad and most of the channels weren't watchable, except for their very own Disney channels. I love the bedroom slippers, and the hotel actually encourage you to bring them home. I'm still wearing my pair of Disney slippers from the hotel right now, as I'm typing this review! Durable, quality stuff. Breakfast at the Enchanted Garden was good, but not fantastic. The only selling point is you get to be greeted by Disney characters and to take pictures with them.

Reviews.Title: “Pricey, but worth the experience.”
Reviews.Author: 5_O
Reviews.Content: Stayed here just before the Lunar New Year with the family. We checked in in the morning but room was only avaliable after 3pm. Not an issue as we spend the day at disneyland and didn't head back to the hotel until after the fireworks. The hotel is decorated in Victorian style, the room are of a decent size. A word of warning, all the resturants in the property closes at 2230, which after the fireworks at 2100 and then the shops etc by the time was in the room, room service was all that was avaliable. Serivce was very good but the standard of the food was very poor, the spaghetti bolognese was microwaved for example not what you would expect really. Breakfast at The Enchanted Garden, an expensive buffet and the standard of the food was forgettable. The point of this meal is to the disney character walk to every table and you can take as much photos with them on your own camera, purely for the kids. The grounds was lovely and very well kept, the maze was great fun. A great disney experience, if somewhat pricey but you probably expect that.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Family Stay”
Reviews.Author: Loren J
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well appointed without being too over the top. Rooms were good and was fun just walking around taking pictures around the property. Breakfast overlooking the maze outside and then walking off the food in the maze itself. Tried the buffet dinner downstairs where the food was just mediocre but didn't really have high expectations. Plenty of Disney characters floating around with accompanying cameraman who charge you for the pictures (optional).

Reviews.Title: “very good for families - but expensive!”
Reviews.Author: mahalow
Reviews.Content: Great location: It takes less than 10 mins to get to the theme park on foot. There's a shuttle bus every 10 mins that takes you to the park too. Kids wont get bored: Lots of activities for kids such as princess make-overs, story-telling, breakfast with characters, etc. Adults also won't get bored with the facilities such as the gym, pool, garden, and restaurants. Tip: spend a night here, but make sure to check-in early and get a 2-day theme park pass (499 HK$ vs 399 for 1 day) so you can have a leisurely time at the park & enjoy the fireworks at 9pm without having to rush back to your hotel in the city late at night. then after you're done with day 2, head for the city and book a cheaper hotel (1/2 the price) in kowloon or HK island to continue exploring the city.

Reviews.Title: “Fantasy at a price...”
Reviews.Author: Josaiah
Reviews.Content: This is one fancy place. Go through an agenda and you will get this cheap. They give free lunch coupons for the park and free dinner in the hotel. Not provided individually. The agents have mass bookings so they get good discounts and hand it over.

Reviews.Title: “A stay at fantasy land!!”
Reviews.Author: midnight_merry
Reviews.Content: Its a must stay at Disneyland hotel. I went around new years and stayed at Disneyland resort hotel. I stayed on the day we visited Disneyland. But If one is going for one night stay, then I would suggest one to go and stay one day at the hotel and enjoy the hotel stay because check in time is 3 pm. and Check out is 11 am, so take a day off at the hotel and go to Disneyland in the Evening to see the fireworks at Sleeping Beauty castle. The next day visit Disneyland for the day until 5 - 6 pm and you can get back to Hong Kong post that. I am an Indian, so did not opt for buffet dinner, but I got nice room service and Indian food is available out there. It is very beautiful, I opted for garden view room. Outside disneyland hotel there is a mickey maze and sea view too. It is a good placeto spend evening by the sea. Apart from that Disneyland is a fantasy land, Kids have a blast there. Dinsey parade is a must see. Rooms and amenities are excellent. Recommended to all!!!

Reviews.Title: “Snow White and Ariel's Princess Holiday!”
Reviews.Author: MissAfternoonDelight
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with a group of 6 friends (3 guys, 3 gals) and had the most amazing time. We all absolutely loved it, even as adults without any kids. Amazing service, very clean and gorgeous views. Faultlessly delicious food in all the restaurants, and via room service. First class spa facilities. Perfectly captures the golden age of old fashioned hotel hospitality. What more could a traveller want? Stayed over Halloween and enjoyed the many festivities at the hotel and Park, that now we are going back for Chinese New Year festival. I can't wait! Don't hesitate, you will love it without a doubt. Rooms with sea view are beautiful, and worth the extra money.

Reviews.Title: “Dream Stay”
Reviews.Author: Helen h
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in April 2011 and weren't quite sure what to expect. We were blown away. Disneyland and Disneyland Hotel delivered our and our daughter's dreams to us on a silver platter. The pictures of the rooms on the promo don't look that great but they are actually really lovely and in April we could throw open the balcony doors to feel the mist from the sea which gave the place a real holiday feel. Everything is 'done' to a 'T' but somehow it just doesn't feel kitsch. The rooms are big - breakfast fantastic and the Disney characters all walk around the tables in the morning so take your camera. The hotel also has an amazing Chinese restaurant and the food and decor is also amazing. It's an easy shuttle to Disneyland itself and they hotel makes it all rather seamless. If you are going to Disneyland make the effort to stay here, it just completes the package.

Reviews.Title: “The”
Reviews.Author: Altitude66
Reviews.Content: The main purpose of this trip was to bring my 5-yr old niece to her 1st Disneyland experience. This hotel is the closest, thus, most convenient. The shuttles to and from the park were ubiquitous - wait was less than 5 minutes. The hotel was exquisite. The motif was Victorian - you wonder whether you are inside Sleeping Beauty's castle. The restaurants were fairly priced although there is a need for more variety of dishes. We were upgraded to the seaview rooms. The rooms were spacious and they were generous with the amenities. We got fresh slippers everyday. And there were characters roaming in the lobby ready to pose for pictures. Although hotels in the city would have been cheaper, the whole Disneyland experience was well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Stay for a total Disneyland Experience”
Reviews.Author: rugratsfc
Reviews.Content: My family and I went to HK for 5 days and 4 nights in December as my Christmas gift to them. We stayed the first 2 nights in Disneyland HK hotel. My decision was based on other traveller’s review saying that if you are going to stay in a hotel in Disneyland, it’s better to choose the Disneyland Hotel over the Hollywood Hotel even if it’s more expensive as the experience and the hotel is a lot better. If you are travelling with a big group of people, I suggest taking the taxi from the airport. There were 7 adults and 3 kids in our group, so we had to take 3 taxis. Each taxi ride costs ~HK$120 (A$15). It was convenient as we had a lot of luggage and cannot imagine using the MTR. We arrived around 12pm at the hotel. Since check in was still at 3pm, we checked in our luggage with the luggage counter initially. We were unfortunately not able to get a room early, and we had to wait for the first room to be ready at 1.30pm. To be fair, they at least made sure we had the 1st room of 3 rooms available as soon as possible so we can at least have a place to stay in/freshen up while we wait for the other rooms. However, that meant we still had to wait in the lobby for 1.5 hours before we can use the 1st room. The lobby itself was beautiful – as it was just days before Christmas, the decorations were very festive. However, there weren’t enough chairs/sofas for guests to sit down while we all waited for rooms to be available. I think there were 3 sets of sofas, and that is nowhere near enough to accommodate people who are tired and waiting for hours to get their room. When we finally got to our rooms, they were beautiful – and just like in the photos. Each of our 3 garden rooms on the first floor had two queen sized comfortable beds, and the patio doors open up to the garden and the Mickey Maze. The small touches such as the Mickey Mouse slippers (which come in adult and children sizes), the intricate carvings of Disney characters in the bedroom and in the toilet added up to the Disney experience. Each room can accommodate 4 people, so at A$320/room/night, it’s a good enough deal if there are 4 of you sharing in the costs. The convenience of the hotel cannot be overlooked as well, as there is a shuttle near the hotel lobby which takes you directly to the Disneyland Park. The shuttle comes by every 15min or so, and the actual ride takes about 5min. We had all our meals in the park, aside from breakfast. The hotel restaurants are pricier than the park restaurants/cafes, and so we made a conscious choice of eating our lunch and dinner at the park. A typical fastfood meal (we had most of our meals in Comet Cafe) cost between HK$50-80 (A$7-11). We had our first breakfast in the Enchanted Garden, and it is as lovely as all the reviews said. The cost for an adult is HK$283 (A$37) and for kids > 3 yrs old is HK$155 (A$20). The breakfast buffet selection is extensive – there is continental, American and asian selections. The Disney characters going around for photo opportunities around the tables was also priceless. I would recommend going to this breakfast at least once in your stay. Our second breakfast was in Walt’s cafe – and this is cheaper than the Enchanted Garden. The cost for an adult is HK$198 (A$26) and for a child is HK$98 (A$14). The menu however is not extensive – and this cost only included a buffet continental breakfast plus 2 eggs and a meat (bacon/ham/sausage) of your choice. If you are not a big breakfast eater, this is not a bad choice. The prices of the merchandise in the hotel/park are surprisingly reasonable. We bought souvenir t-shirts (~HK200 each), magnets (HK40-70), dancing toys (HK200) and other items. The quality of all the items was good – and most of them are actually cheaper than the same items in the Philippines and in Australia. Overall, I would recommend this hotel if your budget will allow it. For a big group like ours, it’s not cheap – we spent around HK$15,000 (A$2,000) for a 2 night stay in the hotel room, food cost for 2.5 days and 2 nights was around HK$7000 (A$920) for the food. Overall, we ended up spending around HK2,300 per person (A$290), for food and accommodation only, excluding the 2 day park entrance and miscellaneous expenses for souvenirs. It was however, an experience of a lifetime, specially if you have your whole family with you.

Reviews.Title: “Surprise every where in Roy O Suite!”
Reviews.Author: ok_xin
Reviews.Content: Our re-visit to Disneyland Hotel on Christmas Eve and Day make our holiday one of the most memorable one! We stayed in the Roy O Suite! (You cannot see the rate from any Disneyland Hotel website nor brochures. Call them directly to get the rate.) The entrance foyer, living and dining areas (with 6 seaters dining table, separate tiny kitchenette), guest toilet are about 1000 square feet large. The bedroom (come with super king size bed and if you have baby, compliementary baby cot can be set up for you upon request) and ensuite bathroom are another 1000 square feet large. Surprises are:- 1.) personal Christmas tree in your own living room!!! 2.) personal OSIM foot massager; 3.) personal twin jacuzzi bath tub; 4.) personal steam bath room in your bath room!!! 5.) Bulgari toileteries (and Disneyland Hotel seven dwarf toiletries) are used! 6.) towel folded christmas tree, reindeer, christmas wreaths, candy bars are placed any where in the suite and make my children screamed! It is the best suite in Disneyland seconder than Walt Disney Suite which has 2 bedrooms. The staff in the hotel will accommodate whatever you want. Staff were so polite and helpful. The Crystal Lotus restaurant attached to the hotel served very good food though it is more expensive than having same dishes else where in Kowloon or Hong Kong island. They had Golden Fish in the Pond special dish that so amazed us. We had our christmas eve dinner in the Enchanted Garden. The cost was high but it worth spending the money as they have Mickey, Minnie, Goofy and Pluto comes to you in Christmas suits and take photos with your family. Being on the club floor, we had the privilege to enter the club lounge on the 7th floor and to take photos with Minnie on pyjamas on Christmas eve and with Mickey on Chritmas night. My children were so happy... This is really a magical resort can make you happy everyday and surprised every moment. Highly recommended if you are planning for a luxury holiday for your family with young children, especially.

Reviews.Title: “Repeat stays”
Reviews.Author: readysuitcase
Reviews.Content: We always stay here when we go to HK due to our toddler. She loves the castle like ambiance the hotel has. We started staying here about 4 years back. The staff are friendly and very accommodating. During our first stay, my daughter was only 2.5 years and still a finicky eater. The hotel staff always accommodated our requests no matter how odd or outrageous it may have seemed. On our second stay, they recommended an upgrade us since our last visit was within the same year to the Kingdom club which made a big difference. There are lots of activities for toddlers and children of all ages, but specialized activities for the Kingdom Club residents. This time around we encountered booking issues due to it being peak season - Chinese New Year and all. The staff helped us relocate to a suite comparable to our earlier stays. They even apologized for the lack of a view. The buffet is always fresh and good. The hotel restaurants are always very well appointed with well trained staff. Overall, our family always looks forward to our trips and stays in HK Disney.

Reviews.Title: “went with lowered expectations, still disappointed”
Reviews.Author: nickt4
Reviews.Content: After reading dozens of reviews about this property, I understood the reason that I selected this hotel was solely for the benefit of my children (ages 2 & 3.5), hoping they would enjoy the special perks of staying at a Disney hotel. Still, the whole experience left us with, if not a bad taste, certainly a bland feeling of stupidly having spent several thousand dollars (US) to experience unabashed mediocrity. I really shouldn't complain too much because the Tripadvisor reviewers with perspective clearly told me what to expect so we definitely expected much less from Hong Kong than from our previous FL or CA Disney visits. I that sense, I guess our expectations were met. The room we were asigned was a two bedroom suite on the Kingdom Club 7th floor, in terms of cleanliness, it was excellent. However, you can see the difficulty the developer of this property (Gov.?) must have had in finding talented workers to build this place, as evidenced by the really poor build quality of everything from the door hinges to the caulking on the bathroom fixtures (heard of a "level" anyone?). But anyhow, not terrible, just sorta sad when it comes to attention to details. At night they offered "bedtime story" telling at the Kingdom Club room, 8pm in Cantones, 8:20pm English, 8:40pm Mandarin. The staff member who told the story in English was ok, but I imagine she is much more fluent and entertaining in the other languages. The food was ok, nothing imaginative or remarkable, the people at the character breakfast were so pushy with the characters that I think it stressed Mickey out and he never came by our table, so after 90 minutes with two toddlers patiently waiting (not really), we finally left with the kids heads hung low because Mickey bailed on us or chose to skip out on our table, who knows. Oh well, they'll get over it. I would say our biggest disappointment was with the kids main playroom downstairs, IMHO, what a disservice this room is toward representing the values of the Disney brand. If I were paranoid, I would say it was almost like a outright effort was being made to sabotage the Disney brand by placing it in this sorry excuse for a playroom in a hotel that is supposedly focused on the kids experience. How important should the playroom be in a hotel that caters to kids? The nearly bare walls, almost no games for the kids, and a confused looking worker with a clipboard who added nothing except making sure you disinfect your hands before you enter this misguided interpretation of a playroom. My wife insisted we take pictures of this "playroom" and share them, because unlike other disappointment we endured (and mostly laughed off ) during our visit, this was something that could have been easily addessed if someone at the executive level at Disney Corporate takes a walk into this supposed playroom. Neither of us could not believe that anyone at the top of Disney would be able to rationalize this "experience" and allow the pervasive brand mismanagement to continue without doing something about it. I explain the whole experience, including nasty, angry looking "cast" members at the park, as a cultural chasm that originates with the fact that most employees here have no clue as to what it means to visit Disney as guests...the magic is an intangible, elusive concept to the natives here, and I believe it will take intensive training and retraining and re re retraining before a culture of excelence can be created at this property as well as the park. I wish Disney the best and hope they can eventually get their house in order at the Hong Kong location.

Reviews.Title: “Quality Stay close to Disneyland”
Reviews.Author: David E
Reviews.Content: The hotel was well appointed and had all the details you hope from a Disney hotel. Beautiful surrounds and great gardens. I was travelling with our 4 year old daughter and this was a great option for the 3 nights we stayed. A taxi is the best option to get from the Airport to the hotel especially with luggage and after a long flight. The hotel staff are warm and friendly and I was quickly checked in and set for the evening. The rooms are a little small, but the views from the rear over the gardens and the water were fantastic. There are heaps of details for the kids, - Seven Dwarfs toiletries, slippers and bath robes for little kids. Outdoors there is a good pool and waterslide as well as a hedge maze which kept the daughter amused between visits to the park. The food was also really good but generally a little expensive. The Chinese restaurant was very high quality and good value for Yum Cha. For the very keen you should book ahead for the Disney Character breakfast or dinner. The proximity to the park and free shuttle service means you can go back and forth a few times a day to allow for little people (and yourselves) to have some rest. Overall I thought this was a very good stay and the family enjoyed the stay.

Reviews.Title: “great location - interesting service”
Reviews.Author: KARIAN136
Reviews.Content: great room and negotiating online for the best pass for Disneyland interesting. On check in we were taken to the Club lounge and between interruptions of other guests, phone ringing and a translator made for our frustion of the many passes being offered and the signing of paper work a real treat for us over an 10 hour + flight from australia - recommendation would be to ensure you get a one on one with guest services agent. Would not recommend the main restaurant downstairs as chicken was raw. Club lounge was lovely and they need to be mindful of not to be over bearing on their presence with guests. Very rude conceige desk and needed to wait for over 45 minutes for luggage from room.

Reviews.Title: “Kingdom Club a sensation”
Reviews.Author: tonymerricks
Reviews.Content: We just spent 3 nights at HK Disneyland hotel, up on the Kingdom Club floor (level 7). It is a wonderful place to stay for a family with small kids. The highlight for us was standing on the Kingdom Club balcony watching the nightly fireworks show.....with our boys in their pajamas....and with the music from the park piped in so that everyone got the complete experience. After the fireworks and some arts n crafts, hotel staff read the kids a bedtime story before Minnie or Mickey, dressed in pjs, came in to say goodnight. KC offers a great breakfast, sweets and fruit throughout the day, savouries from 6pm to 8pm (small morals, but nearly everyone turned them into dinner!) and the more sweets n fruit from 8pm on. It is well worth the extra money.

Reviews.Title: “Stay at Hong Kong Disney”
Reviews.Author: Chee Beng C
Reviews.Content: I was allocated a room at the ground floor and there are scaffolding judt outside my room. The room is small but is hotel is well decoraded with a maze in the garden whereby my kids enjoyed a lot. A good hotel with nice surrounding in the hall and garden but small room and normal service with expensive food.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but should change check in time”
Reviews.Author: outintheair
Reviews.Content: Plus points: Next to Disneyland, nice large beds, well lighted rooms, friendly staff. Negatives: Pricey + Check in time of 3 pm: Especially for visitors from India who arrive in morning flights, this is very inconvenient- especially with the kids.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible”
Reviews.Author: ar r
Reviews.Content: Unwelcoming management. Staff doesn't smile at all. strong accent. Suspicious looks. I felt uncomfortable. Terrible customer service. There is no disney magic expect for Mikey's voice in elevators. Beware of exorbitant food prices. no breakfast buffet. Chipped toilets. It's a let down.

Reviews.Title: “Good for adults, not the best for kids.”
Reviews.Author: joshmarston
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights and it was nice, luxurious but too pricey. The decor is like any ordinary hotel, serious. We have no complaint though. Then we moved to Disney Hollywood hotel, and my kids loved it because of the room decor that is colorful, playful, and kiddy like.

Reviews.Title: “horrible customer service”
Reviews.Author: rt a
Reviews.Content: As a frequent traveler , I have experience amazing hospitality industry throughout the world but this hotel & staff disaapointed us.The corridors smell filthy. Staff is arrogant and lacks ethics when dealing with guests. There is barely any room for lobby and whatever little sofa they have in there , they kick the guests out of there since sofa can be used by resautant guests only. No hotel ever converts a lobby into a restaurant and kicks out it's guests but this resort does it. Long hours of wait before they give you rooms. I booked an upgraded room I receievd a bank wall slapped on my room window facing commercial exhaust fans releasing smoke.

Reviews.Title: “Charming”
Reviews.Author: Ruthie L
Reviews.Content: Although being a native to hong kong myself, I've stayed at this hotel more than three times. It is a charming place to stay, and the magic of disney is always there. Without being totally upfront and in your face, it keeps true to this "victorian" theme while adding accents of disney, which make is suitable to all ages. The buffet at dinner time is very varied (i'm generally found by the two chocolate fountains) and the food is generally very good. The first time we stayed, the service at the front desk was very slow, but i'm pleased to say that it has improved within the last 3 years. It is pricey- but your children will thank you! One word of advice- don't be ashamed to stay at a "disney kids hotel" people, this one is classy!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place for kids”
Reviews.Author: Kiansoon
Reviews.Content: It was my second visit to Disneyland Hongkong and I must say that the park was very well-managed. The quality and the professionalism of the staffs are maintained throughout their hotels, park and every single working person thereat. Although the park is rather small, I bought a two day pass to allow my 4 year old and 7 year old to fully enjoy themselves. Truthfully, a day is sufficient to explore the park, however I just can't get tired of the Disney magic that is prevalent in every corner of the park. I did not mind taking some of the rides twice. Having the two day pass also means that you can skip the parade (if you already watched it on the first day), and go for the popular rides where there are no people in queue during that time.

Reviews.Title: “Hong Kong Disneyland Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Anatomywoo
Reviews.Content: 2D1N family vacation, stayed in Kingdom Suite. Decoration in the room was Christmas - there was a Christmas tree in the room. Room service request was prompt. Food in Kingdom Club was good. Timing for the coming of Minnie (at night) and Princess (in the morning) was good. Food order within Kingdom club was value for money. The only not-so-good thing that I can think of is the balcony outside Kingdom Club where you are suppose to watch the fireworks display. The view was not very pleasant with the "cranes" around and you can only see the fireworks when they are "fire" high-up.

Reviews.Title: “Dec hotel stay at Disneyland Hotel HK”
Reviews.Author: Joyce L
Reviews.Content: Had a great 4 nights stay at the Disneyland Hotel HK. Stayed at the Kingdom Club room which was great. Beautiful decor and surroundings, spacious room and beds. The kids love the Kingdom club which was exclusive to those staying at the Kingdom Club rooms and suites. Free food, drinks, milk for kids, wifi and activities for kids. While the kids were entertained, parents could relax with a drink, read a magazine or surf the net with the free wifi. Service staff were also well trained, efficient and polite. We were able to watch the fireworks every night from the balcony of the kingdom club and the kids enjoyed it very much. Also loved the bedtime stories and having mickey/minnie mouse coming out in pjs to say goodnight to the kids. Princesses also come round in the morning after breakfast. Rooms are expensive but well worth the money. Certainly recommend the kingdom club rooms especially if you are travelling with small children. Cons : Expensive food at the restaurants in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Disneyland Hotel (Hong Kong)”
Reviews.Author: Teolido
Reviews.Content: Disneyland Hong Kong has two hotels, one called Hollywood Hotel and another called Disneyland Hotel. I've stayed at the Hollywood Hotel previously when on a tour. It seems to be full of tourist groups and was crowded. In a more recent trip, my family of 4 stayed at Disneyland Hotel. It seems a lot more quieter and peaceful. Facility wise, both seemed about the same. They had free wireless in the lobby. Internet access in the room was available but only at a hefty fee. The two twin beds in the room were comfortable and big enough for my family of four. Transportation at Disneyland was well covered. There is a free shuttle that ran regularly, going in a circuit to cover both hotels and the main transit station (where DIsneyland entrance is, and the Disneyland MTR train station). The Disneyland MTR line operates only one stop and connects to the rest of the MTR lines from there. One would probably have to cater 15-30 min to get from the hotel lobby to the connecting MTR lines. We travelled all over Hong Kong on the MTR. Having the Octopus cards (for buses, MTRs, tram at The Peak) made travelling a breeze. One mistake I made was not getting the Octopus cards refunded before I crossed through immigration to depart. There isn't an outlet after immigration to do so! Sigh. The Disney character breakfast at the hotel is a must! Book with the front desk. The stars of Disney, namely Mickey, Goofy, Pluto, and Daisy went around each table. Pluto was particularly playful and interactive. It was a most fun event for my family! I wish though that they had a more substantive shopping and dining belt across the hotels. Much like what is seen at their Orlando locale. Disneyland is pretty much on its own on Lantau Island. Of course, there's always the CityWalk Factory Outlets at Tung Chung MTR, as well as the Big Buddha (also at Tung Chung MTR).

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed my stay, very convenient to HKDL”
Reviews.Author: J_from_NY
Reviews.Content: I recently spent 10 days at the HK Disneyland Hotel on business for Disney (totally being upfront here - I do not work for Hong Kong Disneyland however). Perhaps since I do this for a living I might be a bit jaded, but I found my stay at the Hong Kong Disneyland Hotel to be very nice, with friendly and helpful staff and generally good amenities. I would stay here again (and probably will be coming back sooner than I think!). The Service: I found the service at the front desk to be efficient and friendly, and did not have any wait at check-in (we arrived around 8 p.m. at night). On weekends, things definitely picked up in terms of the number of people in the hotel lobby, so there was a queue waiting to be checked in. We stayed in the Kingdom Club rooms, which was great. With Kingdom Club you get the breakfast buffet and drinks/desserts in the afternoon/early evening just before the fireworks go off. This was a much-appreciated amenity - the chance to check email (via free wifi) while having a glass of wine in the evening. Service in the Kingdom Club was well-done, and Yvonne in particular was very helpful - she located my missing scarf that I had left in Walt's Cafe the day before. The Room: Really liked the room, and that's important since I was there for 10 days! Room had two double beds, as well as a table/desk and two chairs. The bathroom was great - loved the rainfall shower head and the fact that you got a fair amount of toiletries (shampoo, conditioner, bath gel, shaving kit, sewing kit, toothbrush/toothpaste...). Since I had forgotten to pack my razor, that shaving kit came in handy. The rooms come with a hair dryer, and if you need a converter plug, you can get one from the front desk. There is a coffee/tea pot in the room as well as a stocked small fridge (stocked with soda/candy). If you need your fix of strong coffee, I suggest you bring your own Starbucks Via, because they only have the Nescafe instant coffee here (ugh!). Internet Access: As has been noted by other reviewers, you have to pay for in-room internet access (via cable connection), otherwise you can pick up the free wifi in the lobby and Kingdom Club. This is one area where things could be improved - because of this, people sit around the lobby, checking email on their laptops/IPhones. In fact, it was problematic because there was limited to no lobby seating at times because of excess wifi users :-)! Short of getting in-room free wifi, I would recommend setting aside some area as a 'wifi lounge' where folks can do their business, print out boarding passes, etc. The Food: We ate at two places in the Disneyland Hotel - Walt's Cafe and the Crystal Lotus. The Crystal Lotus is Chinese cuisine, and was excellent in quality. We got the full dinner option, which ended up being way too much food. Ate several times at Walt's Cafe, which is a mix of asian and western cuisines. Generally liked all the food I had at Walt's in terms of quality. Service here was mixed - sometimes it was great (Anny in particular was a fantastic server and had real Disney pixie dust), other times it was disjointed. You would ask for a beer, and then...you would end up waiting...make another request...you get the picture. Did not know if this was a cultural thing (serving the beverage with the food) or not. Overall: I really liked staying at the Disneyland Hotel, and would come back in the future for a leisure trip to HKDL.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing, would definitely return”
Reviews.Author: Fiona A
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful if brief, 2 night stay in this hotel. Having previously stayed in Disney hotels in Florida we found that this hotel did not let us down. Thoughtful design is in everything, even down to the toiletries being 7 dwarf themed. Our room was on a corner and was large, had a lovely view of the bay and we did not hear anyone else at all - it felt like our own corner of Disney. We ate in Walts Cafe, very lovely, food was tasty and ample portions, the set lunch with buffet starter/dessert was good value for money. We would go back for sure, recommend for families, easy shuttle to park every 20 mins or so, not far from the airport - would consider staying here too if you wanted to get the MRT into Hong Kong since its close enough without the busy hustle bustle of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Disney Touches Everywhere”
Reviews.Author: WinnieP
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights here. And as my husband says, you get what you pay for. Right when I started making reservations months ago, service has been excellent, with reservations staff advising me what to do, and trying to get offers and deals for me, plus make arrangements for a birthday celebration for my kids. The hotel isn't cheap, but it is convenient and front desk service was great. While waiting for check in, there is even a small TV room nearby to keep little kids entertained while parents complete the check in...talk about customer centric....they know their clientele all right! :) We booked 2 rooms, requested for them to be next to each other and got what we asked for. We even had a free upgrade to a larger room size for one of our rooms (without us asking for it) which we were truely grateful for as we were a party of 4 adults and 2 kids. THe rooms were nicely done, spacious, clean, disney theme everywhere. Kids were thrilled with bathrooms and slippers in THEIR SIZE. :) We even had a jacuzzi tub! Only thing missing perhaps was a microwave but it's a small issue. THe shuttle bus is frequent and picks up and drops off from this hotel first before going to the Hollywood hotel. THe only Character dining restaurant is in this Hotel. So if you have kids and want to do character meals, this is the hotel to go to. There are 2 sittings for breakfast, 7.30 and 9.30am. Best to go to the 7.30 am one. I saw many people waiting outside at around 8.30 for the 9.30 sitting. That's no fun. Plus, parks open 10am, so you want to catch the 9.30 shuttle. THe gardens were lovely, kids had fun in the maze. View of the ocean lovely too. THe hotel was decorated in Christmas Theme when we were there and it was lovely! THere was also free activity for kids throughout the day in the activity room. Free wifi in hotel lobby. THey also let us use the business centre for free to do online check in for our flight. Expensive, but worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service and Very Enjoyable Stay”
Reviews.Author: BlueLan
Reviews.Content: Everyone in my travel party enjoyed their stay tremendously -- from the young (my kids) to the young-at-heart (my parents). The rooms were clean, well-appointed, and of good size. Small details like the child-sized bedroom slippers certainly made the stay special. We made the booking by calling the hotel, and was advised that a garden view was sufficient since we would be out most of the day. He was right! The room faced the garden maze, which itself was a lot of fun for the kids. Getting to the hotel from the airport was inexpensive and convenient with taxi (it's cheaper taking the green N.T. taxi). Don't forget to have breakfast at the Enchanted Gardens (there's a discount for hotel guests), and have the Disney characters (Mickey, Daisy, Goofy and Pluto) come to your table for photo-taking! The shuttle service to Disneyland is efficient and speedy, but I did wish that the hotel could have been located right next to Disneyland. I guess we can't have everything!

Reviews.Title: “whimsical”
Reviews.Author: Memphis K
Reviews.Content: magical, classy, clean, love the garden maze, huge park, can access to coastline pathway n walk to jetty. breakfast fantastic...is kid's fantasy, but i think adult enjoy it too.. they had a good landscaping, with great plants, flowers to whelm u.

Reviews.Title: “i'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: Cannie G
Reviews.Content: its a very family orientated hotel.even the basic rooms sleeps up to 4 adults.i arranged for their airport transfer (though u can easily get to the hotel fr the airport via their MRT)...its only 15 mins away fr the airport.they allow up to 4 adults in their Mercedes (other hotels max 2-3),price issuper reasonable...usually the driver will wait for you AFTER u cleared immigration outside the arrival gate but this one,they have somebody waiting for u the moment u touch down,right at the air bridge!! every single detail taken care of,from clearing the immigration,collecting your luggages...so frus not if u r new to that airport...the moment u reach the hotel,u r brought straight to your room...chk in done in the room,they even help u wif the park tics n booking for breakfast.Do book early for breakfast,abit ex but worthwhile,with the Disney characters running ard the cafe to take pics with u! overall service-FIRST CLASS! i'LL DEFINITELY BE BACK:)

Reviews.Title: “Expensive Everything”
Reviews.Author: M_Pranolo
Reviews.Content: I have no complaint whatsoever on the level of expectation I would put on a disney hotel. They have done great job in making the hotel up to the standard where everything is all about disney and its character. They have soap boxes in characters etc..etc. Negatives: All things are expensive...not worthwhile expensive...but just expensive. However, this is a disney resort. So, I wouldnt say that other people would think the same. Staffs at the cafe should have done better in servicing customers. I was having a porridge one day for our daughter. Both our wife and I was sitting there since we want to save HKD22 for a plain water, we opt just to seat there. Nobody offered us any drink (either they think we are too cheap to pay or it's just pure ignorance) Staffs at the check-in counter is not as friendly as the one you can find in other 5 star hotels. For those of you who wants better room, better rate, better food, I would suggest staying at Citygate. 10 minutes from Disneyland with HKD100 taxy fare to Disneyland, I would think that you better spend HKD100 on taxy rather than stuck in the resort and having to pay much more for dinners and lunches. Room interior: I find it just an OK room without any special feature other than part where disney characters can be found inside the room (etc on the carpet) Lobby Area: Love it....such big nice christmas tree. A couple of notes: - Free internet only when you go to the lobby area. Internet in your room means extra money. - All bed are twin bed (2 bed). There is no way they can provide yuou a king or queen bad

Reviews.Title: “Complete your Disneyland experience!”
Reviews.Author: gumbokins
Reviews.Content: I booked the hotel + 2 day passes promotion via their website for my family (2 adults, 2 kids - 4 and 1 yrs old). Currently there is a promotion for breakfast at the Enchanted Garden if you make your reservations online via their website. We headed to Disneyland on Day 1 of our HK trip and arrived at the hotel around 1.30 PM. Our bags were swiftly taken away by the porters at the foyer, and after completing the check-in process, was told to come back at 3PM to collect the room key. There was a lovely Xmas tree and a large gingerbread house in the lobby, it smelt so nice! There are some cafes at the lobby where you can sit to have a cuppa or you could eat lunch at the Chinese restaurant while waiting for your room to be ready. (Tip for Muslim travellers: either eat or pack Popeyes from the airport to bring to the hotel) We were quite tired so we rested the lobby for a bit, finishing our lunch. Next to the reception, there is a small TV room for the little ones to watch Disney Junior. A hidden gem is the Prince Eric room on Level 1 where your kids can do some crafts, or play with the toys...it was empty when we went there, even though there was so many kids running around in the lobby. It is free to enter the room (just show your room card) and they have scheduled craft sessions as well for a small fee. My girl was given a small set of colour pencils after she completed her colouring. There are also some small wooden toys (stackers, blocks, bead chasers) for the younger ones. The minders in the room will play with/look after your kids but an adult has to be present but you can always doze off on the comfy couches there while your kids play :) Next to the Prince Eric room is the Princess Makeover room. It is open on weekends and for a tidy sum, you can get your girl all Princessed-out and have their photo taken. I was there on a weekday, so it was closed but I was told you could approach Kingdom Gifts (the gift store at level 3) to make an appointment. There is a shuttle bus that takes you to the park, comes every 10-15 minutes. The bus also stops by Hollywood hotel, so you can drop off there to take a look. The Disney Princesses make an appearance at the hotel lobby as well, I really have to take my hats off to them because Snow White and Aurora stayed in character, took the time to make small talk with the kids, one girl even brought an autograph book that they gamely signed in. Check for the timings with the concierge desk. The room - We got the Fantasia room, which was a turret room with a view of the lawn and the sea. The room was large, beautiful, clean and comfortable. There was a jacuzzi in the bathroom, and a rain shower, very nice after a day out at the park. The room came with a king bed, and I requested for a baby cot but was so tired at the end of the day that all 4 of us slept on the bed together. The service - prompt, polite, helpful. I asked for late check out and they extended it to 12 nn (from 11am, but hey). Since we had a two day pass, after checking out, they stored our bags and we hit the park. When we left Disneyland to go into the city for the rest of our holiday, the staff helped us with the cab and bags and waved us off! So nice :) If I could do this all over again, I would have opted for a cheaper room but stayed 2 nights instead so that we would not have to rush off after the second day at the park. Yes, a Disneyland experience does not come cheap, but you get really caught up in the moment and things like credit card bills are forgotten :D Some minor grouses was they had a lot of things for girls, but not so much for boys. Also, their tshirt sizes are for 2 yrs and above? There was a very small selection of babywear, suitable for maybe under 6 months.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay - Kingdom Club worth the extra”
Reviews.Author: 11sjw
Reviews.Content: I read some tips through TA so I'll reiterate them: 1. Book a Kingdom Club Room: More relaxed breakfast. Great for watching the fireworks each night (lounge balcony). The Princesses pass through the lounge first each day with many less children they each got to spend more time with them. The complimentary appertifs each evening were enough to fill us. The story time and goodnight from Mickey or Minnie were eagerly anticipated by our child. 2. Buy a Platinum Annual Pass for at least one of you: The discounts on food and accommodation means it will more than pay for itself. If you're celebrating a child's birthday the pass provides extra benefits including a free cake and dinner in the buffet restaurant (Enchanted Garden). Provides fast passes for up to 3 people for the selected rides. We did all of the above during our 3 night stay and we experienced some great service, especially from the Kingdom Lounge staff. Double beds are generally too small for us (I'm 6'2") however we generally managed to sleep ok. The room amenities were great, right down to the differing robe sizes for each of us. I used both pools and they were great. The Highlight for us was being made Grand Marshals of the daily parade!! :-) This was our 2nd stay here and the added expense of the Kingdom Club and Platinum Pass made the hotel stay and going to the park much more enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing for Kids but Mentally Prepare Yourself for the Crowds and All the Extra $$$ You'll Be Shelling Out”
Reviews.Author: LittleEinNY
Reviews.Content: We are a HK-based family (2 adults, one toddler) and decided to stay at the Disneyland Hotel on a Saturday night for a mini weekend getaway. We stayed in a Fantasia Room. Pros: - Amazing for children. The room has child-size robes and slippers and a little step stool that can be used in the bathroom or by the window. At the check-in, there is a small area with stools and a TV playing cartoons for the kids. Staff are all very friendly and attentive to children. - Great bathtub with jacuzzi jets. - You can't beat this location if you are going to Disneyland. - The Chinese restaruant (Crystal Lotus) is quite good but expensive for what it is. - The Theme Breakfast at the Garden Terrace Restaurant is a must-do. It's pretty average breakfast buffet but the Disney characters show up during the breakfast to greet the diners. This was definitely worth the ~300HKD per head because the characters were there for a full hour and gave everyone plenty of time to take pictures and "chat" with the kids. Each character walked around with a helper who was very eager to help snap family photos. Cons: - Service is sub par. We had booked (and confirmed) a king size room and when we checked in (at the check-in time of 3PM nonetheless!) we were told that they only had rooms with 2 double beds or rooms with one double bed and a sofa bed available. Otherwise, we could pay an additional 500HKD to upgrade to the Fantasia Room with a king bed. I mean, seriously?! Not wanting to start the weekend on a sour note, we just ended up sucking up the 500HKD and upgrading. I would have given this hotel a 4-rating if we had not had this experience at check-in. - Service is sub par. I had called in advance to request a crib and we had to ask 2 times before it was actually delivered. - Service is sub par. When we checked in to our room, we were so pleased to find that the hotel had treated us to complimentary champagne, cookies and flowers....only to find that the note card was adressed to some other guests. We drank the champagne, ate the cookies and took the flowers anyway. - The room is not small but I would categorize it as being only moderately sized. - Only one sink in the bathroom. - No booze in the minibar. - The entire decor of the hotel is kitchy. - Crowds. Crowds. Crowds. Everywhere. - The room rate is expensive. Tips: - I think the rooms facing the garden/water are nicer but you can't see the fireworks from this side of the hotel. However, there is a balcony (on the 5th or 6th floor) where you can go to see the fireworks. - Definitely book the Theme Breakfast in advance. They do 2 seatings, one at 730AM, the other at 9AM. We did the 730AM seating on a Sunday since the 9AM was fully booked (and I called 5 days in advance). The 730AM seating didn't seem to be full when we went and the Disney characters were there from 8AM-9AM. - Book your room early.

Reviews.Title: “Excellence + Relax”
Reviews.Author: D_R_ABishop
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights in Seaview Balcony room. Very good size room with balcony - more room for our 2.5-yr old girl moving around. Hotel is excellent, room is spotless clean, quiet and comfortable. Walking distance to Disneyland through beautifully landscaped pathway. Great way to take a break from busy Disneyland. We had a wonderful time staying in this hotel. The breakfast is great with disney characters coming to visit the kids. We will certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “perfect”
Reviews.Author: andyrduggins
Reviews.Content: i took my family here for my sons 5th birthday and totally loved it ,as a hotel owner myself in thailand it was great to sit back and enjoy watching my son have the magical experience that it disney world , i have been once before to the one in florida but wasnt that impressed but hk dl blew me away ,ok so its a little expensive but what the heck...its not that expensive compared to the other hotels in hk ,a truly magical experience for the whole family.....big up to the creators of this truly magnificent masterpiece of fantasy

Reviews.Title: “Where Micky stays in...”
Reviews.Author: Saket D
Reviews.Content: Truely momorable family experience....Right from check-in to our departure. My 7 year son liked like anything. Nice rooms, well mannered staff. This is a hotel especially built for childern. A Bed time story telling for children. My son slept with dreams of Micky Mouse. Delicious breakfast with disney characters. A best gift you can ever give to your child. A beautiful emotional experience. Will visit again....

Reviews.Title: “Best Disney hotel worldwide”
Reviews.Author: byswiss
Reviews.Content: I stayed 1 night at the Hong Kong Disneyland Hotel. This was my 10th Disney hotel over all Disney parks around the world (California, Florida, Paris, Tokyo and Hong Kong) and this is by far the best Disney hotel I have ever slept in. While externally the Hotel is similar to the Grand Floridian in Orlando and the Paris Disneyland Hotel - inside it is certainly a little darker and less pink, picky dusty and more in line with the new Tokyo Disneyland Hotel. Disney plays very successfully with Hong Kong's former British heritage what is reflected in the decoration and look'n'feel of the property. A true highlight is obviously the sea view form the lobby and the rooms: a Disney unique in Hong Kong. We did reserve a Kingdom Club floor room - so check-in was held in the club lounge. Traditional Disney check-in: hotel information, character breakfast, parks and parades: everything you need to know. The Kingdom Club lounge is a nice little salon that features drinks and snacks and hot petits fours in the afternoon with some wine. You can see the park's fireworks from a little balcony with the music in synch - yet we did not test this so I cannot comment if its really worth it. There is free wifi inside the lounge (only). Room was a standard Kingdom Club room with sea view. It was very big and certainly the most luxurious I have seen in any Disney hotel. Decoration is again influenced from colonial chic, mixed with Disney and Victorian charms giving the room an almost historic appeal. Everything about this room is above Disney average: from the little make-up table to the Chinese porcelain decoration on the walls. It keeps getting better in the bathroom: big walk-in shower, tub and all pink marble. The parks and railway station are located withing 10min walking distance - alternatively there is a shuttle service. We did not test any of the hotel's leisure facilities like the spa, pools or the gardens. I cannot repeat myself enough praising this hotel - it is a truly remarkable property and certainly Disney at it's best : I would definitely stay here again and recommend this hotel. It is also good value for money compared to what you pay for 5* properties in other Disney resorts. +Value +Decoration and look'n'feel +Rooms +Kingdom Club lounge -no park view -no free wifi

Reviews.Title: “Priceless!”
Reviews.Author: misisbuccat
Reviews.Content: From booking to check out, everything is Disney. The Victorian inspired hotel interiors is fabulous. Simple yet very elegant. The high ceiling was accented by a huge crystal chandelier. The large windows have a view of the sea and the garden maze. Beside the hotel's reception is an open space dedicated for children for watching TV. You can also check the hotel's lobby for the list of family activities during the day. We booked standard rooms. The rooms were also simple yet elegant. Clean, fresh, and smelled nice. The bathroom are pretty much bigger than the ones on Hollywood's. Toiletries were really cute and full stocked of big towels! The phone has Disney books installed that you can use for storytelling. The cabinet offered room slippers and bathrobes for the entire family. Great! I also ask the hotel if they can reserve a cake for my daughter's birthday. And they said yes. After the kids trick or treat at the Park, we went back to the hotel room and to our surprise, the cake was already set up inside the room with red loot bag and a balloon. Fun! If you are planning to go to HKDL with your family, I recommend you stay at least a night at this hotel. It may be a little expensive but the memories are priceless. Just plan ahead.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive but worth it.”
Reviews.Author: jimbob_uk
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights after arriving late at the airport. Check in was fairly painless and efficient, not so much evidence of the "fun" you get in the US Disney, but maybe it was just because it was late. The garden view room is spacious with two queen beds and actually a sea view. I was expecting the room to be more special than it was, it was pretty much just a room, but it was comfortable and clean. We paid for a character breakfast which was well received by my 4 year old daughter - the food was pretty good too, it should be though for the price. We didn't eat any other meals in the hotel as we were in the park all day until after the fireworks. Shuttle works pretty well, no queues at either end really, only takes 10 minutes to the park, or a couple of minutes to Hollywood hotel. Free Wifi in the lobby, or pay 120HKD for wired internet in the room - not sure why hotels insist on making their guests walk to the lobby for internet... I guess really the only useful comparison is with Disney Hollywood hotel, which I can't help with. We were in the hotel so little we probably could have saved some money and gone for the Hollywood, but we had a good time - and in the total expense of the holiday, the difference in price isn't that significant.

Reviews.Title: “Magic, Fantastic, Fun...”
Reviews.Author: HappyFamilyDoha
Reviews.Content: We were a little afraid, as this is really a big hotel..and we thinked when crossing the door tha maybe we should have choice something smaller, but since the first contavt with the staff (actually the guys in charge of the luggage) we knew that our week-end will be fantastic.. We arrived early at hotel (10am), and have been told that our rooms will only be ready around 3pm. but we were given our park entries and told also that we could enjoy all hotel facilities as normal guest (we were given an hotel Id card)..so we got to he park, but around 1pm as the ay was really hot we decided to go back to have a snack on the swimming pool bar, we used the changing rooms and were given a locker to stuff our clothes, then we had a lunch and used the hotel id card mentionned earlier, around 3.30 pm we got back to reception and got our key. Again all staff was really kind and nice. At night we decided to have some shopping, we gone to the CITY GATE OUTLETS (costs 100HKD by taxi and takes less than 10 minuts) we had dinner there (plenty of choice for dinner) Next morning we started with a muss do..the breakfast at ENCHANTED GARDEN.. And really ..even expensive, really deserves the price..food was great and having bkf with Mickey, Pluto, Goofy... is something my son will never forget...After bkf we did the check-out gave our luggage to the staff and gone to park..and enjoyed the rest of day...at 7 pm come back get our lugagge and geon eyo HKG..

Reviews.Title: “Fun stay but expensive food”
Reviews.Author: MyBoyBlu
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night with my wife and 4 year old son, who had visited the park while I had business meeting in downtown Hong Kong. Booked a standard room but got upgraded to Suite, which was large and comfortable with separate living room and two bathrooms. Obviously, it was great to be upgraded, but we were facing the garden and I would recommend a sea facing view if you can. The decor is very clean but feels slightly dated. The hotel has lots of Disney touches, such as Disney branded bathroom toiletries, and Disney characters taking pictures with the children at breakfast. All lots of fun and my 4 year old son loved running around the maze behind the hotel. Only complaint would be you can really hear any noise in the corridor from the room - not well soundproofed. Also, the food is extremely expensive. We were tired and ordered room service, which was a poor menu and around twice the price you would usually expect to pay for similar items in another hotel. The hotel is isolated and it's not easy to travel to eat somewhere else: they are obviously taking advantage of this fact with the food prices. Anyway - my son enjoyed the park, and this hotel is conveniently located to crash at the end of the day. The airport is only around 20 minutes away and very easy to get a taxi.

Reviews.Title: “Magically spoiled”
Reviews.Author: Leighyoung1963
Reviews.Content: My wife recently won a trip for two to this magical hotel, during our stay we felt like royalty, however, my only complaint is that although we had communicated with he hotel continuously regarding additional guests staying in the room with us we were advised there would be no charge, until we arrived and discovered we had to pay for the two porta beds, an unplanned expense we could have done without. Overall I still rate this hotel as one of the best I have ver stayed in and I thank Disneyland Hong Kong for the pleasure of staying there, next time we travel to Hong Kong we intend to stay there again and will happily pay for a suite on the kingdom club floor.

Reviews.Title: “VERY GOOD”
Reviews.Author: VIBHUTIANAND
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my family for 1 night in a sea view room. It is a good hotel.I recomend to others specially for kids. Food is good and this hotel is very spacious. Specially round trip service for Disneyland park is complimentary for all throught the day.

Reviews.Title: “Truly enjoyed the Kingdom Club experience”
Reviews.Author: Proudnewparents
Reviews.Content: We had an enjoyable 2 night stay at the Kingdom club room. The best part was probably enjoying the access to the comfortable club lounge. Service was excellent at the Kingdom club lounge with cookies, warm milk, drinks and tasty appetisers served most of the day. You can watch the fireworks from the lounge balcony at 7pm. Starting at about 8pm, staff will engage the children in some art activities and a story will be read the children in English, Mandarin and Cantonese. At about 8.45pm, either Mickey or Minnie comes out in pyjamas and the children get to hug and take pictures with the character. This certainly beats queuing for 30 minutes for character photo taking at disneyland! Breakfast comes with the Kingdome club room and it's served in the lounge. The hotel has a very classic and timeless decor. My only complaint was that the plumbing was very noisy - we could hear it everytime the bath/ shower was running next door. So you have to pray for neighbours who don't decide to have a bath after midnight.

Reviews.Title: “Magical Stay”
Reviews.Author: ToddlerTales
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights at the Disneyland Hotel in October, travelling as a party of 3 adults and 1 5yr old child. I had prebooked months before and was thrilled to discover that my request for connecting rooms had been met. The hotel is stunning. Grounds immaculate and the rooms were very well maintained and spotlessly clean. Little touches like the Mickey robe and slippers for adults and children were appreciated. The pool area (complete with slide) were lovely and we commented that it would've been nice to have had a few extra days to just relax by it.Very resort like atmosphere. We had lunch at the pool cafe and it was a lovely meal. The character breakfast at the Enchanted Garden was a highlight of our stay and it put us all in the right mood to head off to the park. Yes, it is expensive but it means that you do not have to que up once inside Disneyland to have photos taken - big plus. We had dinner twice in the Crystal Lotus and the food and service were very good. Our waiter Desmond was a delight and very knowledgable on the menu and wine list. The Peking Duck in particular was delicious. On the other night, exhausted after a very big day in Disneyland we had room service - they offer a childrens menu which was very tasty and healthy and our meals were impressive as well. The night we had room service we went back to the Crystal Lotus and it was no problem at all to purchase a bottle of wine and take it back to the room to enjoy with our dinner - very good customer service. A convenience store somewhere in the hotel would be very handy for forgotten items and some basics. All in all a fabulous stay, we would thoroughly recommend it and would return without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, great experience”
Reviews.Author: sporemom
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay here - stayed 2 days, and went to Disney 1 day (with 2 preschoolers in tow, 1 day was definitely enough). Hotel interior and grounds were beautiful. Meals at the Walt Cafe and even pool bar were satisfactory - but there really was not much choice for food (on hindsight we could have tried going to the Hollywood Hotel). Activities and amusements for kids at the activity room could have been a little more interesting, but I guess most visitors do not spend that much time at the hotel itself, so not a big deal. Also, there was a princess dress up room at the hotel for girls - why not something for boys too?? (not necessarily dress up) Getting to the park was a breeze with the shuttle bus. Was very grateful when I left my camera behind and it was found and kept safely for me to pick up a few days later - very honest staff! Thank you so much, whoever you are!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel to stay with family”
Reviews.Author: FrqIndianTraveller
Reviews.Content: We chose to stay 2 nights in Disneyland Hotel - definitely a good decision. I was contemplating whether to stay in a cheaper option and travel to Disneyland. Ultimately, don't regret my decision to stay in Disneyland Hotel for 2 nights. The hotel is clean, has all the necessary amenities. We used their swimming pools (they've 2 of them- 1 indoor and 1 outdoor), water slides, Jacuzzi etc. The hotel is right next to sea. So, you can chose to take a stroll along the sea rocks. If you are adventurous enough, take a walk to Disneyland Jetty. This was constructed so that Ferry could come to Disneyland Hotel directly, but has not yet been commissioned. I enjoyed my morning walk to Jetty and back. Kids loved the simming pool and the Jantar Mantar Garden. They've free children entertainment center which works 10-10 but we couldn't utilize it. We got good Indian Dishes in room service as well as the restaurant next to swimming pool. For vegetarians - there are options in room service though. Good food. Had breakfast in Enchanted Garden restaurant - but its prohibitively expensive. All the cartoon characters are available during breakfast for you to take a picture with them. However, not worth the money. I took breakfast in room the next day. Disneyland is 15 mins walking from the hotel or you can take hotel shuttle to the park. You can buy the tickets in the hotel itself. Overall, very good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Magical place”
Reviews.Author: Forbesaw
Reviews.Content: A beautiful hotel, close to the park. Rooms very clean and lovely victorian style to them. Only criticism is that the hotel is so isolated there is nothing else around other than Disneyland park. Therefore meals are limited in variety and choice.

Reviews.Title: “Disneyland Hong Kong style”
Reviews.Author: Nsingapore
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit to HK Disneyland and once again we were not disappointed. This truly is a magical place for anyone with Children. The staff are friendly and the service is great. For a hotel that is extremely busy with Children running around everywhere there does not appear to be much chaos. They cater for all the needs of the children with themed breakfast and dinners where you can meet and greet all the disney characters. The photos that they take are expensive but you feel compelled to buy even though you have the same picture on your own camera. The hotel has a great pool area with a big water slide, the water was slightly chilly but they also have an indoor pool so you can swim in warm water also. The staff at the pool were great, and went above and beyond to help me find a screwdriver that would open the remote on a new car I had bought my son at the park. The park is just a 10 min walk or you can ride the shuttle bus. As like all Disneyland parks its just a world of fun and fantasy for children. I recommend all of it, but the fireworks at 730 pm is worth either staying around for or coming back to the park to see. The Lion King show was also brilliant. Very Talented singers and dancers. So if your looking for a short break with your kids, then this is the place to go. You will be tired by the end of day 1 but the plus is so will your children or child, so maybe a good nights sleep for all..... Now why did that not happen to me, think mine was so excited from seeing all the Disney characters he could not sleep

Reviews.Title: “Excellent kids experience”
Reviews.Author: DanishexpatinKL
Reviews.Content: Two aduls and two girls 4 and 5 with a mission to visit the Disney princesses. Only one night was available via the booking site, but calling the booking office there were options to choose from. We ended up getting package deals - two nights on Kingdom Club floor including breakfast, snacks, drinks, bedtime story, good night visit by Mickey or Minnie and 2 day Disney tickets. A great choice - real value for money. The staff were very service- and children minded. Amazing how parents of young kids can relax and enjoy themselves when the kids are 100% welcome. As tacky as the Disney concept could seem it was impressing how good the Disney caracthers were at connecting to each child and making them feel special. The rooms were pure luxery - not a finger to put on anything. The dinner at the Enchanted Garden was a hit - especially Goofy and Pluto were real good with our girls. Great food, but a bit wasted since the intertainment was in focus. Pricy... We had great weather - according to recommendations Oct/Nov and Mar/Apr are the best months. Conclusion: Spoil the kids and pamper the parents. Works for us! We will be back with Grandad next year - he will love it! I'm still wearing my Disney smile and the girls are dressed up as Cindarella and Belle.

Reviews.Title: “American kitsch off the Chinese mainland”
Reviews.Author: sejok
Reviews.Content: For its flaws, I should punish this hotel with a sub-four star rating. But, for the simple fact that they continually put a smile on my child's face, I give them the top score. This Victorian themed hotel is Disney kitsch at its best. A grandiose foyer with a faux antique elevator greets you, but only after your senses are assaulted by guests who choose to smoke at the driveway while chatting in their heavily accented mandarin. Make no mistake, this Disneyland is in China. And Disney sure knows how to appeal to the mainland Nuevo Riche. (While this is hearsay, since I have not personally experienced it, I have it on good authority that the adjacent Hollywood hotel is even worse!) Here's why they get 5 stars. Service. Every where you go, the smiles are genuinely contagious. This is after all the happiest place on earth (or at least in China). Staff appear genuinely warm and helpful, and the ratio of staff to guests is optimal for when we visited in mid-October. Staff are also empowered to please; most carry stickers or little items to please the little guests and almost everyone speaks (or tries their best) 3 languages - Cantonese, Mandarin and English. For me, the ultimate test came when my daughter left her comfort blanket in the room. The hotel immediately arranged to have it shipped back to us. Also, for the little guests, everything is kid sized. Miniature bathrobes, slippers, a thoughtful stool in our room all came in very handy. All amenities are Disney themed and playing find the hidden Mickey is an endless source of joy for any child. The prince Eric playroom with activities from 9am to 10pm will also keep young guests entertained when they're not at the theme park. Breakfast at the enchanted garden is also a very special treat. Diners get visited by the main Disney characters and every table has the opportunity to take pictures with the stars. This will save you valuable queuing time when in the theme park. This meal sure beats the various options available. A very limited and mediocre breakfast at the Chinese restaurant will set you back $170 per adult and room service will cost upwards of $210. The premium which the enchanted garden commands at $258 per adult is in my opinion worth it... Both for the entertainment and the choice of food. Now where could they have done a little better? I think for one, dining choices at the hotel are quite poor. Walt's cafe is expected to open by end-2011 and that should add another choice to an otherwise limited selection of dining locations and menu choices. I can't imagine staying beyond 3-4 days. Especially since eating out really isn't an option. There also isn't a supermarket within the vicinity, so all incidentals need to have been brought along. Also, this means that suddenly the mini-bar seems like a very viable option... Thankfully it's not overpriced, but a vending machine surely would have been appreciated. We also noticed that the towels in the room were frayed and while they advertised that the double rooms would sleep four, I suspect they meant dwarfs. 2 and a half large asians struggled to sleep comfortably. But really, I'm nitpicking. I would come back to stay here - if for nothing else, to see that wide grin on my daughters face when Pluto rubbed noses with her.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel but pricey restaurants”
Reviews.Author: EH78
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights & had a 2 day pass to Disneyland. The hotel is beautifully decorated & has a touch of Disney. The character breakfast was probably the kids favourite part of the stay. It's a bit expensive but worth doing once. The only downside of the hotel, is that the restaurants are quite expensive considering so many children stay there. A few nights we had dinner at the Park as it was so much cheaper - & there is more than just fast food options The hotel pool was really lovely & luckily for us was hardly being used as everyone is at Disneyland! We would go to the Park in the morning, come back to the hotel for a swim & then head back to the Park in the afternoon.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: carolee09
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in Sept 2011 with a 3 & 6 year old...loved every minute. Elegant and beautiful....impeccably clean, great views and fantastic service...Do have breakfast at the Enchanted Garden Resturant and book at reception for a discounted rate...Spa treatments were divine, nice pool facilities...wish we stayed here longer!!!

Reviews.Title: “Disney Stopover”
Reviews.Author: Peter T
Reviews.Content: Myself, my wife and 2 young kids (3 and 6) stayed for two nights in the hotel and visited Disney in between. The Hotel common area is very beautiful and spacious. great for the kids to play in the maze, and the pool: excellent little water slide, lots of lifeguards and servers. Rooms are well kept and clean, we had an ocean view room with balcony which was nice for us to sit on when kids had gone to bed. Had an excellent gym (no extra charge, open good hours) and lap pool for us to take turns doing some exercise. The gym equipment is brand new and varied, with machines, free weights, modern bikes, etc. Had the dinner with characters that the kids just loved. It was expensive, but the buffet was very good quality. The characters all took a lot of time with the kids which was excellent. Shuttle to Disney was quick and easy. Would do it all again, and the same way, very satisfied.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel by Disneyland”
Reviews.Author: negli99
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights in November 2010. We had 2 rooms 2 adults and 1 child in each. We came straight from the airport and arrived early for check in. We were able to get 1 room right away and was told the other room would be ready in a few hours. I asked if it would be possible to get the other room sooner as our group was very tired after flying and the kids being up all night and they said no problem we will give you an upgrade for that room. We were very pleased with our stay. We all had a wonderful time the rooms were great. We ate in the lounge one night and the food was good. We took the courtesy shuttle to and from the park and the MTR into Hong Kong and back. We had a wonderful time.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning Hotel, a stay we will always remember!”
Reviews.Author: Sarah L
Reviews.Content: This hotel is simply stunning. We stayed here as part of our Hong Kong vacation and couldn't be happier with our choice. We loved the easy stroll to Disneyland each morning, lots to look at on the way and nice Disney music playing as you walk! The kids loved the maze, and I still here about it now, more than 6 months since our return! The kids play room is great too, plenty to do to keep the kids happy and I love how clean and neat they keep it all! The rooms were beautiful, we had a lovely view of the sea from our balcony room. The rooms were a good size also for a family for 4. The dining was also 5 star. The Crystal Lotus and the Enchanted Garden were both great places to dine.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful place to stay”
Reviews.Author: rbuckell
Reviews.Content: Apart from reception which is often busy the hotel is a magical place to stay. We had a balcony and the room was so nice it was a shame to go to the park.
