The kids loved the Disney character toilet set in the room to take away and the hotel activities including character brreakfast. The hotel is a short 10min walk to the park or take a coach 6min. The hotel grounds are so good to walk around and the maze is fun but not too difficult. This is our third stay and we will stay again soon I hope.

Reviews.Title: “Disney at it's best - and in Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: gweilo97
Reviews.Content: Wow! Fantastic hotel with all the normally Disney trimmings. Breakfast with the Disney characters in the hotel is a must - and you can do it everyday (make sure you book though as soon as you arrive or before). Rooms a little on the small side - compared to other HK hotels - but you're not in rooms much so not a problem. 20 minutes walk from the big park itself - which is out of this world. Or a short courtesy bus ride and then a 5 minute walk. Hotel pools great and with loads of kid's stuff - slides and games. Pool food also very good. And your very own Disney shop in the hotel lobby. Unbelievable to think this is all on Lantau Island! :-) Would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Fun hotel with surprise everyday!”
Reviews.Author: ok_xin
Reviews.Content: Themed hotel with surprise everyday! Housekeeping staff or even any staff in the hotel gave away handmade rings, folded rabbit face towels and etc to children! Snow white & 7 dwarf toiletries and meet Mickey every night at the club lounge were extra to stay in their club floor room. The room come with it's own balcony overlooking Mickey Maze. The Crystal Lotus restaurant is serving nice food but above average cost. They have Disney set dim sum served during lunch time but you have to pre-book. We met Cinderella at the lobby too! They are celebrating their 5th year anniversary this year with plenty of activities! From the hotel to Hong Kong island is just 30 to 45 minute by taxi and to me, it is not a big problem if you lodge there and go on to Hong Kong for shopping! Hong Kong taxi service is just effective! Will be back again!

Reviews.Title: “Worth to stay but a little bit pricey”
Reviews.Author: yuen80
Reviews.Content: Worth to stay if you have budget and wanna stay away from the busy and dusty down town. I enjoyed the quiet night taking photos at the Disneyland entrance as all visitors would not stay up so late... Spacious room with 2 double beds, feel relaxing when inside room. The lobby was too crowded during day time as children are running here n there.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service... Nice Interior”
Reviews.Author: Ermelo V
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for two nights and everything was great from checkin to checkout. Its kinda hard to understand how some of the frondesk people speak english but they are truly helpful in so many ways. The interior of the room is nice and the room is well appointed as well, I love the seaview from our window.. Will definitely go back there

Reviews.Title: “If you go to disneyland please stay”
Reviews.Author: HITESHSADH
Reviews.Content: It was our choice to stay at disneyland. Most packages will just give you a disneyland trip.. If you really want to enjoy stay here for 2 nights. your kids will be relaxed & they will love it. We were lucky to be there at the halloween time & the nights were ven more amazing. a must see & the kids love the hotel, the food & the ambience.

Reviews.Title: “Disney Magic”
Reviews.Author: countyfan2020
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 1 night in between 2 Disney days. We upgraded to a Fantasy room (one of the 'turrets') & it was worth every penny! The hotel is the usual Disney theme and mirrors WDW's Grand Floridian & DLRP's Disneyland hotel. The room was huge, witha massive bed, large corner jacuzzi & wet room shower. It is just a 10 min bus ride to the park entrance or a 20 min walk (which at night was very nice). The 1 down side was that the bar closed at 10:30 which we thought was a little early considering the fireworks didn't finish til 9:30 & HKDL is a 'dry' park. The staff were very helpful& they were happy to look after our bags all day whilst we played in the park. Wired internet was available for HK$120 per 24hrs. Great place to stay if you want to stay in a Disney hotel. We also went & looked at teh Hollywood & that seemed nice but was very full of people!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel for family reunion”
Reviews.Author: Bunnysnaky
Reviews.Content: We've been to HK Disneyland Hotel for a few times, mainly for birthday celebration. It's easily accessible by MTR (Sunny Bay) follow by a 3-5 minute shuttle bus ride. Located next to HK Disneyland thus provided a good place for all exhaustive guests to take a good rest. Compared with it's less expensive counterpart next door (Disney Hollywood Hotel), it's less crowded, better acoustic effect at night time, more classy stuff (the Disney slippers/ toiletries packed in boxes with Snow White's drawfs printed on it/lavender sachet in the wardrobe etc) and better facilities to entertain the kids (the children's playroom at lower ground, the make-up studio for girls to dress up as Princess, the swimming pool and the botanical maze). The rooms were clean, warm and cosy though not particularly spacious. A double room could accommodate up to 2 adults and 2 kids under 12. Check-in process very efficient and smooth, though during peak seasons some delay were expected. Service just average as I witnessed the impatient faces of the bellboys and receptionists during very busy hours. Accommodation did not include breakfast with Disney characters (which may cost $600-700 for a family of 4) - snaps with Pluto, Mickey, Minnie and Groovy in the restaurant is the highlight of the day, at least for the children. The spa inside the hotel was quite expensive and similar service could be sought in other salons/spas but pay less. For meals outside the resort complex, take the MTR from Sunny Bay to Tung Chung where there were Food Republic/restaurants in the City Gate (next to Tung Chung station exit C ) or a ride via Ngong Ping 360 to the Po Lin Monastery for vegetarian food. The price may vary during seasons and with a Disneyland annual pass there will be discount. So check thoroughly before you book.

Reviews.Title: “If you've ever been to U.S. Disney property - you will be sorely disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Momwith2boysVN
Reviews.Content: The hotel is lovely. However, the service is awful. The food and drink is awful. The services at the hotel are non-existent. The room service food is the worst we've ever had - even the pancakes were hard as rock and looked more like french toast - my kids wouldn't eat anything! The park is a sad copy of Disneyland, Anaheim, CA. Very few rides and the ones they have are the bottom of the barrel with respect to the ones they have at the U.S. parks. We've stayed at Hong Kong hotels in the past - 4 and 5 star - and the food and service is always top notch. The staff here, in contrast, speak little English - they do the 'I will pretend to understand English but my response will make it clear I have no idea what you are saying'. Living in Asia, that drives me nuts - just say I don't understand. Anyway, we stopped here for a few days in transit during our summer holiday. Waste of money. Paid close to $400 per night USD for the room and it included nothing - no internet, no breakfast - no service. The worst of it was even the kids activities are pathetic. I've been to better kids clubs at a Hyatt - this is supposed to be a Disney property - what a shame. Our kids were so disappointed - they've been to Disneyland several times and Disney World - the mecca of Disney resorts - we stayed at the Animal Kingdom lodge which was fantastic. Anyway, if you will never get to the U.S. - I'm sure it will be fine for you - the old adage of if you've not been to Paris, the farms seems great. To U.S. expats/visitors to HK - don't bother!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great for the kids”
Reviews.Author: traveller2255
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my kids for three nights mid July 2011. Had two connecting rooms at the ground level. It was a Wonderful experience for the kids. The rooms are wonderful. The shower, although not separate from the tub, was great. Swimming pool was big with a slide.  The hotel got a shuttle bus to the Disneyland that leaves every 5 minutes or so from a stop 15 meters away from the hotel entrance. It takes 5 to 10 minutes to reach the park from the hotel using the shuttle bus. Then about 10 to 15 minutes walk to disneyland entrance.  Check in was slow. Check out very slow. ( you will probably have to wait in a line for several minutes) The lobby is wonderful but small. No chairs to sit and way too many people waiting. There was construction work in the lobby at the time we stayed. Can't see it cause they covered it but you will have to yell for the person next to you to hear you. No wifi in the room. Only Internet with a cable connection so we couldn't use our iPhones in the rooms had to go to the lobby which 2 out 3 times had no chairs to sit on. I don't know if Its right to say this but I felt like the staff was not genuinely friendly at the reception and the pool. And one housekeeping lady was actually rude one time. Rooms are 5 stars. Lobby is 2 or 3 stars. Other facilities are 4. I recommend this hotel for the experience of your kids caz they will definitely love it.

Reviews.Title: “fun place for family n kids”
Reviews.Author: manish66
Reviews.Content: another trip to the disneyland and what a place to be.there are 2 hotels and i chose the better of the lot-hongkong disneyland hotel.true american craftmanship.located right next to the sea, it was a visual treat to watch the sun go down,the ships sailing by.we chose the room with a sea view and amazing it was.the room had a big balcony attached to it.the room was fairly sized with a good sized bathroom with all modern amneties.the hotel has a lot of activities for kids and women like towel animal making ,kids fancy dressing etc.which they all enjoy.the resturants are good and the food is pretty nice .the rates are fairly moderate.you can get passes to the disneyland park with your hotel accomodation .they have free shuttle service to the park. overall a very good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Marvelous!!”
Reviews.Author: adamarpan
Reviews.Content: the concept hotel I ever stayed in my life... especially if you're a disney fan... unforgettable moment i had with my family.big room, nice interior design, lovely disney orchestra songs 24hours every corner of the hotel, amazing decorated indoor pool, nice princesses ( hint around 10am - 12pm @ lobby)

Reviews.Title: “awesome”
Reviews.Author: nomads5
Reviews.Content: this was the perfect stop over. We had just finished traveling around Europe with out three kids and this stop was just what we needed. The pool in the Hotel was beautiful, the slide into the pool was awesome and the rooms were very impressive. I would go back there again that's for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Sensational experience with Kids”
Reviews.Author: scanm
Reviews.Content: We had 3 days in Hong Kong on a stopover and thought we would treat the kids (and us). The Disneyland Hotel was sensational and the kids LOVED every minute of it. Sitting down to breakfast with Minnie Mouse, being made up as their favorite princess, fireworks every night....basically being spoilt at every turn. Not cheap, but if you can manage it, go for it for the experience (for the kids that is).

Reviews.Title: “Good but could be better.......”
Reviews.Author: Safari_njema40
Reviews.Content: Checked into the hotel in the evening and our rooms were ready...we had 2 inter connecting rooms with a garden view.....the rooms are pretty nice and the beds very comfy......the youngest daughter loved the disney slippers, toiletries and the Disney touches...... We had booked our breakfast for the 3 mornings at the enchanted garden restaurant.....they had a good spread to suit every taste and great opportunity to take photos with the characters.... On our first day of breakfast...I found a long black hair on a piece of fruit so I stopped eating the fruits altogether......on our second morning I found another long black hair on my Danish pastry and as you can guess I stopped eating the pastries.... The food as I hear was good but for such an establishment, hygiene should be the highest priority....

Reviews.Title: “A Pleasant Surprise”
Reviews.Author: SoloTraveller11
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Hong Kong Disneyland Hotel after a very trip throughout Beijing with two young children (5&7) who had climbed The Great Wall of China and seen every site there was to see. We checked into a twin double room that had a small balcony and a glimpse of the water. The hotel is set up in a U shape toward the harbour and the architecture was very American and charming with wood gables. The gardens surrounding the resort and the Disneyland park itself were extremely impressive and went on forever. The hotel is really close to the airport too (I would use it as an airport hotel on a business trip it was that nice). Don't miss breakfast with the characters if your going to go. We went with another family who had 3&5 year old children- all the children loved it. The food was good too. We checked in in the morning and relaxed, enjoyed swimming in the pool (although so Mainland Chinese were spitting in it which was quite gross). We relaxed in the sunshine and enjoyed pool food and cocktails in the sun with our friends whilst the children swam. The next morning we did breakfast, checked out and put our luggage into storage then hit the park for the entire day, doing as much as we could before hotfooting it to the Four Seasons for some real R&R!

Reviews.Title: “Must stay to get the full Disney experience!”
Reviews.Author: kennysia
Reviews.Content: What an amazing hotel! The entire hotel is decorated like a Victorian-era fairy tale castle with grand golden above your head and plenty of sunlight seeping through four floors of glass windows. We were supposed to have a sea view room but it was all booked out. The receptionist was quick to upgrade us to a 'Fantasia' room without the sea view, but equipped with a Jacuzzi inside the bathroom. Can't complain about that! The attention-to-detail inside the Hong Kong Disneyland hotel is incredible. Almost every single decor in the room has a either a Mickey Mouse silhouette or a Disney character drawn on it. From the Seven Dwarves on the toiletries, to the frame on the bathroom mirror, to the "Do Not Disturb" sign. Even the pillow cases have Cinderella and the Fairy godmothers printed on them. The Hong Kong Disneyland Hotel also boasts a large heated indoor swimming pool and an indoor gym, all decorated like they come right out from 19th century England. Well, except their gym equipment. The hotel has a nice romantic courtyard and a beautiful buffet restaurant called The Enchanted Garden. This is the best place to have breakfast in Disneyland! While we were munching on our food, all the familiar characters started coming out to shake hands, take photos and interact with us! We didn't even have to fight with other people or queue for ages under the sun. Will be back, with kids next time!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic helps you get the most out of your Disney experience”
Reviews.Author: Brisvegas24
Reviews.Content: I decided to stay at the Victoria Hotel as it really looked magical and it was. As we were staying at the hotel we got access to buy the 2 day stay pass which was worth the extra money. This pass allowed us to pace ourselves at the park. We booked a garden view room which had two double beds and plenty of room to move. Everyone got a pair of slip on slippers which was a nice touch. As my sons birthday was that month he got this cute cake made of towels. It was very cute! The foyer was beautiful. Try and go around xmas time as they really make the place look beautiful. Beautiful tree dominated the foyer. Kids go a picture with Santa, Check in was very smooth. We spent most of the day at the park and came back in the afternoon for a nap. Then went back for the fireworks and the magical moment of snowflakes flowing down. This was very special. The bus service too and from the hotel and park was well organised and did not have to wait long. Beds and room very comfortable. We did the characters breakfast - not to be missed! A highlight for the kids and the food quality and variety was very good. The food at disneyland itself was expensive and not great! But food at the hotel was excellent. We took a taxi from the Salisbury YMCA to the Disney Hotel and while I can't remember the price I thought it was ok. Better than lugging suitcases around on the train. If you want to really make the experience extra special for the kids its worth it to stay. We tried to book an extra two nights (due to holiday changes) but it was booked out over the week-end. So another good tip is try to go and stay midweek as we never felt the crowds either at the hotel or the park. In terms of place to stay in Hong kong, while I know it is not central it does give you 2 double beds in one room with plenty of space to sit and for your suitcases it could be a choice to stay at even after your disney experience.

Reviews.Title: “Kid Heaven!”
Reviews.Author: pageantqueen
Reviews.Content: (written by 12 year old Ari) Firstly, when we booked the hotel room, they were all full for weeks but luckily, when my dad was on the phone to them, someone canceled right there so we got a room! We came to this hotel expecting 5-star quality and we did. When we booked for a kingdom club room, there was a mix-up with the days of our stay but they fixed it in no time. Right after we checked in, we went straight up to the kingdom club. There are snacks throughout the day and the staff were very friendly. The room was amazing with comfortable beds and you can even watch Disney channel in the bath! We arrived in the afternoon so we went to the pool. As kids, we loved the water slide! Here are some water slide tips for parents to give to their kids: Slide backwards on your knees otherwise you won't go fast at all; you'll just get stuck. Also, if you want to make a train, there is a sensor at the top of the slide to make the light go red; indicating you can't slide. Squash down and miss the sensor and wait in the middle of the slide. Since the light will be green, just go and you can make a train! After swimming, we had a delicious lunch and went to relax in the room. At night time, we went to the Disneyland park. We started walking towards a surfing mickey mouse. Suddenly, there was a change in the music and the water went colourful. It was amazing! Then we watched the beautiful fireworks and got Disney Fever! We went home and had room service dinner and eventually went to sleep. The next day, we woke up and had our complimentary Kingdom Club breakfast (I had a mickey mouse waffle with strawberries and sprinkles). We really wanted to swim so we did for half an hour. Then, we went to Disneyland! We had our fastpasses so we started off using it for Buzz Lightyear which was our favourite ride! We then waited in line for the Orbitron. It was very fun, but a short ride. After that, we went and played in the water ufo zone. We were so hungry so we went and had fried chicken at starliner diner. The other things were too full so we set off to adventure land and had a short wait for the Jungle River Cruise, which was also incredible. On our way to Fantasy Land, we caught the 'Flights of Fantasy' parade and watched some of it, but it was just too hot so we left in the middle of it, which was a good idea because the ride lines were very short. We needed aircon so we went to the 4D show which was amazing and so fun! I really wanted to see the Lion King so we went with our fastpasses and were whisked into the show in the front seats. When we went past the queue, we heard a few moans and groans! It was so worth getting to the front because we got lots of high fives from the actors. I really wanted to do more rides in fantasy land, but it was just to hot so we went shopping and bought T-shirts. We returned to the hotel and although we couldn't get to our room, we could still go to the Kingdom Club (we went on a sugar rush because of all the candy) and go swimming. We didn't want to leave so we hid behind the concierge but eventually we had to! IT IS THE BEST HOTEL IN THE WORLD!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Terrible bathroom”
Reviews.Author: tweetymai
Reviews.Content: I have always love visiting Disney. I have been to Disney World in Florida for my honeymoon, millions of time to the one in Anaheim, CA and a few times to the one in Tokyo. My husband and I decided to stay there for a night for the July 1st long weekend. It was a terrible experience. We paid for a room over $400 US and would not expect the bathroom facilities so terrible!! The wallpaper and wall side was in terrible condition. The sink and shower drain clogged! It was a ripoff. The jaccuci in the bathroom had grayish stains, practically unusable. To make it worse, when I told the check out staff, Ling, about it and showed her the photos I took of the room the next morning. She only said sorry and would notify housekeeping!! Need I say more?! I will upload the photos I took of the bathroom and you guys can decide.

Reviews.Title: “Victorian style,Premier Disney Hotel,2 Stops away from going to Disney L/Park & 1 stop coming back,great service”
Reviews.Author: liptonst
Reviews.Content: Victorian style, Premier Disney Land hotel, 2 Stops away from going to Disney Land Park and 1 stop away when coming back, great service, great environment, with all the Disney characters. Disney Land Hotel stands out as unique in Lantau Island for me due to the attention to detail, impressive environment and great value, making the Disney land Hotel the best out of the 2 Disney hotels to choose from and the most popular, making this property heavily booked, so I do recommend all to book early. The rooms are elegant, comfortable and spacious with the rate being the same as the lesser Disney hotel, which assures really good value here. Your meal at the Enchanted Garden Restaurant, will be a rewarding excellent buffet which will be supported by all the Disney Characters and lots of photo opportunities. Tip: I can only recommend the Disney Land Hotel, so book early as the lesser Disney hotel is nowhere near the same league. You only need one day to see everything in the Disney Land Park and enjoy the majority if not all of the rides.

Reviews.Title: “Good Experience”
Reviews.Author: KabsMumbai
Reviews.Content: On a holiday with 2 kids in hongkong....the Disneyland hotel was a natural choice for stay during the trip to Disneyland.The Checkin was delayed as it was a weekend.The people at the check in were helpful.Once in the room, the room had enough place for all 4 of us.The sense that you are in Mickey mouse land was evident in all areas of the room.As this was the last leg of our trip to Hongkong , we were longing for an Indian meal & fortunately there was a buffet at the Disney Hollywood hotel which is close to the Disneyland hotel.The breakfast at the hotel was extremely limited in choice and with kids the options for them were missing.

Reviews.Title: “Okay with some flaws”
Reviews.Author: sophiegrayy
Reviews.Content: The hotel was okay, just what I expected. Buffet breakfast at chef mickey was terrible. The food like salmon were not fresh. The lobby was crowded since the place was small. Check in took a bit long since like I said, the place was small. They should make a bigger lobby. The guests and the staff there were already getting irritated.

Reviews.Title: “Fun Filled Hotel”
Reviews.Author: abhijitsengupta
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel with lots of surprises. Front office fantastic evn though it was crowded as lots of people were checking in. The staff took lots of time to explain the packages to each guest. Chinese restaurant within the hotel was excellent serving very good food, even the restaurant staff were excellent. Hotel view of the ocean was fun. Must stay hotel for great experience. Though we stayed one night since our daughter had flu so we could only get one night availability after we rescheduled our stay through our agentand as we were leaving next day morning for Singapore we missed out on many things. Rooms are spacious and you are given complimentary room sleepers which you can take along with you, that was nice on the part of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fun at Disneyland”
Reviews.Author: NatashaSR
Reviews.Content: We booked our hotel well in advance atleast 60 days to avail of the Christmas offers and various other activities. Disneyland was fun ----- Having breakfast with the cartoon characters and enjoing every moment be it even by the poolside was great. Their SPA was fantastic and you could smell chocolate and it reminded you of your childhood memories. It good for everyone, couple, friends, family and children......

Reviews.Title: “Kids Dream Vacation”
Reviews.Author: ShahRajen
Reviews.Content: From the moment you enter the premises of the Hotel, you can feel the Micky mania in air. The hotel is comfortable and full of activities for the kids. location is great. Hotel room are spacious for the family of four. The checkin time is late, except that everything is very well taken care of. Free shuttle to the park is a good service with stay 2 day ticket its a booster for kids.

Reviews.Title: “THE BEST HOTEL I'VE STAYED IN !”
Reviews.Author: hkdxbqr
Reviews.Content: I chose the HK DisneyLand hotel for our honeymoon. I have to start by saying that this is infact the best hotel I've stayed in so far ! We chose the Lonstay package as we were there for 6 nights. Stayed at the Disney Club house which is on the 7th floor and is very private. Booked in for a Merc pick up from the airport, we were assisted by some one from the hotel staff as soon as we got of the plane ! We were assisted to the immigration counter, helped with our luggage and guided to the car by them ! About a 20 minute drive from the airport to HK Disneyland Hotel. We had requested for an early check in, we got it an hour late, no complaints there sine that gave us ample time to walk around this huge hotel and take in every bit of magic ! The room was big, clean, well maintained and had lotsa small personal Disney touches that we were blown away by ! We had reserved for dinner with the characters on our 3rd night and my wife had a ball of a time taking pics with all her favourite characters !! Characters keep popping up in the hotel in the mornings for a fotoshoot. The hotel has buses every 5-10 minutes to Disneyland and also the metro station which connects you to the rest of Hong Kong. We ended up going to Ngong Ping, HK City day and night tour, Ocean Park, DisneyLand, Madamme Tuessads and the Tram while we were there. Pickedup an Octopus card for travelling around - it was worth it. Loved this hotel and would definitely come back again !! RECOMMENDED !!

Reviews.Title: “JUST A PERFECT PLACE”
Reviews.Author: Jayamani
Reviews.Content: This Hong Kong hotel is a part of the Disneyland complex. The other attractions popular with visitors to Hong Kong include the Clock Tower, the Night Market, the many commercial and business addresses and the cultural attractions that define the city. Hong Kong International Airport is located only 6 miles away from this hotel. There is extensive public transit within the city itself.

Reviews.Title: “Beware the bedbugs!”
Reviews.Author: Dataspice
Reviews.Content: Overall the hotel itself was decent with the highlight being breakfast at the main dining hall where Mickey and some other characters will come around and mingle with the guests. However, I was horribly bitten by bed bugs staying there. I think the hotel needs to change its mattresses on the 5th floor!! This is a big turn off for me!

Reviews.Title: “Magical”
Reviews.Author: ravensilvers
Reviews.Content: We were quite excited to stay in the Disneyland Hotel for two nights in May 2011. The room was large and spacious, and the two queen-sized beds were really very comfortable. As expected, a lot of things in the room were Disney-themed, including the toiletries, but the room itself isn't very Disney overload. A big advantage of the hotel is its proximity to the park. As guests we were guaranteed tickets to the park, but admission is not included in the room. Food in the hotel is overpriced. Breakfast at the Sorcerer's Lounge in the lobby was overpriced and very sad; there was almost no hot food and not filling. Good for kids maybe, but we were sorely disappointed. We had wanted the meet-and-greet breakfast at Enchanted Garden, but it was fully booked. We looked in at the buffet dinner at Enchanted Garden, but we were unwilling to pay HKD488 per adult for 'international buffet'. It's better to eat at the Hollywood Hotel. They have more eateries and are generally cheaper than Disneyland Hotel. We liked the Hollywood and Dine "fast food" place because it was less posh and pricey (average meal is under HKD100). We had dinner at the Indian buffet in Hollywood and Dine, which was much more reasonably-priced at HKD160/head. The shop in the lobby is quite well-stocked and very good for last-minute shopping. You can also send anything you buy from the park back to the hotel for no additional charge, which is very useful if you're traveling light. While the Disneyland Hotel is a very nice hotel, next time we're more likely to stay in the Hollywood Hotel because it's more lively and casual. But if you're looking for a more luxurious and quiet stay after a long day at Disneyland, this is a great choice.

Reviews.Title: “Top Hotel, just what you expect from Disney.”
Reviews.Author: davidhowarth29
Reviews.Content: Had a very relaxing and enjoyable stay at the Disneyland Hotel. Room was excellent and very comfortable. The only downside is that there is not much to do on site apart from the theme park It is set up in a similar style to the Boardwalk in orlando, but without the shops, restauarants and bars. This addition would really make a difference.

Reviews.Title: “My daugthers gave me a hug & said "Thanks Dad" ...”
Reviews.Author: Maneesh13
Reviews.Content: Hello The hotel is 5 star property & conveniently located at sea side giving a spectacular view of beautiful garden & sea. The dinning was little expensive. But we enjoyed the amazing buffet breakfast with diff. Disney characters coming in chef dresses. It was dream come true for my daughters when they posed with " Cinderella, Snow white, Sleeping Beauty and many others " If you have small children u must stay there .... Thanks

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for kids in Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: Vol-de-Mar888
Reviews.Content: Spent 10 days in HK, 4 of them with the Disneyland Hotel. it was our second time, we had Kingdom Suite connected to Kingdom club room. It is a great hotel and a great Disney park. Especially compared to the one in Paris. From what I observed parents at dinner looked relaxed and friendly, that is after whole day in the park with kids. Staff is very frienldly and eager to help, though everything is already perfectly organized and managed. Kids have a lot of activities even if You do not go to the Park, Kingdom Club lounge is nice and very relaxing, rooms are well kept, restaurants offer good choice especially one with Disney characters, the variety of dishes from so many cuisines I have never seen before. Hotel is located 10 minutes from the airport and 20 minutes by taxi to the Central or Kowloon, we had a nanny with us and spent some good night time in the city after sending kids to bed. Can go on describing the good sides, like swimming pool, a lot of kids programms etc. We loved it and for sure will return next year. There were only three things that minorly upset us and I assume the management needs to take care of such first was the noise from the ventillation shaft, You can manage the AC and having kids sleeping with us we turned it of for the nights. The ventillation worked constantly and You can not manage it. The noise was quite loud and unpleasant. As I understood we had the end of the corridor suite and only such rooms had this problem. We complained, they said they solved, but the noise remained same second was the smell from the toilet in the master bathroom. The suite has two bathrooms (which is great), we also had another toilet in the connected room, but only toilet in the main bathroom smelt. We complained - nothing was done. We did not bother. But it is not correct Third is very important and my wife and nanny were very much upset. There are a lot of different insects in Asia. In this hotel we did not see a single fly, cockroach or mosquito which was great. But there were little black kind of flies - very tiny, in the park, at the swimming pool. You lie down at the swimming pool and from nowhere 20 or 30 such flies appear and bite. You either have to stay in the swimming pool or cover with towels and sweat. Please use more and better repellent Otherwise kids were very happy, so were we. Great Hotel in the one of the greatest cities in the world

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: julieweb
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in March for one night as it was close to airport, and we werent heading back to disneyland till later that week. This hotel was lovely. Fantastic marble bathrooms with TV in them so you could lay in the bath whilst watching tele. Large comfy beds, and a balcony which overlooked the south china sea. used the pool in the morning before we took off for Macau and had the pool to ourselves. Pool had a slide which the kids loved. Taxis easily get in and out of this hotel as & when you want them, and the shuttle bus runs to disneyland all day. Would highly recommend. Went back there later the next week on our return for the Breakfast with the Disney characters. The Kids loved that also. On our return we stayed at the Disneyland Hollywood Hotel. If you can't decide which of the two to stay at, I would suggest this one over the Hollywood for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay, but could be better”
Reviews.Author: punit007
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Disneyland Hotel for 2 nights. We very lucky to get a room at 10am in the morning, I guess we were the 1st guests to checkin in the morning. We saw a big line of guest waiting to checkin at around 12pm. There rooms are spacious and very comfortable with 2 queen size beds. I was not very impressed by the Toilets as the shower was very old and not having much force as expected. The toiletries were packed in the 7 dwarfs printed boxes, but inside the box they were standard budget hotet showercap, soap, etc Loved the mickey mouse embroidered bathrobes and room shoes. Hotel is a good 10-15 mins bus ride to the Disneyland and then a long walk inside. I was very surprised that there was No Wifi internet in the room, one had to go to the lobby for the same. Staff is very helpful all the time.Service was excellent in the hotel The Breakfast is a big treat for Mickey lovers as he visits every table patiently and gives enough time to each child. The spread is good enough with Indian Veg dishes also in the Buffet. The Activity room was excellent for young children, but one hardly gets enough time to take full use of the same. One good service you get at the Disneyland Park is that you can send all your shoppings back to your room from the shops your have purchased.

Reviews.Title: “overpriced hotel”
Reviews.Author: mulberry888
Reviews.Content: this is our 2nd stay here. this time we stay in the Fantasia Room with King Bed. it's more expensive and definately not worth it but no choice for us because we wanted a king size bed. I'm a fussy sleeper and I couldn't sleep in their double bed (it's just abit bigger than a super single) with my daugther (she'll toss n turn in her sleep). The major complain i have is the room's bathroom. I would rate it as a 3 star hotel's bathroom. big turn off. other than the lousy bathroom, the rest of the room is fine. but nothing 'fantasia' about it. i wondered why it was named as that. Staff are very polite and friendly. There is a kids activities room in the hotel which is great. a lot of toys to keep my toddler occupied. If not for wanting to go to the disneyland park, i wouldn't want to stay in this hotel again. It's not much better than Hollywood Hotel, just that the shuttle bus stops at Disneyland hotel 1st before going to Hollywood. By the time it reach Hollywood, the bus is nearly full and I see a very long queue there. If you don't mind the waiting for shuttle bus time, do stay at Hollywood hotel as price is cheaper and the rooms are alright (I stayed there once a few years back when i went with just my husband).

Reviews.Title: “Not so magical ...”
Reviews.Author: oracledbaUsa
Reviews.Content: We just finished a two night stay at the Disneyland Hotel Hong Kong. Firstly, there really is no other place to stay - except the Hollywood Hotel, however the MTR access is quite convenient into Lantau Island. We were staying in Hong Kong for a week and decided to finish our stay at Disneyland, since it is 15 minutes from the Airport and would be a nice finish to our Asia trip. The hotel is really understaffed. The queue to check-in is horrendous and for some reason it takes a long time for each guest to check-in. We waited for 30 minutes in line before we were helped. They offered us fast-pass tickets in lieu of our inconvenience. I had reserved a bayview room with balcony, however after check-in the room was the regular garden view, no balcony room. I called down to the desk and I was told "they are too busy and will have to call me back". So I decided to go down and wait again. My son was still in the room and they finally called back, just to tell us to come down (I was already waiting in the dreaded queue again). They put me in the room I had reserved however gave me the rate of the less expensive room - which was nice. The restaurant service was very hit and miss, everyone seemed to be really busy - they are just understaffed in most capacities. It was amusing to me to find cigarettes and alcohol in the Disney store shop there in the hotel, however there really are no other stores or convenience markets anywhere nearby. No complaints about that. The pool is nice however don't expect to have a quiet relaxing day at the pool, its full of kids - which is expected for a family resort. The gym was OK - wifi was free in the lobby, so everyone was hanging out there. The room was average size, but clean, the bathroom was tight for sure. The shuttle bus was dependable and on-time going to-from the park. The prices were a bit steep for food/drinks, however that seems to be the norm in Hong Kong/China, seems inflation is a bit out of control. I would not go back - i would prefer to stay in Kownloon or Hong Kong and just take the MTR in. Since the park closes at 8pm and it is not as good as the other Disney parks, it's hard to fill a full day of Disneyland anyway. I've read they are expanding the park and adding new phases in - which is sorely needed - since the only real ride they have there is Space Mountain and the Jungle Cruise (actually the best jungle cruise of all the parks).

Reviews.Title: “Overcrowded”
Reviews.Author: girlstuckinsydney
Reviews.Content: If not because my youngest son's birthday fell during our holiday to HK, I wouldn't recommend staying in the hotel. Just not worth the money at all. I would rather continued staying at my previous hotel in Tsim Sha Tsui. The place was overcrowded with the tourists from overseas and local Mainlands. I arrived with my family around 11am to check in before continuing to the park (I only stayed one night). There were only two front desk staff doing the check-ins, and I had to wait at least 30 minutes in the line, and i was like the 3rd in the 10 guests queue. When it was my turn to be served, no apologies at all. I had to actually complained to her, but the staff just half heartedly listened to my complaint. The only minor consolation was it's my son's birthday. They had a screen near the entrance, announcing who's birthday were on that day. My kiddy was kinda proud that his name came up on the screen, and there was a little present and card presented in the room for him. I only went in to the room like 10 pm as spent the whole day at the park, which was easily accessible by the free shuttle that comes quite often. The room was okay, standard amenities. There was a wet patch on the carpet near the entrance, but I didn't bother to complain to the front desk as all I wanted to do just sleep after the day out. Spent the morning having breakfast at the Enchanted Garden (?), again lots of people. Apparently they divided the brekkie into 2 allocated time (I was asked when checking in), the first was like 7am-9.30am, and then 9.30-11am (mine). The varities are plenty, ranging from asian menus to bacon and egg, kids menu (like mickey mouse waffles). Worth paying the money for the varieties and the staff always ensures that the trays were never empty. We also had the Disney characters walking around to take pictures with. I bought the 2daystay tickets, but didn't go back to the park the second day. So, if you're not staying for more than one night, don't buy it, not worth it as most likely it's gonna get wasted. if you want to stay longer than one night, stay because you wanted to go back to the park the next day, but if you want to travel around HK, not worth the trip as it's quite secluded from the rest of the town.

Reviews.Title: “Probably too long of a stay”
Reviews.Author: Dingmomma
Reviews.Content: We checked in on a Sunday and stayed until Friday. We arrived around three o'clock in the afternoon and when we walked through the main doors, we were greeted by a large crowd of guests in the foyer. As I tried to get checked in, some other couple jumped the line and the cast member didn't even bat an eyelash as she started helping them. When I finally got some help, I asked about complimentary upgrades and the cast member scoffed at me and said that there was no such thing. (see the previous review) She did offer a discounted upgrade for a sea view room with a balcony, which we decided to take. She then handed my children stickers and dismissed me. (Hoorah for Disney hospitality) The room was clean and the little Disney touches were really cute. My 3 year old especially loved the complimentary Mickey room slippers. The double beds were comfortable and the Disney channel kept the kids entertained while my husband and I unpacked. Throughout our stay, cast members either ignored us or stopped to give the kids cards and stickers which makes it hard to critique on service since it was so inconsistent. Even the cast members at the gift shop were inconsistent. Some girl rolled her eyes as if we was bother her when we had questions about some of the products. On another day, a different cast member was so helpful we spent HKD$850 at one go. As for food, we ordered room service and it was nothing spectacular but the convenience was unbeatable. We tried breakfast at the Sorcerer's Lounge and that was a little disappointing. There was a congee, lotus leaf wrapped rice, shrimp dumpling, fried noodles and crab meat dumplings for the oriental spread. There was yogurt, cold cut platter, cheese, four kinds of cereal and a small selection of pastries. The selection was limited for what we paid and I had to flag down the server twice to get some coffee. The breakfast buffet at the Enchanted Garden was much better. There was a large variety of food and coffee was flowing. The kids met Mickey, Goofy, Pluto and Daisy. We also had the dinner buffet at Chef Mickeys and that was also really great. We didn't try any other restaurants at the hotel because we discovered that if we took a short train ride out to the city, the food was much better and cheaper. The hotel was actually quite secluded and to get to the park takes about 15 minutes on a bus. The bus schedule was quite nice though as we never had to wait for longer than 5 minutes for it to come by. The trek to the park gates was not appreciated as you can't rent strollers until you were in the park and our 3 year old had to walk the whole way since we had to carry our 18 month old. On our last day, we decided to participate in the activities of the hotel only to find out that Prince Eric's room was only available on weekends and peak days! Perhaps someone could have told us that in advance? No hotel information on line and no activity sheets unless you ask for it every morning. Sigh. At least we filled the time in with another trip into town, swimming and meeting the princesses in the foyer. If we were to return, it would be only for one night at most. Next time, we would probably stay at a hotel off property.

Reviews.Title: “A magical experience together with the 5th Anniversary of Disneyland”
Reviews.Author: simonso
Reviews.Content: The moment I reach Disneyland everything seemed so magical. Checked in at Disneyland Hotel at about 2pm on February 25 2011. The room was extremely clean, the toilet is just like a fairytale. Everything is just perfect. From all my experience traveling, I can strongly say that this is one of the best hotel I've stayed so far! I was lucky enough to catch the flight of fantasy parade at Disneyland in conjunction with their 5th Anniversary and its running throughout the whole 2011. Checked-in from 25th Feb - 27th Feb 2011.

Reviews.Title: “DISNEYTASTIC”
Reviews.Author: Dara58
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately we only stayed here for a 1 night stopover. The hotel itself is just gorgeous. We (hubby and I) arrived very early in the morning not expecting to be able to get into our room. We were upgraded to a balcony, seaview room. Which I must say was very nice. The room itself was very clean with lovely little extras around. The bathroom was huge with lots of great personal items, in boxed Disney character covers ( tooth brush, combs etc). The free shuttle to and from the hotel to the Park was great and run every 10 or so minutes. We ate at the restuarant for lunch, tea and breakfast, the service was 10 out 10, the food was very good, presentation, taste etc. The staff everywhere from reception, restaurant to the baggage claim were all professional. Could not find a fault. During the day they have Disney Characters in the foyer so that the children can get a chance for a photo and quick chat, which I thought was lovely for them. We did not eat in the Character Dining Room, but I am sure that going by everything else at this hotel it would be excellant as well. This is truly a beautiful hotel in gorgeous surroundings, as I said a shame it was only for 1 night. Would definately go back if we were to visit Disneyland Hong Kong again.

Reviews.Title: “Pricey but wonderful Magical Experience!”
Reviews.Author: paStillieS
Reviews.Content: I booked the room + tickets + Breakfast package via the resort website direct. Prior to booking, the staff were very prompt in handling my enquires via email on the Breakfast @ Enchanted Garden which is suppose to be the highlight of our stay! For those who are not aware, Breakfast @ Enchanted Garden resturant = Breakfast with Disney characters. Upon check-in, we were inform there were 2 seatings for the breakfast & chosen the early slot. Breakfst vouchers were then issued to us. Ours was a Garden room: very big & 2 double beds which can sleep up to 4 pax. TV was showing classic Disney cartoons which was a great change from the usual Mickeymouse clubhouse! Breakfast: yes that was the most awaited highlighted! we were so excited waiting for mickey mouse to come to our table. At our seating we had Pluto/Mickey/Daisy & Goofy to take photos with. As our package comes with 2 days pass to Disneyland , it meant we could slowly take our time to explore. The free shuttle bus service goes btw Disneyhotel to Hollywood hotel then to Disneyland. Hence disneyhotel being the first pickup stop was a strong advantage as when the bus reaches hollywood hotel , often its already quite full. Overall: Indeed much more pricey than Hollywood hotel package but worth it for the wonderful experience & breakfast with mickey & frens at Disneyland hotel!

Reviews.Title: “The happiest place on earth ... disneyland :)”
Reviews.Author: claire294265
Reviews.Content: Loved the spacious hotel room and bath room very appreicated after spending 3 nights in cramped HK hotel room. Staff were friendly and accomodating with requests to change breakfast timings but were not sure about questions asked that did not pertain to Disneyland and its amenities. Activities at Disneyland itself will occupy alot of your time and you may not have time to enjoy the hotel's amenities. It was very cold when we visited and so did not have an opportunity to use the lovely outdoor pool. Scenery from our sea view room with balcony was beautiful. Room Service food was good and service was quick but abit pricey, but no point counting your pennies if you;re on holiday. Gift shop in lobby had good selection. Guess my only gripe would be that they don't have a convenience store nearby that you could buy water and other groceries as Disney is quite isolated. Had drinks at the hotel lobby late at night, looked out and hotel grounds were lit up beautifully. Breakfast at Enchanted Garden was lovely, felt like a kid all over again meeting Mickey, Pluto, Goofy and Daisy :) . In a nutshell, it was worth every penny and we are definately coming back!

Reviews.Title: “Not as great as 2 years ago”
Reviews.Author: AirVisitor
Reviews.Content: This is my second time stay in Hong Kong Disneyland hotel. Given our great experience previously, I choose to stay here during the whole tenure in HK. This time I booked 2 connecting Garden View room. (Surprisingly with an ugly looking balcony, nonetheless a plus for Garden View room.) Have quite a few special requests, basically all fulfilled. Give me the impression that HKDLH is serious about accommodate guest’s request. Compare with 2 years ago: -Hotel lighting is now less ‘orangish’ which make the atmosphere less cozy. -Shower water pressure is significantly weaker. -No longer in-room free internet access is a big inconvenience to me. (Free internet at lobby) -TV now with multi-country channels Hassle: During our stay, me & my sister (another room) have difficulty to have our bathrobe washed. The first time I have it washed but without replacement leaving no XL size bathrobe for me. Then my sister request it to be washed but the housekeeper just place the original bathrobe on the chair. I also faced the same situation the next day. All the troubles rectified within 15 mins upon calling guest service though stress already been built by the inconsistence service. Suggestion: Staying in Disney hotel, we can have our purchases send back to hotel save us from carry it around. It is a very convenience service but would be even better if it can deliver right to the room. Overall: Not as great as 2 years ago.

Reviews.Title: “A Must If You Have Kids”
Reviews.Author: koo_clan
Reviews.Content: We book the Hotel Package that include breakfast & Stay2Day Hotel+Park. It was value for money. It was a fun filled experience for children to see their favourite cartoon character strolling from table to table hugging & teasing them during breakfast. A great way to start their morning. The hotel is very kid oriented, providing details like kids bathrobe, bedroom slipper. Staffs are ever ready to distribute disney stickers to children.

Reviews.Title: “No regret choosing this over Disney Hollywood hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cheery66
Reviews.Content: Hotel room is big and comfortable, very cOnvenIent to Disneyland and the bus is always on time. Felt like staying in a fairyland though Ordered room service which the food is OKAY. No surprises.. The only downside is the expensive rate but I guess its the standard rate in hong kong.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place and the kids loved it”
Reviews.Author: Alien2424
Reviews.Content: Brought our 2 kids for a short trip to Disneyland and stayed for 4 days. The place was nice and the staff were friendly and helpful. The place would be suitable for those with kids who want to visit Disneyland only.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoy it for the absolutely over the top Disney feel”
Reviews.Author: MissSue1
Reviews.Content: I loved this place. Having never stayed in a 'theme hotel' before I was blown away by the attention to detail given to making sure you had no chance of forgetting you were in a Disney experience. If you are going to get uptight about Pluto getting in your face before your first morning coffee, or annoyed when Goofy gives you attitude when you call him by the wrong name, then this is NOT the place for you, but if you can get into the spirit of things and just enjoy the complete over the top experience of Disney literally being everywhere, then you'll enjoy this place. Extremely easy to get to via train (which is wonderfully decked out) and shuttle bus. The staff are very friendly and while we had no use for the kid's club I did see the staff in there making huge efforts to make the kids feel welcome. Mickey is everywhere, in the carpets, in the wrought iron around the lift, in the tomato sauce in the bowl, even on the PA in the lift :) The Cinderella foyer was magical. Take a close look at what is hidden in the glass chandeliers! If you have kids who love Disney, I think they would love this place. Negatives: Food is expensive and choices are relatively limited. Disneyland itself disappointed. Maybe if I hadn’t been to Disneyland in LA I wouldn’t have minded as much, but there is only one ‘adrenalin’ ride at the park. It’s a long way out of HK proper, so I would only stay here for a planned Disneyland visit. I would recommend this hotel for families with the caveat that food is pricy and Disneyland itself wasn’t all that great.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel was so HOKEY it isnt funny!”
Reviews.Author: MadameCerette
Reviews.Content: We were shocked at the dreadful Hokey , trying to look like Disneyworld but not making it! we checked in after staying at the Mandarin Oriental and it was completely lacking in character! I hated it! We decided to go for high tea! EVERYTHING was made YESTERDAY - nothing was fresh and it cost a fortune NEVER AGAIN!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient hotel for access to Disneyland Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: ChrisNCL
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights after spending three nights in Hong Kong sightseeing. Access to the hotel was easy - we took the MTR to the park. The kids loved the Mickey Mouse themed train which took us the last stage from Sunny Bay. Getting to the hotel was easy using the nearby shuttle bus from the MTR station at the Park. Check-in was easy and the hotel plush and stylish - staff very helpful. Room was clean and well appointed. What disappointed us was the food choice. For our tastes only the "Enchanted Garden" fitted the bill but the bill caused us to rename it the "Enchanted Rip-off" as while the food choice was good you certainly paid for the Disney characters present at each meal. On the second day we opted for a late breakfast in the park and did the same for dinner. Dinner in the park - while not offering the buffet choice back at the hotel - for two adults and two children could be had for the price of one adult dinner back at the hotel! But as Disney know, the kids do love a meal where all of a sudden you can find Tigger at your table so you do have to grin and bear it occasionally as you wallet is gently freed of some cash. The other alternative is to stay off-site and commute to the park as the MTR link is c40 minutes from Hong Kong/Kowloon. However, for many people flying to the UK, us included, the convenience of being able to take a short taxi ride to the airport for your pre-midnight flight after a full day in the park makes an on-site hotel an attractive option. Certainly cannot fault the hotel for comfort, etc. but make sure you budget for breakfast/dinner or make alternative arrangements.

Reviews.Title: “Disneyland Hotel review”
Reviews.Author: vishalrpanchal
Reviews.Content: I went to this hotel for 4 days on my birthday as i wanted to celebrate my birthday in Disney Land and this hotel is very near to Disney Land. But it is toooo far from other Hongkong attractions. so i would recommend if u want to see hongkong then don't stay here as u will waste a lot of time in traveling. As far as the hotel is concerned, i found it a bit costly as compared to other hotels in hongkong. yes it is very clean, very good service is provided. Food is not that good, so so. Rooms are ok in size, not too big not too small.

Reviews.Title: “Great theme hotel”
Reviews.Author: abhishekg46
Reviews.Content: Best theme hotel I've ever seen. It's a combination of fun + luxury. great joy for kids. staff is really courteous. Rooms are huge in size. Really close to amusement park. Not too many options for food though. Difficult to find options for veg food.

Reviews.Title: “For the experience of magical world”
Reviews.Author: vivi003
Reviews.Content: We made enquire through the reservation centre and pricing was as quoted on the website with only expensive seaview rooms. I later surfed around and book through online portal PYOtravel.com; which was on nett price basis and graden view rooms were still available, with saving of easily 30-35% compared with booking through their reservation centre. Check in was smooth and we were offered to be upgraded to seaview rooms at HKD250 per night. We took the offer as it means higher floor and sea view at a discount. Overall rooms are ok but as other viewers had pointed it out, TV channels are limited to Disney channels; leaving mums & pops no entertainment at night. We did not take the breakfast as it's quite pricey; and photos with characters could be planned at the theme park. Due to the young age of our kids we chose to stay at the park; but after having the experience for our next visits we will stay out of park hotels; which would be cheaper and more choices for food, and the park is easily accessible through MRT.

Reviews.Title: “Specacular excellent food, lush green grounds”
Reviews.Author: RobynsRest
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights for a conference, shuttle bus out the front that takes you to Disneyland. Shuttle runs on a regular schedule.Staff helpful Swimming pool great for the children. Character Breakfast not to be missed, Dont forget your camera.Easy to get to take the Disney Train

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: gingerleaf
Reviews.Content: Cozy room with 2 very comfortable queen size beds. Love the little bedroom slippers provided for the kid. The little bunny towel they placed on the desk was a nice touch and it delighted my little princess. Bus service provided to Disneyland is a big plus. Staffs is extremely polite. Thumbs up.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel with excellent facilities”
Reviews.Author: SydneyS_k
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 4 day/ 3 night stop over at the Disneyland Hotel on the way back from the UK to Australia. We are so glad we made the stop. The hotel was extremely easy to get to, just a 25 min cab ride. The hotel is amazing, totally 5 star, especially on the Kingdom Club level where we stayed. The rooms are well appointed, only issue would be bed size, a double for 2 adults was a tight squeeze! Apart from that the room and bathroom were excellent. Room service was quick and the food delicious as was the food in the Grand Salon. A 2 day pass to Disneyland wasnt enough, we could have easily had another day there. Our 4 year old daughter was quite dazzled by everything and we intend to make this trip an annual thing now!

Reviews.Title: “Roomy, elegant and comfortable hotel!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: EastmeetsWestAB
Reviews.Content: We were allocated the ground floor room for our 1 night stay in the disneyland hotel. We were so worried that it will be so noisy!!! To my surprise, this was very quiet. One of my best night sleep. The room was roomy, very elegant and is not overdosed with disney characters. The bed is massive and is very comfortable. The bathroom was great. It comes with Jacuzzi corner bath and shower on the other side. The toiletries all comes with 7 dwarfs boxes. The hotel also provide slippers for you to use. The check-in staff is very friendly and make sure you are aware of all the important shows that you will need to see in Disneyland. Food in this hotel is ok but expensive. The treat is really the lower ground floor cafe where you can meet the disney characters during breakfast. It was good fun!!! The free shuttle provided by the hotel to and from disneyland is one of the plus. It makes going to disneyland so convenient.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME PLACE... WORTH EVERY PENNY SPENT”
Reviews.Author: Moiz4got
Reviews.Content: It is an amazing experience to stay at the DISNEYLAND HOTEL... I would recommend everyone to stay at this place and not the cheaper option of Hollywood disney land hotel. Amazing location... very child friendly place. there are disney characters roaming around while you are dinning or having breakfast at the hotel which gives great entertainment to childrens.

Reviews.Title: “Splendid stay, luxurious room, great location!!”
Reviews.Author: luvtravellin82
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for a night at the Disneyland Hotel. Had a room on the 7th Floor, and the room simply struck me dumbfounded. The moment I stepped into the room, I actually whooped so loud that I was sure the neighbours heard me. The room was so beautiful. It was so roomy, and the decor was simply breathtaking. I loved the fact that the furniture were of those classic European style which i absolutely adore. The bathroom even had a jacuzzi and tiny toiletries with pictures of the 7 dwarfs. I definitely had a good night rest at the hotel. Moreover, the restaurant that served breakfast also held photo taking sessions with the Disney characters which made breakfast entertaining. Overall, I'm glad i chose to stay at the Disneyland Hotel in Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “American Gem Transplanted to Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: RoadWarriorSingapore
Reviews.Content: We brought our children to HK Disneyland and wanted to stay close to the park for the experience and the convenience. Friends had told us that the Hollywood Disney hotel was crowded, not well maintained and had poor service, so we went with the Disneyland Hotel. We do not regret that choice. The staff is clearly experienced in dealing with the masses of Chinese and other guests, many of whom are difficult to deal with, but the staff come through with flying colors. The hotel and its staff's attention to detail to the primary guests, the children, is to be admired. Children's size waiting area for check in, children's size slippers, robes, dressing stands, the kid's club, the Princess makeover spa (which my boys did not want to be 50 feet of) and all of the other touches make it a wonderful experience. The only small nitpick is the price of the breakfast buffet, but for US$ 100 for 2 adults and 2 children, you get excellent food (Indian, Chinese, Japanese, Western) and excellent company (Mickey, Daisy, Goofy and Pluto). It's like the rest of the Disney experience - a little high priced, but reassuring and excellent quality. Adults just need to succumb to the mind numbing experience. Disney has come a long way since the horrible Chinese food at the EPCOT center in Orlando - this was light years beyond that. I hope they continue to keep up the good work!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent but costly”
Reviews.Author: Akshat T
Reviews.Content: Downside check in is at 3pm. Upside good breakfast where kids can interact with Disney characters. If you stay here and wish to save money dine at Chef Mickey which has same menu and 100 HK dollars cheap and yes veg dishes too. Also reserve seats day before as they can refuse you for dinner as they are flowing with guests,always. If traveling with kids prams are available at Disney so don't worry. Keep in mind that this is a closed area far from hong kong where even phone recharges,cigarettes ,water bottles are not available . For Fire works display seat yourself at about 7 pm in front of Fantasy land as the place is crowded with people sitting on road at about 7.30.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Excellent Excellent”
Reviews.Author: vyomesh
Reviews.Content: Excellent place for family with kids. Large beds, comfortable rooms, great food. idealy getaway. While they do not have room service, i suspect its more to do with gettig kids down in the lobby to interact and enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Little Girl's Heaven!”
Reviews.Author: peachsorbet
Reviews.Content: Went on the trip with my mum and my 4-yr old princess. And all of us were very impressed with the hotel and the whole disney-ness of the hotel! From the bedroom slippers... to the toiletries.. to the mirror (which had Snow White and her 7 dwarves engraved on)... to the little step stool for children to get to the sink (highly useful). It was sooo magical. The buffet breakfast at the hotel was wonderful as well with mickey-shaped pancakes and with Pluto, Goofy, Mickey & Minnie making their rounds to take photos with you. They were very organised about the breakfast photos and went around in sequence. There were a couple of rowdy kids who were running to grab a photo with Goofy while he was about to take a photo my daughter but he signalled them back to their table indicating that he'll be coming around soon. That definitely limited the chaos at breakfast. They were so strict that when we asked if we could get a photo with both Mickey & Minnie at breakfast... they said no. We were a little disappointed.. but I guess I could understand their difficulties. I'm deducting one-star though cos of the Prince Eric's playroom. Firstly, I could not find info about it in the bedroom and we only saw it when leaving the breakfast restaurant. It's basically a playroom with toys and no... we didn't see anyone chaperoning the children other than parents who just sitting around. When we entered, there was supposed to have been a guided activity where they were to make spiders. The guy who was in charge was late.. then he unethusiastically took out some pipe cleaners and started making his own spiders with them. Basically, the whole 'event' was so uninteresting and my daughter preferred the spiders I made for her. It wasn't well-led and many kids continued just doing their own things. Otherwise this is a once-in-a-lifetime experience! (It is rather painful on the pocket hence a once-in-a-lifetime expenditure too!)

Reviews.Title: “not as expected”
Reviews.Author: Vishalr
Reviews.Content: i expected luxury and good serive, which was missing. I had requested a early check-in, but i reached at 10.00 hours the normal check-in is at 14,00 hours and the rooms were give to me only at 15.00 hours.

Reviews.Title: “Back to Childhood at hotel disney”
Reviews.Author: Tanya030
Reviews.Content: Our family really enjoyed our time at Disneyland Hongkong. I had the opportunity to stay at the Hongkong Disney Resort in April. The room was clean, relaxing, and cute. The room rate is so expensive, but worth! The staff was very fantastic. The pool area was large with nice sea view. Transportation from hotel to Disney is free and easy. We absolutely loved staying here and defintely will be back again.

Reviews.Title: “Everything you'd expect from Disney”
Reviews.Author: finendandy21
Reviews.Content: The hotel stay was an extension of the Disneyland theme park experience. Everything in the hotel was well thought out to cater to Disney fans young and old (especially the young!). From the little TV corner next to check-in built specially for the little ones (TV a foot off the ground, chairs for little kids) to activity rooms for the kids to having Disney characters roaming the dining room during breakfast. For grown ups, there is a spa (which we didn't have time to try) and free internet connection in the rooms for when the kids hog the TV to watch the DIsney Channel (but bring your own laptop). Even the telelphone in the room comes with a video display that has a storytelling button to keep the kids occupied when the TV is off. All in, it was a pleasant stay for me as a parent with hyperactive kids. With all other families there seemingly in the same circumstance, I didn't have to worry at all about my kids being too loud, or running around too much or making too much of a mess during meals. To get to Disneyland park itself, there is a shuttle bus that leaves every 10 mins making a loop between the 2 Disneyland hotels and the theme park. Super convenient. The only downside is that it is a resort hotel with nothing else to do besides what's on offer at the hotel itself. Food is overpriced but that's what you get at the theme park so it's all part of the Disney experience. To wander further from the hotel, take the shuttle bus to the Public Transport Interchange (next to Dsineyland Park) and then catch an MTR to Tung Chung Station (1 stop away). Ngong Ping Village is there and there's a great 6km cable car ride that gives you great views from up high. Connected to the MTR station is a big outlet mall with a food court, supermarket and the inevitable McDonald's for those with kids who cannot live without Happy Meals.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, child-friendly and absolute fake (but that's okay!)”
Reviews.Author: Family-travellerNL
Reviews.Content: We combined a Disneyland visit with a sleepover in the Disney hotel (pay attention to the fact that there are two hotels; the other one is called Hollywood). It is a rebuilt Victorian mansion-like hotel, but they did an excellent job and they used good quality materials. Despite the fact that everything is new, you get the whole package of thick carpet, marble, chandeliers, 'antique' furniture, piano player in the lobby etc. There are paintings on the walls suggesting the hotel has been there for centuries with 19th(?) century ladies strolling along the hotel. Classical Disney tunes in all the hallways... Just go along and take it all with a huge (magical) smile. The rooms are large enough to accomodate a family of four. We had a standard room with two double beds. Beds a bit on the hard side, but nice pillows. Bathroom with lots of marble, fluffy towels, Snow White themed mirror and bathroom supplies, good shower (although in the bathtub). The pool area is nice but small. Kids liked the water slide although not really spectacular. Small playground next to the pool also nice. We also went to the kids play room (no extra charge, but you have to stay with them). Quite basic for a kids club: colouring, some toys, wooden play store... We came in twice but there was nothing 'organised' those times. Kids were not allowed in the 'haunted halloween area' that was covering part of the room... Staff was friendly, but with all parents there they seemed a bit bored. Next door you could do a make-over princess session (extra charge), which looked nice (but daughter (almost 8) thought she was too old for that anyway... Staff (restaurants, reception, door) was all very friendly and helpful. We had the dinner buffet with the Disney figures, which was great. Our toddler loved it! He would chase them and hug them (and they let him). Of course there is a photographer tagging along, offering adorable pictures and key chains for 'adorable' prices. But they are not pushy if you don't want to buy it, and you can take your own photos. The buffet was varied enough en tasty (nice desserts as well!). Kids buffet was lower, so they could help themselves. In the morning we had the breakfast buffet offered in the lobby/lounge area (without the Disney figures). A bit limited compared to other hotels I stayed in (eg no eggs/pancakes), but decent enough. All in all I thought the whole hotel was a very nice experience.

Reviews.Title: “Property not upto my expectation”
Reviews.Author: abvb21
Reviews.Content: Hong Kong Disneyland has made an excellent web-site to promote their property. The pictures of the rooms that they have shown in their web-site are huge and very attractive. The rooms that we got is below average than what has been shown. We were upgraded from a garden view room to a fantisia room, but this room also did not meet our expectation. The hotel is not at all worth the price that we paid for it. We stayed at this property expecting it to be inside the disneyland park, but it is not so. One can easily travel from kowloon or hong kong to visit the park. there is no need to stay at this property.

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay - for young and old”
Reviews.Author: sunitam_3
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the disneyland hotel at hong kong with our 4 yr old daughter, beautiful hotel and we had a wonderful stay there even though for only a night, our daughter thought she was staying in a castle !! be sure to do breakfast with the disney characters... bit pricey but worth the experience

Reviews.Title: “Unforgettable!”
Reviews.Author: Prakash51
Reviews.Content: Excellent service, superb location and outstanding architecture. What more can you ask?

Reviews.Title: “It's a Magical Stay ...”
Reviews.Author: robynn99
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel after reading the reviews here and the experience had gone beyond our expectations! We had a birthday celebration for our son at the Enchanted Garden restaurant and it was truly wonderful and special. My toddler son who turns 2 was especially delighted to see all the characters at the restaurant Even my husband and myself enjoyed ourselves very much. The food at the restaurant is delicious! And not forgetting the birthday room decor which had thrilled our son once we entered the room. We met many characters in the hotel restaurant and lobby, so we did not have to queue for it when we were at the park. The staffs are great, from chambermaid to phone operator, they are all so helpful and friendly. One drawback though, as I made reservation through online, they took almost 3 days to reply all my different queries! Overall, it was still a magical stay ! When we asked our son whether he want to go back to disneyland, he said: again!

Reviews.Title: “great place”
Reviews.Author: drparmod
Reviews.Content: drparmod,chandigarh,india------ i stayed at hotel disneyland,hongkong along with my wife ,son (14 yrs) and daughter(11yrs). the place is so relaxing and child friendly.it made us also to feel like small children especially at breakfast.we were clicking photos with cartoon characters like children. the rooms are done properly and food was also excellent.they have excellent arrangement to ferry us to disneyland.

Reviews.Title: “My only regret was not staying longer!”
Reviews.Author: Swamp_Donkey66
Reviews.Content: We stayed at HK Disney hotel for 2 nights with our children. We had a Kingdom Suite room, which was not cheap however was sensational. The room itself was huge and split into a bedroom and lounge area, allowing my youngest to get an early night whilst the rest of us stayed up and watched a movie. The Kingdom club facilities were brilliant, with a surprisingly good breakfast buffet and snacks and drinks all day. Check in/out was a breeze as it is done in the club and not the main reception which did look very crowded. The hotels best asset by far was the staff. Nothing was too much trouble and my toddler could barely go 2 minutes without a staff member doting on her and giving her stickers. Even the gardeners and maintenance guys would stop and say hello. She LOVED the attention. (note the same can be said for the Disney park staff - also great) At night the Kingdom club staff read the kids stories and mickey would come to say goodnight in his PJs while we relaxed with complimentary drinks. We had a 2 day park pass and found our biggest challenge was that we didn't have enough time to fully take advantage of all the hotel had to offer. If I were to go again I would stay a 3rd day just to let the kids swim, do the activities, princess dressups etc. At the park there are big queues for photos with the characters, so we did the Enchanted Garden dinner buffet with the characters. This is also brilliant. Again it's not cheap but I have paid a lot more in other cities for less. The food selection and quality is great, more importantly the characters run around and play with the kids, keeping them enthralled and allowing the whole family a wonderful meal. A couple of tips - (1) Buy a park season pass for one of your party, it saves money on both the room rates and food. Even though it's pretty unlikely we'll use it again it saved us a fortune. (2) ignore the hotel shuttle bus to the park. It's a battle to get on and the park is 700m from the hotel door. It's a beautifully landscaped walk with fountains and way nicer than the bus option. My 3 yr old did the walk easily.

Reviews.Title: “Magical stay”
Reviews.Author: Sydneymum09
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel - it makes a great stopover on the way back to Australia. The service was excellent, the food was top notch, and children are sincerely welcomed and catered for. The hotel is beautiful -reminding me of a big historic American hotel. The interiors are stunning and luxurious -and the pool and slide are great too. My only complaint would be the hard beds, which are typical of China and Hong Kong. Disneyland was great fun too. Our 5 and 8 year old daughters had the time of their lives.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: akoh
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the HK Disneyland Hotel for 2 nights in early Jun 2010 with 2 kids. We booked a garden view room. Upon check-in, without even telling us, we were given a room with a balcony and partial sea view, a bit far from the lobby though. Room is clean, roomy with 2 double beds good for 2A+2C. Victorian themed instead of Disney themed. Staff was polite and helpful. Very frequent shuttle bus to the Park entrance. My son liked the breakfast with Disney characters at the Enchanted Garden. Food was so so, like a typical 4-star hotel BB. Was expecting better quality and variety for the price I paid. Next time, I'll most probably stay at the Hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome! Can't wait to visit again!”
Reviews.Author: rpjy66
Reviews.Content: All I can say is that the hotel is a wonderful experience for all ages! It is not cheap but I think it was worth every dollar spent for my mother, my two young children and myself. Service - As other reviewers have pointed out, the queue at the reception can be quite long, but the service staff are efficient and polite. I had booked a Sea View room but was given a Garden View one. When I highlighted this to the reception staff, she quickly apologized and corrected the booking. We later found that we were given a corner Sea View room, which is actually more expensive than the regular one that we had paid for. On one of the evenings we were there, I was struggling to carry my stroller up the staircase from the outdoor maze to the lobby. One of the hotel's staff literally ran up and helped me with it, I hadn't even noticed that there was anyone else around! Rooms - big, clean and decorated tastefully in line with the hotel's VIctorian theme. Huge bathroom with jacuzzi and shower. Disney-theme toiletries and child-size robes, slippers and step-stool are nice touches :) Free broadband internet is great. We can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “It is worth an experience of a lifetime for your kids”
Reviews.Author: remalsekar
