Reviews.Content: DisneyLand Hotels in the Disneyland Campus provide you an experience of a different theme world, in particular for your kids. The Disneyland flavor is maintained in the hotels, various food options are available. I found the prices on the higher side, but then all good things come at a price.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Magical”
Reviews.Author: Anna1834
Reviews.Content: We stayed here overnight as part of a Room+ 2 Disnleyland Tickets. We stayed in a Kingdom Club Suite and the whole experience was incredible. The Suite was stunning with a beautiful view, comfortable king-sized bed, and huge tv+ dvd player (you can rent dvds for free from the Kingdom Club if you are staying on this floor). The Kingdom Club was worth paying extra for, it provided complimentary food and drinks all day/ night. There were delicious breakfasts and the snacks throughout the day were ok. However, the h'ordeourves at night and wine/ beer were the best, we had a great evening watching the fireworks from the private balcony. Booking a Kingdom Club room means you get free spa access- to use the jacuzzi, steam room, and nice change room- this was an added bonus. The hotel was nice enough to hold our baggage when we checked out and went to Disneyland on the second day- and let us shower in the pool change rooms when we returned (nice touch before our flight) The pool area was lovely- particularly as it was 35 degrees both days. The only complaint was it was really hot to be walking around Disneyland- we came back early- this isnt the hotels fault though :) Great stay- would highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Zuggy2000
Reviews.Content: Reasonable place to stay if you prefer to spend majority of your time in theme park. However, I think to visit another hotel of Disney next time if I can.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING”
Reviews.Author: sitasrivalli
Reviews.Content: Fantastic interiors. wonderful service and ambience. seven star experience. go for it

Reviews.Title: “When in Disneyland, do what Mickey Mouse would do :-)”
Reviews.Author: NODDY27
Reviews.Content: We had planned our trip to Hong Kong and after 4 tiring days (2 in HK and 2 in Macau) were looking forward to our trip's last-part- Disneyland. We booked Disneyland Hotel a month is advance and got some decent deal with a 2-day pass. The hotel is excellent and is a must for kids- breakfast with Disney characters; enjoying in the pool; shopping at the souvenir shop. The best part is their preparedness for a wheel-chair guest. My mother uses a wheelchair and everything at the hotel has provisions for such guests- rooms; rest-rooms; even the complimentary shuttle to the park has a provision.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay in the better of the 2 Hotels there”
Reviews.Author: manshus
Reviews.Content: Hotel was charming, even though check-in is late. All the Disney stuff though cheesy - was truely enjoyed by the kids. Loved the Mickey Maze out back, our boys enjoyed the pool, the buffet was excellent. Overall a very kid friendly hotel, and less flashy & loud compared to the other one there.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Family Friendly Hotel”
Reviews.Author: travelwell2007
Reviews.Content: If you have young children - this hotel is excellent. We stayed on the Club level of the hotel and every day was a new adventure for our children. The rooms are large and family friendly, some with balconies overlooking the sea. Fireworks every night at 7.30 pm. You can dine with the characters - worth doing at least once if you have kids who are fans of disney. The staff are excellent and this is honestly the best way to enjoy the disneyland experience. Wonderful grounds, great pool, excellent easy and enjoyable walking to the Park, by the sea and in the grounds. Food quality did vary - excellent on the club level and in the buffet with the characters, the chinese restaurant was ok, with service that was ok, the lounge restaurant provided very poor service and food. Overall though - it did not matter as the hotel was a wonderful experience with very friendly and helpful service staff.

Reviews.Title: “Good for families. The kids will love it.”
Reviews.Author: AdelaideAnita
Reviews.Content: My family has just stayed here in peak season. The hotel and Disneyland were both very busy, but our family enjoyed our stay. The staff were friendly and helpful. We had the buffet breakfast at the Enchanted Garden restaurant, which includes appearances by Disney characters. Our kids loved this experience, but I thought it was expensive for rather average food. We booked a sea view room with a balcony. In hindsight, this wasn't really necessary as it was too hot to use the balcony. We were given a room with more pool views than sea views, so I would go with the garden view next time to save money. The large number of families meant that there was a lot of noise, but this quietens down when all the kids are put to bed. The pool was excellent and we ate at the poolside cafe a few times, which was less expensive than the other hotel restaurants. Overall, we had a great holiday and the kids were very reluctant to leave.

Reviews.Title: “Tips when staying at HKDisneyland Hollywood Hotel”
Reviews.Author: yunesa
Reviews.Content: This is my second time to visit HK and my second time to visit HK Disneyland Hollywood hotel. On both trips we stayed for more than two days. Tips when you stay at this hotel/resort: 1. When we stayed here way back in October 2009, it's less busier. There are more guests during the months of June than October. We have to line up for more than 30 minutes before we were entertained. We were one of those who have to leave our luggage at the counter and come back after 3pm (this is the official time of check-in). We came back after eating lunch at the Corner Cafe on Main street and returned at 4 pm and checked in and rested for nearly the whole afternoon. Even rides and attractions are busier. So tip #1 stay during the months of October instead of the summer months. And if it's your first time in HK do not just stay overnight...there are a lot of things to do and to see so, take your time to experience fun and relaxation whther inside the park or within the hotel premises and if you are the type that gets bored easily, stay for another two days at a downtown hotel or the other Disneyland hotel. It's worth being a child again...like myself. 2. There are two restaurants that offers buffet breakfast (one at Chef Mickey's and the other at the Enchanted Garden- located at the Disneyland hotel NOT at the Hollywood hotel) and if you were to compare their breakfast rates, they are more expensive compared to burgers, pasta and the like at the park. We paid HK$135 per person at Chef Mickey's and HK$207 per person at the Enchanted Garden. Enchanted Garden has more menu/food selection than Chef Mickey's and if you would like to meet and take photos along with Disney Characters then Enchanted Garden is the place for you because they come to your table and greet everyone-- that is an advantage if you would like to be up close and personal with these characters, no need to line up like those at the park. We had one breakfast at Chef Mickeys and the other at the Enchanted Garden. I like Enchanted Garden the fod and ambiance of Enchanted Garden more. Dining hours for breakfast at the 1st floor of Disneyland Hotel has two rounds: 8-930 am and the other 10 am to 11:30 am. It's better to choose the first round as park hours starts at 10:30am and you wouldn't want to miss your time while you are there. This is the drawback for taking a breakfast at the Enchanted Garden. Your time is limited. In the meantime, dining hours for Chef Mickey's starts at 7am to 10 am - you can show up anytime during those times. Prepare to take photos even at breakfast. 3. Unless you specify they will give only one pillow for every person in the room. We were given only 4 pillows for 4 adults. See to it that you specify your requirements upon check-in. 4. We found out that the shop inside the hotel have some items/clothes on sale. Take advantage of this as some were taged only for 3 for HK$100 instead of the usual HK$160 or HK$180 per item at the park. I also found out that Disney store inside the airport are much cheaper than those at the park. Sad to say, I have limisted HK$ left and bought most of what I needed inside the park. Now I know better.... 5. No room service, no fitness center and spa at this hotel. The fitness center and the spa are located at the other hotel- the Disneyland Hotel not at the Hollywood hotel. So in both visits, I have to be picked up from the Hollywood hotel to the Disney hotel. I was thankful as it's complimentary. Watch out though as a simple Swedish massage can cost you HK$900++ for an hour (approximately more than U$D110). As a spa consultant, this is another story. More of this when I review their Victorian inspired spa. 6. There are no health/medical care center or day care center only an activity center for kids. But then again, who would want to leave their kids behind such a place as this? 7. There are a lot of nice spots at the back of the Hollywood hotel overlooking the HK bay. So walk outside the hotel lobby and get farther down --- after the piano-shaped pool. 8. Not for people who loves the nightlife or downtown clubs and shopping. This is more of a fantasy, children's park/place and for families, childlike adults like me..... 9. At the back of the hotel are more picturesque views like those vintage cars, the view of HK bay with tall buidlings, etc. So prepare to take photos and do not leave your camera behind. 10. There was a cute animal designed towel inside the toilet and did not realize until I arrived home that there is a workshop on how you can learn to make towel design animals at the other hotel (Prince Eric activities room at the Disneyland hotel) and there is also a demonstration on how you can prepare paper mirror with decorative effect available for the whole family including teens. There are a lot of good activities to attend inside the hotel (activities only lasts about 30-45 minutes) only if you read the hotel information paper- just ask the concierge for a copy. 11. If you are a first time visitor in HK here is my tip for you to maximize your stay: stay for two days at Disney Hollywood Hotel, then another two days at the other Disney hotel spend all of these four days either at the park or just enjoying the hotel's amenities, food at the park and activities and then stay in another downtown hotel for another three days to experience tours and trips to other HK destinations including the monastery, cable car rides, downtown shopping, Ocean Park, helicopter ride, etc. All in all, in order to maximize your travel to HK, you need a minimum of seven days. So far what I have read from almost all of the reviews of others were true so its really good to read and get to know what people have experienced before you book your hotel here as this is not the hotel or place for everyone. In my case, I have no grand expectations except to write or blog about my experiences here, learn something new from my field, do a bit of some business and be a child again...and because I wil be returning soon, next time I would try the other hotel- the Disney hotel.....

Reviews.Title: “disney hotel is the best..”
Reviews.Author: ChinaRockstar
Reviews.Content: Disneyland hotel is the best hotel in hongkong.This hotel is full of leisure.comfort and entertainment for childrens and teenagers.I will surely recommend this hotel to others , so that they can also enjoy the ultimate leisure which i enjoyed there.The only problem i face was problem of food.I could'nt get any indian food available there.but it is full of entertainment for childrens and there parents.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel for Small & Big Kids”
Reviews.Author: OrawanK
Reviews.Content: My children loves this hotel. There are so many things for small kids to do there. Plus, it is so close to Hong Kong Disneyland. Breakfast buffet was great.

Reviews.Title: “We expected much more from a Disney Hotel”
Reviews.Author: h0lidayplan
Reviews.Content: The hotel was overpriced for the room size and quality. Except for the music & meeting the characters at specified times, there wasn't so much of Disney feel to it. We had to pay additional for the breakfast with Disney characters & after that there was no Minnie or Donald.

Reviews.Title: “so so”
Reviews.Author: shakungifts
Reviews.Content: The disney hotel we stayed for 1 night with children visited disney land in the day was quite small and disappointed with the place payed almost 175 usd for a family with 2 children but the place was quite small .check in at the hotel only at 3 pm so had to dumb bags in the reception the pool is good in the hotel over all only one time stay aviodable hk disney land

Reviews.Title: “Disneyland fun”
Reviews.Author: pareshMumbai
Reviews.Content: Excellent Hotel. Great service. Sheer out of fairyland story...... You can even find Indian food at the hotel restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “fairyland experience for kids and brings out the child in you...!”
Reviews.Author: rajajain
Reviews.Content: lovely experience interacting with disney characters. delightful to watch your children relish the time with mickey, daisy and goofy the chef during breakfast. check in time is 3 pm. suggest arrive by 0930am, leave the luggage and proceed to the park, return around 5, check in, get fresh and return to the park to experience the breathtaking fireworks.... the property is nice, clean but a bit expensive but worth the experience provided

Reviews.Title: “An awsome place to enjoy your bisiness meetings with pleasure of vacation”
Reviews.Author: Vinodraib
Reviews.Content: An awsome service by this great property in Disneyland. Although 10 of us were staying and attending our annual seminar for 3 days, we never felt that we are in so serious discussion since as soon as we come out of the meeting, the entire environment brings you down to the vacation mood...this is perfect place with a blend of leasure pleasure and for serious business discussion. An outstanding food which is very rare in most tourist destinations like this where people visit for vacation but not much for business. However, this is an exception.

Reviews.Title: “better of the two hotels but lacking disney character”
Reviews.Author: skhemka
Reviews.Content: better of the two hotels but lacking disney character

Reviews.Title: “NOT the happiest place on earth”
Reviews.Author: jialoong
Reviews.Content: Called the hotel hotline to book. The lady could not find my records (stayed there twice before). I kept insisting that they find my records as i wanted to book the same room I had before and she eventually found it. When i booked the room, she told me that i needed to get the higher end rooms as it was fully booked and i wasn't entitled to any discounts (35% for annual pass holder) as the "budget rooms" are all taken. Was trying very hard to upsell me. I got pissed and ended the conversation. Booked through the internet. Got the room i wanted and everything was settled in slightly more than 5 mins (wasted 15 mins with the lady over the phone). Requested for a seaview with balcony kingdom club room but was assigned a garden view. They did changed the room for me at night though. The major thing i want to point out is...the employees rarely smile, the cast at disneyland park lacked passion, was just going through motion....in fact, many of them look moody. Same goes for the hotel staff. Only two were smiley, the front desk lady that checked me in (although assigned me the wrong room) and the lady that did the make-up for our little gal (our little gal took the "little princess" makeover and photoshoot session). The drivers looked impatient and moody. When we walked by the chambermaids, we smiled but they ignored us (and they looked gloomy). The folks at the kingdom club lounge were not friendly. The hotel staff would only acknowledge you if you speak to them, if not, they just ignore you. Why is everyone (almost) so moody? The worst was the lady trying to sell the pictures of photos of our little girl in her princess outfit to us. We felt sad after talking to her. No passion, eyes looked blank, couldn't be bothered attitude, short curt answers, we spent at least 20 mins with her and NOT ONE SMILE.... How can the place be happy if the staff are not..... Wake up Disney.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Family Vacation with Kids < 10”
Reviews.Author: M0mmyDearest
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for 5 days, 4 nights. For some, this might be a little too much Disneyland but it was my 7 yo first trip abroad. I am very picky at hotels and would only stay at Sofitel or Makati Shang in Manila. So Disneyland Hotel was the hotel of choice and not Hollywood Hotel. Arrived at the hotel before 10am as we took the 620am flight out of Manila. Check in was easy and hassle free. I attribute this to the day we checked in - Monday. We were given a room immediately. I asked for a Star Guest pass and received the pass, a roll of stickers, a birthday badge (for my 7 yo) and more stickers. Who could ask for more? Our room was the cheapest one - Garden View. It was comfortable for 4 people as it had 2 double beds. Considerably bigger by HK standards. Bathroom has a bathtub, a spacious counter and was roomy overall. Housekeeping was very prompt, a 10 min wait is long. I asked for 4 more sets of pillows, 2 sets of toiletries, an additional bathrobe and extra slippers for my 7 yo. All my requests were attended to with utmost promptness and courtesy. We got a rabbit for the animal towel and a towel cake plus birthday card for my bday celebrant. We enjoyed the pool. They had an outdoor and an indoor pool. However, the towels seem to have been left out in the open a day too long as they stink. The Mickey Maze was fun as well. We went out on a Monday and my daughter had the maze all to herself. Next to the maze is a gate that leads out to a pathway along the South China Sea. My dad enjoyed this space every morning, as he wakes up very early in the morning. He would sit by the sea and enjoy the sunrise with his morning paper while waiting for us sleepyheads to wake up. Even 67 year olds have a place to go! The food is another story. It was monotonous, imagine staying for 5 days and eating the same breakfast. There are cheaper dining options by Hollywood Hotel. Consider going there for lunch or dinner. Chef Mickey is good by itself. Hollywood and Dine is the fastfood restaurant. Not too many choices here though. We tried the Character Bfast at Enchanted Garden. Was a bit disappointed as there was only Mickey, Goofy and Pluto. We were hoping to see Minnie, Donald or Daisy instead of the 2 dogs. I think you'll have more luck with dinner as we saw Winnie and Minnie one time. Or better yet, ask ahead and make sure the characters you want to see would be there when you are. I honestly don't think that the buffets are overpriced for the place. Most expensive buffet was at HK$250 or around P1500. This is cheaper than Makati Shang or Sofitel. Buy your merchandise at the hotel shops so you dont have to lug them around at the park. Although for hotel guests, you can ask the park shops to deliver your purchases to your hotel. The hotel shops have mostly whats available in the park. If they dont have it, you can ask them to get it. I also availed of the pay 510 for 600 purchase offer. Browse the HKDL website for other offers as well. By the way, they run Disney the whole day in one channel. So be prepared to watch Chip and Dale episodes over and over again. They have free internet in the rooms though. So you can entertain yourself with your laptop once the television has been sequestered. The other days we werent at the park, we were out shopping. We spent one day at Tsim Sha Tsui for good ole haggle shopping. Another day we spent exploring Ngong Ping Cable Cars and the Citigate Outlet Malls. This is very accessible to HKDL. HKDL has their own MTR stop. You will see the MTR station before you even get to the HKDL entrance. Take the very Mickey train to Tung Chung. From here, you cant miss the outlet malls and the cable cars. The Outlet Mall has a floor dedicated to sports wear. You'll find Nike, Adidas, World Balance, Puma, Reebok, K Swiss. They have great brands like Mango, Giordano, Clarks, Coach. You can spend a whole day here so bring plastic money. If you need to save some money, eat your meals at Tung Chung. There's KFC, McDonalds and most other good restaurants. You can even go out after the fireworks and still make dinner at Tung Chung, its that near! HKDL runs their shuttle service until 12 midnight. So no worries about going back to the hotel at all. You can make arrangements if you plan to arrive past 12 midnight so they can pick you up. Only real complain I have is that 2 people from our party got what looked like bedbug bites. Not sure though if this was from the pool or the room itself.

Reviews.Title: “Victorian style luxury in Hong Kong Disneyland.”
Reviews.Author: Chuecy
Reviews.Content: We visited HK Disneyland in January and stayed at this hotel. When we arrived we decided to pay extra for a seaview room. It looked like a corner room. It was spacious with a very comfortable king bed and jacuzzi in the bathroom. The windows, furniture and bathroom are victorian style which is different from the modern designer style of other hotels. In addition to the usual bathrobes and slippers for adults, there was a kid size bathrobe and a pair of kid size mickey mouse slippers for our toddler. Nice touch! It's very convenient to go to Disneyland, just hop on the free shuttle bus outside the entrance which also takes you to Disney's Hollywood Hotel. We didn't eat at Disneyland Hotel as we found it too expensive. Instead we took the shuttle bus and had buffet breakfast at Hollywood Hotel. The food was very good and less expensive. There are also some restaurants and fast food in Disneyland but charging tourist prices. Be sure to take the Ngong Ping cable car while you are at lantau island. Go on a weekday morning to avoid the crowd and you can get a cable car to yourself. The cable cars are big and the scenery is nice. Nothing much to see at the temple end though except a giant Buddha statue.

Reviews.Title: “come and live with all the disney characters”
Reviews.Author: dhruvkheterpal
Reviews.Content: good hotel but over priced.isd phonecalls are very expensive.food is good they serve buffet which has lot of indian curries and dal.rooms are small but good view.

Reviews.Title: “The kids will love it!”
Reviews.Author: homsingapore
Reviews.Content: Beautiful & tranquil hotel with a big lobby area. Concierge staff are professional (don't expect warm personalised service though) but felt that the check-in/check-out process is somewhat slow considering that there’s not even a queue when we are there. Family-friendly facilities with indoor & outdoor pool with water slides, playground, garden with maze, numerous activities for the children around the hotel and Disney character at the hotel lobby at certain timings for photo taking. The lobby store sells Disney souvenirs too although you can find a wider variety at the park itself. Pros of shopping at the hotel would be it’s less crowded at the hotel & you can leave the merchandise at the hotel instead of carrying it all the way with you if you buy from the park. I realised I got the wrong size for my girl’s T- shirt which I bought at the park when I was packing my luggage & they allow customers to change at the hotel’s store without the need to return to the same store at the park for exchange. Rooms are kids-friendly with 2 queen size beds in the room (connecting rooms available upon request). Spacious & cozy bathrooms with well stock-up of toiletries. Very thoughtful to provide a standing stool for young kids & plastic cup although not sure why only 1 is provided so my young twins had to take turns to use the cup. Slippers (for guest to bring home) and bathrobes are available for the kids as well. The TV size is good and you can get Disney Cartoon TV channels for kids. The only flaw with the room would be the dusty drawers & cabinets. I pulled out a coaster from the drinks cabinet and to my surprise, dirt started flying before my eyes & the coaster is also covered in dust. Disneyland is very near to the airport so the trip from airport cost only HKD110. It’s a wiser choice compared to taking train as you have to change train 2 times before you reach the park & then hop on to the free shuttle bus to the hotel (every 10-15 mins interval) dragging your luggage all the way. I wonder why Disneyland station wasn’t being placed in a more strategic MTR line. The shuttle bus service is just outside the hotel covering 3 areas in the order of Disneyland Park -> Disneyland hotel -> Disney’s Hollywood hotel. Rates for Disneyland hotel is more expensive compared to Disney’s Hollywood hotel but the exterior, interior décor and furnishing explains it all.

Reviews.Title: “Superbly magical!”
Reviews.Author: lmptorres
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hong Kong Disneyland Hotel (in a Balcony Seaview Room) and it is worth the price difference of staying either in Kowloon or another hotel in Lantau. I travelled with 2 daughters aged 7 and 3 and it was a princess's dream hotel. (for bigger kids, or for families with boys, I have no doubt that the Hollywood hotel is just as super).The room was quite big for HK standards. Towels were new, toiletries were enough, even an extra pillow was provided for! Check in was a breeze and the hotel staff helpful and friendly all throughout. They have stickers for the kids as well as hotel activities like bedtime stories in a function room at 9PM. The pool was huge and heated, and children can play in a bigger part of the pool (unlike other hotel where the kids are is a tiny space). Truly, there isnt a more child friendly hotel than this. The food was also good. It is a bit expensive since there is no restaurant outlet outside the park, but it was also OK. You wont feel cheated out of your HK100 for a meal since it was enough. Breakfast at Enchanted Garden was wonderful! The added bonus was that the food was great. American, Indian, and Chinese selections were very tasty. I suggest you go there at 8AM and have a nice leisurely breakfast with the characters until 9:30. The shuttle buses to and from the Park were also round the clock and on time, so that was great.

Reviews.Title: “This is the place to stay if visiting Disneyland”
Reviews.Author: MidwestTony1969
Reviews.Content: If you've ever been to Disney World in Orlando you'll find that this hotel is based on a scaled down version of the Grand Floridian hotel. The Disney area is relatively close to the airport (about 15 minutes) and you can either take a cab (about $25US but be sure to ask the price before to avoid getting ripped off) or a train but if you take the train you have to go past the disney exit and backtrack one stop...it's odd to me that Disney didn't require a stop specifically for them on the Airport Express...plus there is no signage at the airport to help you figure out how to get to Disney...do your homework... You can get anywhere downtown from the hotel by using the MTR (Disney station to Sunny Bay...which then takes you in to HK) but it will take you about 35 minutes...very clean, efficient and cheap. As for the hotel, it was immaculate. The room was just okay, typical room but the view was great, but you pay for it. The few things that bothered me most were: No wi-fi in the room but it's free in the lobby (although you do get free internet in the room, just not wireless), the bed is like sleeping on a rock but that is probably just the way they are in this part of the world, not sure...if you want to eat you have no choice but to eat at their restaurant and breakfast, which was a character buffet, cost me $35US...the hotel and park is not close to anything so once you are there, you are stuck if you are hungry...finally, they did not have any place to buy snacks, drinks, etc...or at least I couldn't find any so do yourself a favor and pick something up when in HK and bring it back with you. As for getting around...you will have to take the bus that picks up outside the hotel and it will take you to the park entrance...you will make one stop at the Hollywood hotel on the way...it was a minor inconvenience but the alternative was a 20-30 minute walk...overally, it was a nice hotel and I'm happy I stayed at it for the Disney experience.

Reviews.Title: “Have a Magical Day!”
Reviews.Author: Madamjojo1
Reviews.Content: We were impressed with this hotel from the moment we arrived. The staff are friendly, efficient and extremely helpful, the food was superb and the hotel room was clean and comfortable with 2 double beds. The hotel caters very well for families with young children with lots of organised activities, child friendly food and play areas. Disney characters make an appearance at breakfast and dinner and were very affectionate towards the children. Their costumes are realistic looking and they stick to their character roles very well. I highly recommend this hotel to any family thinking of attending Disneyland Park as the free shuttle bus that runs every 10 mins was a bonus!

Reviews.Title: “A Childs paradise”
Reviews.Author: Abbey_8
Reviews.Content: The location and attention to children in service is what makes this memorable. From the disney characters who attend dinner and breakfast in the Chef Mickey Restaurant to the small waterslide and numerous lifeguards in the pool. The attention to making sure children enjoy their stay is amazing. 11,9 and 6 year old loved this - stayed 3 nights. The location means that we were able to go home at lunch and return back at night for the fireworks at Disneyland. Chef Mickey restaurant and staff delightful sushimi for adults and Mickey shaped waffles and pizza for children - every age group happy

Reviews.Title: “A magical experience - only at Disney”
Reviews.Author: jennydj
Reviews.Content: It was peak season and although the queue was long, we were accomodated rather quickly by hotel staff. The kiddies loved the hotel - the personalized service, the soft beds and the big bathroom. Slippers (that you can take home) and bathrobes were available for the kids. Of course, they loved the playroom and the maze. When the kids were asleep, it was convenient for hubby and I to sneak out for a quick drink at the Sorcerer's Lounge which was open till 12:30 AM. Some tips: If your celebrating a special birthday, take the celebration package for a night -the decor in the room and dinner with the Characters along with cake and other freebies was a great experience for the family. Take the 8:30 - 10:30 PM slot as most of the guests are gone by 9:30 and only a few guests are still dining. Hence, MIckey and pals have few tables to greet - including yours which result in lots of pictures. With this, we didn't even need to line up to take pictures with the Characters when we were in the Resort. Book in advance for the restaurant as it gets filled up. Purchase the Star Pass - you'll love the convenience in the Resort. In the Resort, use the fast track machine as much as you can to avoid long lines. When you buy something in the stores, you can ask the Cashier to deliver the goods to your Disney Hotel so you need not lug around heavy packages while going around the Resort. When your in the hotel, ask reception if you can get a star guest lineyard for the kids - there's lots of freebies and surprises both at the Resort and at the hotel. Characters visit the Hotel Lobby after park hours and at 11:00 AM. Bring your camera and be ready to smile a lot. For tourists to HK (like myself) who don't want to bring home extra HK Dollars, you can opt to pay in cash first - yes, including the coins and pay the balance via credit card. Don't forget to reserve at least HK$200.00 for airport cab. A great experience - another small surprise was that you can bring home the key cards as a souvenir.

Reviews.Title: “fabulous and fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Ram2010
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is at around 45 minutes drive from the HongKong International Airport and located very close the Theme park Disneyland. A classic hotel to stay and every thing from the lobby, corridors, interiors and exeteriors were fabulous and a real fantasic experience to remember and cherish. We had a great celebrations in the ball room and the ambience and facilities were of uncomparable quality. A best hotel for leisure and holidays

Reviews.Title: “Memorable one”
Reviews.Author: malenct
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, super good services and personalized accomodation.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel with excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Kyle20
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel on the last few days of our holiday so that we could visit Disneyland and be near the airport. We arrived via the MTR and used the courtesy bus which is located about 100m away from the exit of station to get to the hotel. Very impressed when we arrived as hotel is new but set to look like it was built in the Victorian era. Service is excellent, the rooms clean and quite spacious. The breakfast buffet at the enchanted garden restaurant was excellent if just a bit expensive. If you like complimentary gifts, you'll like the fact you can keep the slippers provided in the room. On the day we were to leave, we left our suitcases with conceirge and visited Disneyland. On arrival back to the hotel the reception provided us with a complimentary room so that we could get a shower and changed for the flight home. Obviously this is family hotel and if your looking to have a drink at night at the bar, you'll probably find yourself there alone as most residents have youngsters to look after. The prices at the bar are real eye opener as well.

Reviews.Title: “Superb. Highly Recommended.”
Reviews.Author: moju72
Reviews.Content: Fabulous pool! Lovely rooms! Excellent Service! Superb location! Especially suitable for families with young children. Great place to spend a couple of days relaxing away from the hustle and bustle of Hong Kong city center.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Hotel with Kind and Helpful Staff!”
Reviews.Author: Rurid
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hong Kong Disneyland Hotel for 2 nights at the end of our Hong Kong holiday. Normally we would not have been able to afford a hotel such as this (as the rates are quite expensive), but at that time they had a special promotion where you received 2 nights accommodation and a 2 day park entry for a significantly lower price than retail. After staying in a less than satisfactory room in Kowloon, it was such a relief to stay at this Hotel. From the first moment of entry to our final departure, the staff were absolutely phenomenal. They were always good-mannered, genuinely kind and friendly, and did anything to accommodate a guests request. This aspect alone made the stay so worth the extra money, as you hardly receive service like this anymore. We checked in with Crystal at the front desk, who upgraded us to a balcony room, supplied us with 3 door keys (one for each person), took her time personally explaining all about the hotel and theme park facilities and making paperwork easy and hassle-free, all with a smile on her face and a cheerful disposition. We were overly impressed before we even reached our room, and when we got there, we were even more so! Our room was spacious, well appointed and immaculately clean. We had an opening balcony with a beautiful view of the South China Sea and the garden. The bathroom was huge, and every facility worked perfectly. Again, the staff shined through for us on many occasions. We had previously shopped a lot in Kowloon (who wouldn't!) and were worried that our bags would be over the airline limit. When rung, Bell services happily appeared at our room in less than 5 minutes and took our bags to be weighed with a smile on their face. They returned in less than 20 minutes with all of our bags, little tags with handwritten weights attached to each one. They did this on not 1, but 2 occasions for us, for which we were extremely grateful! Although it is their job to deal with such requests, they did it with a cheerful and helpful disposition, and did not seem upset by the request in the least. Another instance of outstanding customer service is when my sister and I were left in the room to await Bell Services to pick up our bags. Our mum decided to leave the room and begin the checkout process, taking our room key (which is used to direct power to the room) with her, leaving us in total darkness. When the lovely bellboy Helson arrived, he cheerfully took our bags, happily chatting and telling jokes, then offered to let us borrow his key so that we could turn the lights on and see to make sure we hadn't left anything behind! You don't get this kind of thoughtfulness in many places anymore. Most bellboys would have been happy to leave us in the dark. Checkout was equally efficient and kind, even at the ungodly hour of 6am. The only complaint we had about the hotel was that the food was outrageously expensive, and seeing as the resort is sort of in the middle of nowhere, you really have no choice but to eat it if you don't want to starve. However, this was the only thing that bothered us about the place, and it was a very minor issue. If we had of known beforehand, we would have brought some cup noodles and snacks with us. If you are intending to visit Hong Kong Disneyland, splurge and spend a night or two at this hotel. For the service alone, the fee is well worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely magical time in the magical Kingdom!”
Reviews.Author: BeadyEyes
Reviews.Content: Visited Disneyland & stayed 1 night @ Disneyland Hotel in early Dec 09. We were a party of 2 families comprising 3 adults & 3 kids (2, 4 & 5yr old). Everyone had an absolutely amazing time! We checked into the hotel on a Tues morning. Everything went smoothly although the check-in process was a little convoluted to me. Had to sign so many things! Dumped our valuables in the hotel safe & were @ the Park by 1030am. Pls see separate review for HK Disneyland. The hotel was nicely designed with all the necessary Disney motifs. Our kids loved it! The rooms were very spacious, unusually so in HK. We also had interconnecting rooms so that was great for the kids. The room service food was actually pretty good, to our surprise! The Characters Breakfast is a must.. yes its pricey, but hey, its Disneyland. The spread was decent and the kids get to take all the pictures they want without having to queue.. so that was great. There was a special promotion so we could go back to the Park the next morning, spent a few hrs there before heading back to hotel to pick up luggage & then straight to the airport. Its extremely convenient to go to the airport by taxi & took us abt 20mins in all. The one thing the hotel could not accommodate us was a check-out beyond 12pm cos they were fully booked! Overall, we had a great time and wld definitely come back again! =)

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel -- Disneyland under renovations”
Reviews.Author: charliebrownsnoopy
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights during January 2010 Room was very spacious -- our garden view room was directly over the front entrance/taxi stand; this gave us a good view of the nightly fireworks show :) We didn't find any faults with the room; in-room internet is free (no wifi though). Bathroom is quite large by HK standards As for Disneyland...a bit disappointed at the number of rides under renovation. Son's favourite ride was out of commission until mid-February. Even the most "Disney" ride, i.e. "It's a small world", is being renovated until mid-January. It would've been nice if the hotel provided information about which rides were available/unavailable. Since the park is on Lantau Island, it's not exactly the most convenient location. There isn't a convenience store at/near the park, so be sure to stop by Tung Chung or Tsing Yi for necessities!

Reviews.Title: “all show and no substance...”
Reviews.Author: clarkie66
Reviews.Content: My first time staying in a Disney hotel and I must admit, I was a little disappointed. Everything ticked the right boxes, but it all was a little sterile for some reason. The hotel looks beautiful, but lacks any atmosphere at all. I kept hoping I would warm to it, but I never did. Prices were a little high, too. Can't fault the character breakfast, though: fantastic array of food, and Disney characters falling over themselves to entertain you. Probably worth it for that alone.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for a family”
Reviews.Author: LilVoyagers
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel, very well kept. The food was excellent, delicious breakfast buffet with plenty of food choices. The family rooms (with 2 beds in a room) are not very spacious, but the quality of the beds and the room facilities are great. A couple of less positive points: - There's no internet in the rooms, you have to use their business center facilities, they charge for each 15 minutes and the charges were quit high (I think it was something around 55HKD for 15 min). - We found it a bit strange at this family-oriented location that they didn't have babysitting service at the hotel. I you like to go out for a meal or a drink in the evening after putting the children to bed you will struggle to find a suitable option. The receptionist explained to us that they use an external agency which charges around 900 HKD for just a few hours in the evening (extortionate price, given that elsewhere in HK hotels you'd pay not more that 80 HKD per hour). Other than that, we enjoyed our stay at HK Disneyland hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A memorable and magical stay in a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: gwap
Reviews.Content: What an amazing Hotel this is. We arrived here after having read alot of reviews and expected a high level of service and accomodation and we were not disappointed. The service was incredible, Our daughters ere made to feel like princesses from the moment we arrived. The hotel is gorgeous and beautifully maintained. The staff are so very friendly and accomodating. We were there for both mine and my husbands birthdays and when i informed the reception staff of this they delivered to our room a cake made out of towels and a birthday badge for us. Very sweet and the kids thought it was wonderful. The room we had was a kingdom club suite which was fantastic. Access to the kingdom club meant we could relax and watch the nightly fireworks while the children were entertained. They loved the mickey mouuse shaped biscuits and special treats available throughout the day. Every staff member seemed to know our names and especially the children which i thought was pretty special. The Disney store was fantastic and the same prices at Disneyland. Much more relaxing to shop in the hotel tho. We spent 2 nights here which was perfectt as we enjoyed a day at Disneyland and relaxed for the other around the great pool. Could easily have enjoyed another couple of days here but the shopping and city life of Hong Kong was calling. This is a great place to stay if you want to indulge yourselves in the Disney magic. The Kingdom club is great value for money and the staff cannot do enough for you.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but too Business-like”
Reviews.Author: Liverpool4Singapore
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel over the Christmas period for 2 nights..room is nice but not 'disney' enough. Kids was looking for more disney character motifs eg wall paper, bedsheet, etc...but is missing the 'wow' factor... Also had the Enchanted Garden breakfast thingy. Better arrive early so that you will have enough time to take pictures with Mickey and crews(no princesses' appearance though)...Minders for the character is very firm about no photo taking outside the allocated time..despite pleading for just one shot with Santa having bump into him after BF. Oh, do note that no wifi in the room(only in lobby) somust connect use LAN cable to access free internet...

Reviews.Title: “HK Disneyland stay”
Reviews.Author: Teacher2259
Reviews.Content: Amazing hotel, great inclusions, good for children!

Reviews.Title: “wonderful time for the family”
Reviews.Author: doradiegoboots
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights. You walk through the lobby and my kids were so excited to see the lovely, gigantic Xmas tree. Checking in was a breeze. Walking into our room , it was good size, clean and tastefully decorated. We stayed on the first floor with our own balcony overlooking the pool. There are activity rooms for the kids and we used both indoor/outdoor pool. My daughter got made up and photos done in the Princess Room. It is pricey but very worth it for the convenience to the park. Our only disapointment was that the food quality is pretty disappointing both in park and hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't ask for more”
Reviews.Author: CakerBaker
Reviews.Content: We stayed in hongkong disneyland hotel around the 3rd week of Nov 2009. Although we booked a Garden View room, we requested for something with a sea view and they gave one to us at the top floor, from which we could see the sea and the Maze of the hotel. We stayed 3 nights at an offer price of about SGD 320/night. Regular price was about SGD400/night. Room was very nice and they provided the kiddie barriers, to prevent kids from rolling off the bed. There were 2 queen beds and a nicely sized room for, I would say, 2 adults and 2 kids. Everything was clean and nice. The curtains were nice and thick and blocked out the sunlight completely, so much so that we could sleep in till late and still didn't realise it was bright and sunny outside till we drew the curtains. There's a PRINCE ERIC room meant for youngsters to do things like colouring, playing, reading, listening to bedtime stories. It was quite nice. We signed up for the buffet breakfast which had Mickey Mouse, Minnie, Goofy and Pluto visiting each table. We thought the buffet was a bit overpriced but went for it because of the Disney characters for our kid. Nothing to complain about.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: kryztle_16
Reviews.Content: WE stayed at a two bedroom suite complete with receiving area and kitchen spacious bathroom but what i did not like is that it smelled of cigarette smoke...

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: Kiran_2009
Reviews.Content: Kids loved it! The hotel is very nice. It is built like a palace and is very clean and plush. Though the rates are expensive but we thought it was penny well spent! We did the Enchanted garden breakfast as well but thought that was little overpriced. There are two pools - one outside and one indoors. Botha re heated in winters and kids loved that. The lobby was done up very well as Christmas is around the corner. The service is amazing and the staff efficient. Effiecient but not frindly. That is the only downside ...the girls at the reception do not smile. Even if the small children say "Hello" in their sweet manner they respond but do not smile at them. I found that very strange and eerie. They are very efficient but not frendly. The lawns are good and the kids lvoe the maze which is made of hedge. There is a nice play areas as well. There is a shutle which goes to the park every 10 mins and is nicve and colorful. The rooms are large and have two big beds which can accomodate 2 kids easily.

Reviews.Title: “Magical stay !!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: lovino
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a Magical stay at The Hongkong Disneyland Hotel.We were 4 families traveling together and reached the Hotel at around 12 in the afternoon and the check in lady gave us two rooms immediately although the check in time was 3 o'clock.Check in was extremely smooth and the luggage arrived in our rooms in almost no time . As requested we got all our 4 rooms next to each other.One unique feature was that the rooms were below the lobby level.Booked the character breakfast at the garden restaurant of the Hotel.Booking the breakfast at check in itself is cheaper as you get a discount of about 20 percent. Although the breakfast was not cheap (198 HKD ) it was worth every dollar.All the staff at the breakfast had a smile on their faces and the Disney characters moving around really exited the kids.The staff also readily obliged in clicking photographs with the characters.Breakfast selection was huge and also had a few Indian dishes also which the children loved very much. The overall ambience of the hotel was cool and relaxing .Had dinner at the restaurant at the lobby level which had lounge type seating arrangement also .The service at dinner was a bit slow but the food was ok. There was a well stocked bar inside the restaurant too.Stay and Play for 2 days was also a good deal.Since we reached the park at around 2:30 on the first day and were covering the park at a very leisurely pace we could not complete all the attractions on the first day itself.So next day we checked out of the hotel and kept the luggage in their cloak room and then hit the park for another 2 hours. There were a lot of disney characters moving around in the lobby area also with whom you could photograph yourself so if you are staying in the hotel there is no need to queue up for meeting Disney characters at the park.All in all was quite satisfied with the stay.

Reviews.Title: “Just what the kids wanted”
Reviews.Author: mkash
Reviews.Content: Everything about this hotel is worth writing about and everything is excellent. Let's go on each point one by one: 1. Location: It's far out from the city but then you don't stay here if you have come for work in Hong Kong city. It's 5 minutes bus drive from the Park. You couldn't have it any better. 2. Surroundings: Green foliage all around. Coming from Dubai this was like going to a tropical rain forest. But that aside the trees and the greenery was just awesome. We got a garden facing room and for the only time during the trip my wife said- the view is nice! Kind of made up for the whole trip. 3. Service: Staff is very courteous. Difficult to imagine people can be like this. The service was excellent- at check in- Katy was very polite and helpful, room service, housekeeping, restaurants- Taka in the breakfast place, concierge services every one was great. 4. Food: The breakfast is nice, though a little steep. But the Disney characters moving about more than make up for it. The kids loved Mickey, Goofy and Pluto - we got tired eventually of the photographs we took. The spread in the breakfast is very large. The banana bread is amazing. We had dinner in the lobby restaurant and surprises of all surprises they had north Indian food- the kids were longing for something which could be near home cooked food- and this hit the spot. Again the service here was exceptional. 5. Disney Store: If you forget to buy anything in the Park then can buy it from the in-house Disney store. 6. Park: The Park is unlike the Paris DL. It's small and has kiddy rides only- in other words it's manageable and perfect. There was no rush and we did Dumbo the Flying Elephant twice- can't beat that. Last time in Paris stood in line for 45 minutes for a 3 minute ride. Did the Mad Hatter's Tea Cups thrice- within 15 minutes. Just awesome. Easy to meet the characters, can stand in the front to watch the parade- can't think of anything bad about this DL.

Reviews.Title: “A real fantasy experience...lots of space and a real 5 * experience.”
Reviews.Author: asiantraveller2009
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our Disneyland Hotel experience - from the room, to staff, pool, food and ambiance - a really good, well thought-out hotel, and unlike other Hong Kong Hotels - lots of space and room. Do yourself a flavor and stay more than 1 night. Most obviously the location is great for the Disneyland Park - but getting into HK proper is not a great hassle, but takes some time - about $200 HKD in a cab and 30-40 mins, or by MTR in the same time or less for under $20 HKG. We were advised to avoid the Hotel during the peak periods of Chinese New Year and late September/October. Weekends are busier - so if you can plan a mid week stay. Remember your food choices are restricted to the hotel offerings, which are many, varied, tasty but also in the 5* price realm, although not excessively so. We thought the pricing was expensive but not so bad for the standard of the property and certainly far better than many other 5* hotels we have eaten at. Thoroughly recommended - especially if you have small children.

Reviews.Title: “May all your dreams come true!”
Reviews.Author: iv_eternity
Reviews.Content: I like to travel, and I have to say that so far Hong Kong Disneyland Hotel is definitely in my top 5 list of best hotels that i've stayed in. Service was excellent, even my enquires via email about our trip was above expectations. All my questions was answers straight away. Conveniently they upgraded us to the room with fireworks view which was excellent as it was my mum's birthday at the time. We had the breakfast buffet every morning during our stay and it was just delicious. Some how eating waffles shaped as mickey mouse's face made it more delicious then usual. I am definitely making this a permanent holiday destination for my future family!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable first time at Disney Hotel”
Reviews.Author: vinz20
Reviews.Content: We got a fantastic deal from Disney via travel industry rate when we booked direct. Location: The hotel just like Disney is about 30 minutes from town by train (MTR). And you have to take a train to the nearest suburbs. The MTR near the theme park is about 10 mins away from the Disney hotel. There are buses conveniently plying both the disney hotels and the theme park every 10 mins in a circular route. ie Disneyland hotel- disney hollywood hotel - theme park - disney hotel. Check-in : we arrived at about 8.30 am and were pleasantly surprised to be allowed to check in to the room at an early hour to enable us to visit the theme park which opened at 10.30am. Fast and fuss free. Rooms: Victorian themed - spacious double beds, room was clean and all amenities working. Tho we paid for a seaview, we had a 45degrees angled seaview. Actually, nothing really to look at. Advisable to save the money. Facilities: Two main restaurants; a buffet and a chinese. I must say its on the pricey side Buffet Dinner at the Enchanted Restaurant costs HKD300 for adults. The attraction is that about 3 Disney characters will appear during meal times for photo taking ! There's a Victorian Spa onsite which has a nice quiet spa ambience but with prices on the high side. I was suprised that they didnt offer discounts off the spa menu even during off peak. Jacuzzi, steam and sauna is free for spa guests but HKD100 for non spa guests. Also, a gym, indoor and outdoor pool. Hotel has a " Kid's club" that teaches kids how to draw disney characters, magic, tell bedtimes stories during specified hours only. Downside - There is very little for adults to do after dinner other than drinks at the hotel lounge or when the park closes at 7.30pm around the hotels. I visited the Disney Hollywood hotel as well and think Kids would probably enjoy the Hollywood themed hotel more than the Disneyland hotel which looked a bit too prim and formal for kids. Overall - an enjoyable experience for a first timer.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels ever stayed”
Reviews.Author: bluedusk
Reviews.Content: This is without a doubt the best Disneyland Hotel ever stayed for me. Previously I have stayed in Paris Disneyland Hotel and also Tokyo Disneyland Hotel. The hotel is very clean, very posh and has a wonderful lounge with fantastic drinks at reasonable prices. The rooms are quite large by HK standards I simply love their buffet breakfast. As for the park, it is really very small but I enjoyed Space Mountain and their shows.

Reviews.Title: “cozy rooms”
Reviews.Author: bettedaviseyes
Reviews.Content: the hotel was very kid-friendly. makes you want to remember your disney days :) and the HKD200 buffet was so worth the price! but the hotel was very far from the city.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced & No Variety”
Reviews.Author: fatimaAD
Reviews.Content: Our stay at Disneyland Hotel was supposed to be magical, but it wasn't really. It was simply overpriced. And the fact that it was in a secluded area didn't help either. We couldn't wait to get out of there. Unlike Disneyland Paris, the hotel and park are for kids only. Adults would find themselves bored out of their wits.

Reviews.Title: “Super for kids but watch the biting insects”
Reviews.Author: DCBLEGAL
Reviews.Content: Kids loved the character breakfast (Mickey, Daisy, Goofy and Pluto) and at HK$600 for family of 4 not bad value. Rooms large. Staff were super - handing out Disney stickers to kids at every opportunity. Little girls (3+) will enjoy the princess make over and meeting princesses in lobby in morning. Don't miss afternoon tea. Free broadband. Easy taxi ride to / from airport and regular hotel shuttle to MTR and Disney. Not place to stay if want HK bright lights, shopping etc. Only one issue - beware the poolside bar: the insects will have better meal of you, than you will have (90 bites in 5 minutes). Not just fresh "tourist meat" either: bar staff similarly afflicted.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely extension of the Disneyland experience”
Reviews.Author: Thisgig
Reviews.Content: The kids loved the pool, we all loved the slides. Some cheaper options for food for kids breakfast etc would be helpful. Faultless accomodation in terms of opulence and cleanliness. Staff were obliging and helpful. The maze was magic, and kids bumping into Snow White etc. is a lovely part of the stay

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great Staff”
Reviews.Author: AviaryFamily
Reviews.Content: We had a great time at Hong Kong Disney. We stayed at the Disney Land hotel and had a nice time. We were disappointed in the restaurants and actually ate all our meals at the nearby Hollywood Hotel (I think that is the name....it is also a Disney hotel on the premisis). The Disneyland hotel was great for kids with the Disney Characters all around, all the time. We were a little disappointed that there was no kids club, but they did have a room filled with things to do, but the parents had to stay with the kids. The restaurants were too formal for us. With a 5 year old and a 3 year old the "fine china" and victorian style caused us too much stress at the table. Our kids are also up very early ready for breakfast and the restaurants opened too late. Even though it is a Disney Hotel, I think that it wasn't well suited for young kids. I would definitely recommend it for families with kids over age 8, but but iIf we go back we will stay at the other Disney Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Want to go back right now!”
Reviews.Author: TravelCaper
Reviews.Content: This was our first time at a Disneyland Hotel and what an amazing experience!! Arriving at the hotel at night was breathtaking as it is all lit up with fairy lights. Check-in was easy and the staff are all wonderful. Disney has always been fantastic with details and the three of us (all adults) had a great time finding hidden Mickeys everywhere. We had a light snack for dinner in the lobby and had two wonderful buffet breakfasts during our stay. It is very easy to get carried away when Mickey, Pluto and Goofy join you for breakfast. The hotel is just as spectacular outside as it is inside. The maze is fun and there is access to the outlying sea wall which you can get great views of Kowloon and Hong Kong Island. The room was on the same level as the reception and was spacious, and beautifully furnished. Once again, Disney went all-out with the detail. So good that we're planning to return in 2010!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic, would recommend staying here even if your not going to Disneyland”
Reviews.Author: RickRouse
Reviews.Content: This hotel is excellent, I really can't praise it more. The staff are friendly, polite, helpful and great with the children. The services are always good, the food despite being expensive is fairly good and the buffet offers options for everyone with lots of food, ice cream machines and a choices from Sushi, Chinese, Japanese, Indian, European, American. The rooms are cleaned and serviced properly everyday, everything works and they are comfortable. The pool is clean, lots of supervision etc. I would recommend this to any family, it's worth paying extra to stay in a safe, good quality hotel. The theme park is smaller and more tame then other Disneylands, but all that said, in three days we didn't see everything with our 2 year old in tow (with older children I think they might get bored after a few day in the park and a day by the pool???)

Reviews.Title: “Breath taking view of the ocean”
Reviews.Author: dd_m29
Reviews.Content: part of HK disneyland though not attached. it is an oasis of peace. if you do get a top room you are sure to enjoy the calm of the sea when you get up early morning. a family place with lots of activity even in the lobby keeps eveyone young at heart. the coach service to the park is convenient but perhaps would be better if access was easier especially for people who may need a wheel chair. a rather good alternate in case the US one cannot be managed

Reviews.Title: “Blow the budget, this hotel is worth every cent!”
Reviews.Author: tric1003
Reviews.Content: We (2 adults and 2 children aged 7 and 9) stayed here for 2 nights at the end of May. Before I made the booking via the internet I was considering the Hollywood Hotel due to it's cheaper rates and excellent reviews on this forum. And now I have absolutely no regrets about spending the extra $$ and staying at the DisneyLand Hotel. From the moment we arrived the service was impeccable, from the bell boys to the Concierge Staff to the Front Desk staff and the Housekeeping staff (they are all called Cast Members). Nothing was a problem and all our requests were handled with a smile and efficiency. All Cast Members greet the hotel guests with a cheery "Have a magical day", even on the telephone when I called for more towels! This did get a bit strange after a while but does show the dedication and excellent standards maintained by the management of the property. It definitely is a family oriented property with all small guests being paid special attention to and constantly being given Disney stickers by the staff. The Hotel itself is absolutely gorgeous. The lobby is breathtaking and the grounds are amazing. We stayed for 2 nights and I regret not booking an extra night just so that we could have enjoyed the facilities and what the resort had to offer. Most of our days were spent at the fantastic DisneyLand Park and Ngong Ping and Citigate Outlets, so we felt as though we barely got a chance to enjoy the hotel. The pools are fantastic. The outdoor pool has fast and fun waterslide which provided hours of amusement for me and my children, even until 10pm when there are still lifeguards on duty. The indoor pool is lovely, designed like a Roman bath. We enjoyed doing laps there. The Prince Eric childrens activity room had lots of supervision for the kids with loads of interesting activities to occupy them. They even had bedtime stories nightly at 8pm. From 11am daily a Princess visits the Lobby for photos with guests. It was wonderful for my daughter to have such an opportunity after having to queue up for ages at DisneyLand and to only be able to spend a few minutes (2 photos) with the Princesses there out of fairness to all the others in queue. The gift shop sells very reasonably priced Disney merchandise and has a huge variety. We visited the Hollywood Hotel's shop and found that it carried a much smaller range. The prices of the merchandise are the same at DisneyLand, and both the hotels so I would recommend that you purchase from the Hotel to save yourself having to fight the crowds at the Park and then have to carry your purchases around. You can even charge your purchases to your room account. We booked a Character Breakfast at the Enchanted Garden restaurant which was expensive especially since my youngest was too excited to eat, but it was worth it for the Disney experience. Also the variety of food was amazing - it was a truly international buffet with bench islands dedicated to Japanese, Chinese, Indian food as well as salads, cereals, pastries, bread and fruit. It was huge! Our room was a Garden Room with fabulous views over the Mickey Maze and also the ocean. The room was definitely large enough for all 4 of us and we slept 2 to a bed very comfortably. The rooms are immaculate as are the bathrooms which are well stocked with toiletries and posh fluffy towels. There are bathrobes in the wardrobe for everyone and slippers for you to keep. My daughter celebrated a birthday in May and housekeeping left her a birthday card and a birthday cake sculpted from a towel. It was a lovely gesture. And at the end of our stay, Housekeeping advised that the birthday cake was a gift! I was really touched especially considering all the other "gifts" which were complimentary. Due to rainy weather we weren't keen to walk to DisneyLand but my husband did and it's only a 10 minute walk along beautifully paved and landscaped gardens. We didn't go to Inspiration Lake because of the weather but would have if we had stayed another night. We did visit the Hollywood Hotel and it looked fantastic as well, with a huge pool and beautifully landscaped gardens and loads of childrens play equipment. The meals looked more reasonably priced than at the DisneyLand Hotel and had a greater variety of dining options. We would have been more than happy staying at the Hollywood Hotel but were thrilled to be at the DisneyLand Hotel. The shuttle buses to and from the Hotels to DisneyLand public transport interchange are clean and efficient and reliable. It was another bonus of staying here as we used the shuttle to take us to the MTR to explore the other parts of Lantau Island. The Ngong Ping Cable Car ride and Citigate Outlets are definitely worth a visit but avoid the Ngong Ping village which is ghastly. My only complaint would be that the cost of eating at DisneyLand Hotel was expensive and did not represent value for money. We would have liked more choices for smaller meals and snacks as often we would be coming back to the Hotel for a quick refresher before heading out again. Overall we had a terrific time at this property and enjoyed the total Disney experience. DisneyLand itself was just perfect for my children's age group as the rides weren't too scary and the park was large enough without being daunting. I would not hesitate to recommend this Hotel to anyone and everyone wanting to experience the Disney magic and we hope to return soon.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Experience”
Reviews.Author: Audrey9
Reviews.Content: This was the last stop of a big family holiday and the whole Disneyland experience was made even better by staying at this luxury hotel. Spend the extra dollars and stay here. The staff couldn't do enough for you, the pool has 2 lifeguards! 2! The lobby lounge was more than comfortable. We had the best night here relaxing on the lounges drinking the wine, eating tiramisu,watching the kids dance to the brass band/ pianist. The kids loved the maze and we were lucky to see Mickey in person on the last day outside when they put on special games for Easter. If I come back to Hong Kong I think I will base our family here and commute to the city! Far more relaxing. It is even close to the cable car ride to the Buddha! You get to experience the green and mountainous side of Hong Kong here - a little hideaway.

Reviews.Title: “A fun stopover in Hong Kong.”
Reviews.Author: Ellemay
Reviews.Content: We visit Hong Kong frequently and this time we decided to stay close to the airport due to us having a late night flight. The hotel is perfectly located within easy walking distance to Disneyland entrance. The hotel is expensive but its worth the luxury. It also serves as an excellent airport hotel or stopover hotel with the added bonus of Disneyland at your finger tips. The hotel is neatly tucked on the harbour with lively water views. There is a free shuttle bus that is available for those who don’t want to walk to Disneyland from the hotel. The hotel foyer, exterior façade and lush green gardens are highly impressive and would appeal to any traveller. However, one must be aware the hotel totally caters for children and families. The restaurant is expensive and totally overpriced for example we paid AUD$16.00 for two cups of coffee. The swimming pool is gorgeous with plenty of deck chairs, umbrellas and a good size spa. Breakfast is good with plenty of selections and the kids will be entertained with Disney characters Minnie and Goofy dropping by to say hi. The maze is good fun and it’s a pleasure to stroll through the garden as they are immaculately presented and well designed. This is a hotel were one needs to shop around for a package deal. The Hollywood Hotel is close by and easily reached by shuttle bus but its not classy like this hotel. Overall : If you are looking to visit Disneyland this hotel is perfect. Its expensive but worth it.

Reviews.Title: “You do the sums, it's worth it !”
Reviews.Author: chai77
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel and we found it very good by Hong Kong standard. Staying at the Kingdom Club floor I think was worth it, as you get a lot of benefit, which by the time you add it up I think is about the same as the normal room. The room itself was large. We had twin double bed room which was more than adequate for us , my wife and 2 kids. Bathroom was spacious. In the Kingdom Club breakfast was more than adequate, only thing missing was dim sum stuff, morning tea was then available. They provided simple small cakes and biscuits and unlimited drinks. Then at evening time , canapés started at 5:00pm. We had canapés as our dinner as the selection was huge. All this was complimentary, so you add up the cost –definitely worth it from my point of view. You can see the fireworks from the verandah of the top floor of the hotel – Kingdom Club access only. We checked out at 12:00pm and while waiting for our late evening flight back to Australia we could still use the hotel facilities. We went back to Disneyland cause we had a 2 day pass, once finished back to the hotel, had a shower by the pool area and then went straight to the airport – nice and refreshed. This is a good trick for all catching late flights out of Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Deluxe Disney Hotel In the World, Hands Down.”
Reviews.Author: davegidd
Reviews.Content: So you know where I'm coming from with this review let me give you a bit of background. My partner and I both worked at the original Disneyland back in the days when service was more important that profit, so we are both VERY picky when it comes to all things Disney. We expect a lot from Disney and we're not very forgiving when paying the premium prices Disney charges for their deluxe resorts. We have been to all of the Disneylands in the world and have stayed at many of Disney's deluxe resorts, including the Grand Floridian on which this property is based. So, with that said, I can say without a doubt that THIS Disneyland hotel is the finest example of what Disney can do to create a magcal experience. There is simply no better Disney hotel in the world and I do not make that statement lightly. Anyone who thinks this hotel is overpriced has not stayed at other Disney hotels. We stayed for four nights in a Fantasia room and it was less than one-third the price of what we paid at the Grand Floridian for a regular room. Not only that, but the food was priced reasonably and every single dish we had during our stay was excellent. We ordered room service every night after we returned tired from the park and it arrived so quickly I have no idea how it was possible to cook it and deliver it in such a short amount of time. It was delivered by the most gracious cast members we have ever encountered and the food was hot and beautifully presented. The moment we put the tray/table out in the hallway it was picked up. The same was true of the breakfast buffet in the morning. Although limited everything was outstanding and there was never a wait. We did not go to the character breakfast, but we did check it out one morning and there was no wait there either. There were always one or more Disney princesses in the lobby greeting people and taking photos day and night. We were astounded that they were always available and the way they interacted with the children was marvelous even by Disney standards. The hotel is similar in design to the Grand Floridian, but on a much smaller scale. There are only 400 rooms here all in the main building, so it has a much more intimate feel to it and there were never crowds. The Disney details in the design were amazing...Cinderella's glass slipper in the crystal chandeliers, Mickey's head inlaid in the stone floors, characters faces woven into the carpets, etc. You could spend all day just looking for the hidden Mickeys. Generally one pays dearly for Disney hotels, but the service doesn't quite measure up to the price. Not so here. We had service so attentive even we were amazed. For example, our first night we put some dirty clothes in the laundry bag and left it in the closet intending to add to it later. That afternoon housekeeping called to be sure we didn't intend to send it out because the maid had notice it. That alone was amazing. We said that we would send it out on our last day there and forgot about it. On our last full day, housekeeping called to ask if our laundry was ready to send out! We were astounded that not only did someone make a note of our off-hand comment, but they actually followed up on it. We have stayed at some very upscale places and none has ever been THAT on top of things. Most cast members we dealt with spoke very good English and the few who didn't immediately went and got someone who could help us. The cast members at the hotel and all of Hong Kong Disneyland were the friendliest we have ever encountered. Literally every single one of them during our four day stay greeted us when we walked by even when they could have easily avoided eye contact. We've never seen anything like it. Even the woman dusting the floors said hello to us, twice! We asked if we could see the other types of rooms available and that resulted in us beign taken on a private tour of the entire hotel to visit every type of room. Other than the Fantasia rooms that are in the turrets and have king sized beds and a Jacuzzi bathtub, all of the other rooms are identical. We'd say go for the Fantasia room if you can because you will have more floor space for children to play. The other rooms were beautiful, but seemed a bit cramped for a family. The Kingdom Club level has a beautiful lounge area serving breakfast and snacks. It was MUCH nicer than the similar lounge and the Grand Floridian. The rooms on the Kingdom Club floor have TV's in the bathrooms and views of the park, but are otherwise the same, so we're not sure they would be worth the extra cost. The Fantasia rooms have panoramic ocean views with windows on two sides and we were very happy with that. Disney hotels generally charge for every little thing, but here there was free wired high-speed internet and bottled water. We also received a room full of towel animals and a tin of cookies for a birthday we happened to mention to a cast member in the morning. There is a large themed pool area outside with a playground area for children and a stunning indoor pool as well. We didn't use the spa, but did look at it and it was very nicely done. There is a free shuttle bus to the park, but after using it once we found that we prefered to walk to the park along the beautifully landscaped Park Promenade. The walk takes about fifteen minutes at a leisurely pace and features lovely fountains and Disney music playing along the entire route. Hardly anyone used this walkway which is a shame because it really is beautiful. If the Disneyland Hotel is too pricey for you, try Disney's Hollywood Hotel instead. We were given a tour of that hotel also and it is very well done. It has a more frantic feel to it, but the service was outstanding, the rooms well designed (sort of like a cruise ship stateroom) and there are many more food options there including a food court that the Disneyland Hotel lacks. We really thought that booking four days here would be too long, but the entire experience was so wonderful we didn't want to leave. We don't use the term "magical" very often, but the entire resort was just that. Yes, the park is small, but that forced us to do the little things that we haven't done in years at the established parks. We LOVED it. Even as jaded ex-cast members we were won over by the whole experience here. What the park lacks in attractions it fully makes up for in charm and friendliness. If all you want to do is run from attraction to attraction, this probably isn't the Disneyland Resort for you, but if you want a truly magical experience on a scale that you and your children will find enchanting, then this is the place.

Reviews.Title: “Over priced especially for Families”
Reviews.Author: PerthBogga
Reviews.Content: The hotel is beautiful, and magical. It is isolated from everything, so meal times at hotel can be very expensive. Young children dont eat much and $40AUS per child is over priced. The service is great. Room was a bit small and tight.

Reviews.Title: “a delightful and easy stay with kids”
Reviews.Author: happymommyclam
Reviews.Content: Everything about the hotel was kid friendly. Traveling with my toddles was so easy. Padded carpets and exquisite but kid-friendly furniture. Parents found the place luxurious. Kids will enjoy the many things to explore. Overall, it provides accommodation that's relaxing, fun, and filled with magic. The many delightfully-placed disney touches all over the hotel gave us something to smile about in every corner. Mascots walked around, but not in an invasive way. Little girls were dressed in princess outfits. There was beautiful music from a grand piano in the lobby as we waited to meet the rest of our party. The only improvement i could hope for would be better tasting food in the hotel. I'd like to watch out for promos, if any, because one does have to pay a premium for the disney experience.

Reviews.Title: “Children will enjoy this”
Reviews.Author: MyAttitude
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night and the kid enjoyed it. The rate was 50% off for annual membership owner and it is really worth it. Finish off Hong Kong Disneyland with a night stay in the hotel and breakfast with character appearances will leave a deep impression in the children's mind.

Reviews.Title: “Typical Disney Magic”
Reviews.Author: gidget_8
Reviews.Content: Our family of four Mum , Dad 14Y/O Daughter and 70+Y/O Nanna visited Hong Kong in Feb/Mar 2009. We spent the first week in Kowloon and then a further 3 nights in this amazing hotel. We have been to Disneyland in California and stayed on site in the Disneyland hotel so we simply had to do the same here. As a guest of the hotel the Disney experience doesnt stop when you leave the park in the evening. Every single thing exceeds your expectation. There were shuttle buses running every 10mins back and forward from the hotel to the park (less than 10 min trip). My husbands birthday fell during the stay and how special was that !
