His name as displayed on the special events screen, he was given a Birthday badge and after the most wonderful day in the park we arrived back in our room to find 2 "cakes" made from towelling, one from housekeeping and one with a personal card from Mickey himself.The breakfast at Enchanted Garden is one we will never forget, the characters mill around willing you to have a memorable dining experience and the food is superb. The rooms are beautifully fitted out and a family of 4 fit comfortably. The beds and pillows were a little too firm for us . The toilettries and goodies were endless and the best quality. The huge flat screen tv had the added bonus of an sd camera card slot so we could view our snaps at the end of the day. Each person had robes and complimentary scuffs. Most morning you could find Disney characters walking around in the colourfully opulent lobby complete with grand piano .The gardens are magnificent and we could walk along the waterfront to the park. There is a great little gift shop where the staff were always willing to help.Disney have out done themselves with the great attention to detail without losing the Chinese feel. All the staff were attentive and beautifully groomed and the overall service and standard was outstanding.Speaking English was never a problem. I only wish there had been a guest laundry available as the dry cleaning fees were a little pricey. This is the place to stay if you want to visit Disneyland in Hong Kong for a few days, its worth every cent.

Reviews.Title: “Magical stay”
Reviews.Author: Hanoona
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hong Kong Disneyland hotel 3 times April 2007, July 2008 and February 2009. and we all loved each time very much. Check in, check out was fast. all the staff spoke english and were very polite and helpful, handed out lots of disney stickers to my daughter all the time. Rooms (we stayed at the garden view) are spacious and very clean with lots of drawers for your stuff and comfortable bed and clean carpet very sunny yet the windows don't open, the sofa in the room opens up to a single bed (or into a double bed in other rooms) which was great for my 5 year old daughter, the TV channels were excellent for her viewing also when its fireworks time at the park (every night at 8.00 pm ) there's a channel that plays the music with the fireworks (about 15 minutes long). the Bathrooms were very clean with really cute toiletries you can take home with you, also the "do not disturb" sign at the door with the dwarfs picture is complimentary, I asked the lady at reception desk and she said its for you to take home - which i loved. internet in the room was free of charge. Breakfast either at the "Enchanted Garden Character Buffet" where Mickey, Goofy Pluto are there wearing chefs clothes and Miney or Daisy would be there too ( never donald i dont know why) you buy the breakfast brochure everyday for the next day (or all at once but i liked that I get the option instead of a package) the food however is O.K. not to yummy yet very PRICY so we didn't go to it to often (besides your not able to eat two mouthfuls without a character jumping in you face for a photo ) and very noisy too. The "Grand salon" which is in the lobby was quite, cheaper yet with limited food selection . I loved ( well my daughter loved) that after breakfast at the lobby everyday around 10.30-11.30 we find a disney princess where we stand in a short line and her two assistance help us take a photo with her. the gift shop is great too. The garden maze was lots of fun also there is a long walk near the ocean that was wonderful and peaceful, a small playground ( for toddlers maybe) we didn't get to swim at the pool but it looked very clean and lots of fun for kids with its large slide. The shuttle bus takes you to Disneypark and MTR( subway) station every 10 minutes (a few minutes ride) very organized and efficient when it was very crowded (during Chinese new year there were many busses going to and from the park at once). Stayed at the hotel about 5-6 days each time, bought tickets to the park for one day and we got the next day entry for free. So the rest of the days we stayed at the hotel we went out to explore Hong kong city instead of going to another hotel in the city since the price and service were great, also the area is very quite and relaxing compared to downtown Hong Kong...and of course so that my little one can still enjoy disney and see her beloved princesses.

Reviews.Title: “It's Disney, so it has the Disney magic!”
Reviews.Author: malupit
Reviews.Content: Check-in was easy. The rooms were simple but elegant and very clean, and the staff was courteous and attentive. Two pools to use, indoor and outdoor. Simple but fun garden maze. Children can not only have breakfast with Disney characters, but can casually run into them in the hotel lobby during various times of the day. Beautiful ocean view. Fantastic (if slightly pricey) Chinese restaurant. Family friendly, with some special activities for children. And if that wasn't good enough, the Magic Kingdom (well, a small version of it) is just a brisk walk or a brief bus ride away.

Reviews.Title: “Kids were so happy, they didn't want to leave!”
Reviews.Author: HotMama168
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night last Feb 2009. Others have written extensive reviews and i don't want to say the same things. It was a good experience for us. They gave us connecting rooms like we requested. We got an early check in. And the crib and bed rails were waiting for us as we entered the room. I also had to clean the bed rails... it had dried red stain on the plastic part. Not sure if it was dried blood or dried red marker.... hoping it was the marker. But I wiped it off with a tissue and alcohol. We've previously stayed in Hollywood Hotel 2x before. I think the Disneyland Hotel is worth the extra money. The princesses and Alice who were at the lobby really made my daughter so happy. The character breakfast in the Enchanted Garden was a real treat for my son! And the maze was a lot of fun for them as well. We only stayed one night here and spent the rest of the nights at W Hotel. Looking back, we should have stayed 2 nights at Disneryland Hotel. We have 3 small kids and you can't move or see sights as fast bec of so many stops! So to have a liesurely time at the park and hotel, I think 2 nights will be best for us. Given that we spent 1.5 days there, we didn't get to do everything! My kids are 4, 2 and 7 mos. If you have bigger kids, you can accomplish more. Service was good. Room was clean. Food was so so. We ate at the lobby lounge, I forget the name. It was the one overlooking the maze. We chose to ate there so the kids could see the characters coming in the lobby! So it was sort of like a character lunch. But you had to walk a tiny bit to see them. And we also had the character breakfast. It was worth it to see the happiness in my son's face. My daughter felt sick and decided to sleep in that morning.. Overall, it was a very good and memorable experience for the family.

Reviews.Title: “Great for family with young children”
Reviews.Author: vintage2002mom
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Disneyland Hotel for 4 nights in the second lag of our two-week Asia trip in February. We are a family with two kids ages 5 and 6 (turning 7 in a few weeks). I have been to Hong Kong numerous times but this was the first trip for my husband and the kids. Originally we planned to stay at the Disneyland Hotel for 2 nights, then the Kowloon Shangri-la for another two. However, once we arrived at the Disneyland Hotel, the kids immediately fell in love -- their first comment was: “this hotel looks so familiar, just like the one in San Diego!”. Well, the hotel is indeed a replica of the historic Hotel del Coronado (less than 30 minutes from our house in San Diego), which we frequently visit. The kids kept on insisting that they wanted to stay there for the whole time (they may be a bit homesick after seeing the hotel), so we finally gave in and stayed for 4 nights. In the beginning I was quite reluctant to give up our reservation at the Shangri-la, as we booked a harbor view suite to celebrate our 15th anniversary (Shangri-la was fantastic and did not charge us for the cancellation!). I also felt that staying 5 days at Disney was not my idea of an authentic Hong Kong experience for our kids. However, the kids absolutely loved this hotel and were very very happy with everything it has to offer and we ended up having a good time. The hotel is beautiful, the ground meticulously landscaped, and there’s a nice walking path along the shore of the South China Sea and lots of room for the kids to roam about. So we had a surprisingly peaceful, relaxing, and pleasant stay. Since many of the previous reviews have offered excellent information on the rooms, the restaurants, and hotel amenities already, I will focus this review on the rooms and services at the Kingdom Club. When we booked our stay, we took the advice from several people on this forum and purchased an Hong Kong Disneyland annual pass for my son for hotel and dining discounts. With the pass we had a choice of either 35% discount off hotel rooms during weekdays, or paying rack rate for a guaranteed upgrade to the Kingdom Club suite. Since we needed two rooms we decided to purchase the premium pass for the upgrade and we were very happy that we did so. The Kingdom Club is located at the 7th floor of the hotel, with its own check-in desk, dedicated concierge, and a private dining room. The dining room is the main gathering place for the Kingdom Club guests. It serves a very nice buffet breakfast, drinks and snacks throughout the day and appetizers in the evenings, all complementary. It also offered several newspapers in 3 different languages (Chinese, English, and Japanese) and bedtime stories for the kids. The buffet breakfast was very good, with typical western breakfast items (including cereals, eggs, ham, sausages, hash brown, smoked salmon, a variety of pastries, bread, fruits) and traditional Cantonese breakfast items (such as dim sum, fried noodles and rice congee). The appetizers in the evenings were equally good, with a variety of finger foods, pastries, dessert, fruits, and some luxurious items such as seared tuna, finger sandwiches with crab salad; drink choices included wine, sparkling water (Perrier and San Pelligrino), soft drinks, and beer. They also served snacks, drinks and fruits throughout the day. This arrangement was extremely convenient for us as our kids could just stop by at the Kingdom Club whenever they wanted a something to eat. In the evenings you can view the fireworks from the dining room or the balcony while munching on yummy appetizers. A couple nights we were so full we decided to skip dinner and just ordered a few small dishes from room service. Our suite was roomy, and very nicely (and tastefully) decorated. In the living room there is a large sleeper sofa and two chairs, an armoire with a flat-screen TV with DVD player, a dining table for 4, a minibar, a coffee maker, and a safe. In the living room there’s a half bathroom right by the entrance, and opposite the half-bath there’s a connecting door to another guestroom so it could potentially become a two-bedroom suite. The bedroom has two double beds, another flat-screen TV with DVD player, a desk, a chest drawer, and a very large bathroom with a separate shower, a Jacuzzi bathtub, a separate vanity with chair. The room is extremely nice with tons of drawers and more than enough storage space for our family of 4. The only complain I could even think of is that there’s only one sink in the bathroom, instead of the customary two in most high-end western hotels. The suite also comes with two small balconies and our room has beautiful views of the South China Sea, Kowloon, Hong Kong and a few offshore islands, and the bridges connecting Lantau island to the mainland. At night we often sat on the balcony with a drink and just looked at the lights from the city and the boats. So it was unexpectedly relaxing for my husband and I. The hotel (and Hollywood hotel as well) offers 2nd day free Disneyland park ticket deal for its guests. This turns out to be great for us, as our kids could only do a few hours of sightseeing everyday, and they did get tired from the 30-40 minute subway ride back and forth into town. We did hit most of the usual tourist attractions such as the Peak Tram, Star Ferry, Avenue of Stars, double-decker bus, the Ngong Ping cable car, etc. but in the afternoon the kids just wanted to spend a few hours in Disneyland, hang out at the hotel, or run around the Mickey Mouse maze. Although I have to say that Hong Kong Disneyland itself was very small and non-descript (what people said in the forum are true!). It’s hard to understand why they selected this incredible seaside location, built a dedicated Mickey Mouse train to connect to the main MTR line, built two beautiful hotels and a nice lake for paddle boating, and, a small, mediocre park??!! There were only 10-15 rides in total and you can walk around the park in less than an hour. Anyhow, our kids loved all the rides, the parade, Lion King and Mickey Mouse shows and we could tell they this really the highlights of their vacation in Hong Kong. We realized that instead of packing our daily schedule with a sightseeing hit-list with whiny kids, it is simply more enjoyable to slow down and treasure the moment as a family. The kids were so happy every day and this is more important for us than going to one more temple or museum. On our fourth day it rained in the morning so we decided to stay in. We discovered that there’s a kids club at the hotel and my kids decided to go check it out. It offers organized activities throughout the day but kids need to be accompanied by their parents. It is really geared toward little kids and my son quickly grew bored and I decided to take him into Kowloon for some sightseeing and shopping. My daughter loved it and ended up staying there for two hours while my husband tried to finish up a book sitting on a Mickey Mouse chair. Several of the princess characters came to visit the kids club and she later had a tea party with Cinderella and Snow White by herself. The characters chatted with her for a very long time and she was truly happy. The characters seemed to hang out in the lobby every so often to greet the guests and later on she also met Alice (in the wonderland) and Mulan in the lobby. Needless to say this was the highlight of my daughter’s entire Asia trip! The concierge service at the Kingdom club was fantastic! We frequently stay at 5-star hotels such as the Four Seasons and I would say that the concierge service was better than ANY hotel we’ve stayed in. One afternoon my husband and I decided that we’ve had enough of the room service food and overpriced resort restaurants, and that we should go into town for a nice dinner. As we were flipping through our guide books, I thought a dinner at Felix at the Peninsula Hotel with a view of Victoria Harbor will make up for my husband’s having to spend our anniversary at Disneyland (he originally wanted to go to Bali but I talked him into going to Hong Kong. Even though he did not complain I knew this was far from his idea of spending our anniversary). I remember it was pass 2pm in the afternoon when I walked into the Kingdom Club and told the concierge about my dinner plan. As I was talking to the concierge I realized we also needed a babysitter for the kids. The concierge smiled and said he would try his best, he just had to make a few phone calls to see whether he could find us a babysitter (the hotel has a 24-hr advanced reservation policy). While he was on the phone, another concierge called the Peninsula, told them she had two VIP guests celebrating anniversary, then apparently the call was transferred to another person and she started speaking rapidly in Cantonese. A few minutes later she told us that she was able to secure us a table with a view. At 5:30pm our sitter arrived, after spending some time with the sitter to make sure our kids were in good hands, my husband and I started our 40-minute trek to Kowloon. At 7pm we were seated at one of the best tables at Felix on the 28th floor of the Peninsula Hotel, right by the window, with unobstructed view of the Victoria Harbor. We toasted champagne, had a fantastic 3-course dinner, and watched Symphony of Lights together. It was truly a memorable evening and it took a team of dedicated and capable concierge to make it happen! Even though our vacation plan was unexpectedly modified by our kids, it was overall a very nice, enjoyable vacation. The Disneyland Hotel is truly a gem, and I will highly recommend this hotel, especially the Kingdom Club, to any family with small children as a comfortable alternative base from the rest of the hustle and bustle of Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Well, it's Disney :)”
Reviews.Author: PKa
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights on Feb 09. We arrived pretty early, 11am and they had one of our rooms ready, the other was read as promised, at 3PM. After purchasing our park tickets we headed to Buddha and Citygate outlets. We arrived back to our hotel, took a little break and headed to park for a quick look and something to eat. The next morning we went straight to the park, spent the whole day there and arrived to hotel and went for dinner in Enchancet Garden, the character buffet. The buffet was excellent, lots of selection and the quality was goof. And the characters, well, they were just great, goofying with everyone of us, ok the restautant was pretty empty, so maybe that explains that, but we loved our dinner. It was pricy, but, hey, it's Disney :) The room, clean, comfy, excellent beds etc. Our room had a balcony facing the park, so we could listen the elephants on Jungle Cruise :) Service was very good, nothing was too much to ask from the helpfull staff. And the lobby...man, it is beatiful. All in all, of all the Disney hotels we have stayed, this has been the best so far, no we have to test the last one (California), then we have completed our Disney world tour :) -Pete

Reviews.Title: “Wondeful stay”
Reviews.Author: Arriadne
Reviews.Content: I'll make this short: This is the best hotel I have ever stayed in! =)

Reviews.Title: “Believe in the Magic!”
Reviews.Author: LilaNfry
Reviews.Content: We went to see Disneyland HK during the CNY (chinese new year) holidays for the 3rd time in after 2 years. This time we stayed at the Victorian Style Disneyland Hotel instead of the Hollywood Hotel since we've been there twice. I tried to booked us at the Fantasia Room but was dissappointed to know that it was fully booked due to the golden week holidays in China. The Sea View and the Kingdom Club Rooms were offered to me and I opted to take the Sea View room being much cheaper then plus my wife would go on a fit if she found out how much I "splurged" on my year-end pay. On the day we came, there were lots of people from the mainland as guests but surprisingly their check-in queue was much faster than the other hotel eventhough there were more people in comparison with our previous stays. As expected due to their number of guests, we weren't given our rooms yet so we took our tickets and went to the park. The park was all jam-packed with people on every corner and we were not able to take all of the rides or see some of the shows like the Lion King, the boat ride to Tarzan's house or the Disney Parade even when we stayed until 9PM. We did not get the "play for 2 days" ticket because the golden week were considered special holidays. As we went back to the hotel to get our keys for the Seaview Room; I secretly wished that the front desk would give us an upgrade to the Kingdom Club Room for free at least to make our stay a bit better. Disney's magic seemed to have worked as the clerk at the front-desk informed me then that we were upgraded to the Kingdom Club Room! So we got freebies to boot like evening snacks, breakfast, morning and afternoon tea/snacks etc.. As a result, I cancelled the buffet breakfast for the following morning. I actually saved money on this trip! My wife and kids did not seemed to understand when I told them about the upgrade; (I saw the rooms at their website) till they saw the room themselves. The bathroom was simply beyond their words with my 6 year old daughter squealing that they had a TV inside the bathroom too! So she and her little brother stayed longer at the tub while watching their cartoons. The beds were soft and fluffy and had extra pillows hidden at the media cabinet. I loved the balcony with the romantic view of the sea and over-looking their outdoor swimming pool, it had chairs for you to sit on while you breathe all that fresh air, I think. The outdoor pool was closed for maintenance but we got to use their indoor pool and had it to ourselves since it appears no one knew about the indoor pool. My kids were also pleasantly surprised about the snacks at the Kingdom Club Lounge as well and had an eating binge or was that just me. I normally pay attention to the desserts table so lots of mini-cakes, cookies and pastries. The free breakfast was also great! I'll give it two words~~~smoked salmon! All in all, our stay at the park may not be that enjoyable because of the holiday crowd but I think we wouldn't get that upgrade if they weren't fully booked, maybe. Disneyland Hotel made our stay memorable that it was the best vacation we had. Just Magical, if you will. The next time, we will definitely take the Kingdom Club rooms and use more of our time at the hotel and lounge. Who knows, we might even get a room upgrade again maybe at their Kingdom Suite on that next visit!

Reviews.Title: “upscale hotel”
Reviews.Author: edwin_f
Reviews.Content: The hotel room is pretty spacious with Hong Kong standard. The furniture looks classy but the workmanship is so so. The view is good. I booked a garden view room and I could see the garden then the pier and the ocean. The inside of the hotel looked pretty nice with real band playing soft music on the balcony. There was plenty of staff around to serve. I guessed not all of them are fluent in English (that may be the reason why some reviews said they were not responding). They have 2 pretty nice swimming pools, one outdoor and one indoor. There is a park owned by Disney with a small lake in the middle. You can ride bicycle and row boat. It is free to the public with not many people. You can easily go there with the Disney free shuttle. We went to the next door hotel – Disney Hollywood for buffet dinner, it has quite a varieties of food of good taste. This is a Victorian style hotel, but Hollywood is more modern style and my son likes that one better. There were Disney characters in the hotels to take photos with, which is quite unusual. You can easily reach the hotel by underground train. They have special trains with windows like Mickey’s head and Disney decoration inside. I think they also have special route from airport to Disney, which may be a good idea when stop over.

Reviews.Title: “The best”
Reviews.Author: natashaarora
Reviews.Content: wonderfull is the word!! the food and ambience was great! And a cinderella too was in the lobby evry morning! The disneyland just walking distance! And the staff alwayas with a huge smile! Come here to belive!the magical experiance!

Reviews.Title: “magic is really an illusion”
Reviews.Author: ryu1974
Reviews.Content: I have mixed feelings about my stay at disneyland hotel. The hotel itself is beautiful, beautiful lobby, beautiful gardens and rooms. The stay was let down by the quality of the staff and the ambiance of chaos. There were plenty of staff around but very few of them useful. We found many avoided eye contact or simply ignored you so wouldn't have to do any work apart from stand around. The checkin was total chaos. The location of the bell services meant that there were lugguage and people everywhere, blocking you from easily getting to the reception. There was a very minor mix up with my booking but I was shocked by the rudeness and incompetance of the service. Not what I would expect from a supposed 5 star premises. Also the strict 3PM checkin time is a bit self indulgent. We arrived in the early morning on a long haul flight. The hotel would not allow us early check in (in any form!) so we were faced with the options of waiting 5 hours in the crowded lobby or going into Disneyland with 2 tired grumpy kids. I've been faced with similar situations before in my travels but Disneyland Hotel has to be by far the most imcompetant handling of the situation ever. The rooms were large, clean and comfortable. Our room had a great view of the garden maze and the sea. The all day Disney channels were a huge hit with the kids. The disney toiletries are a nice touch. The food at the hotel is overpriced and very average at best. Because of the location of the hotel being issolated, you're going to have to live with it. The Disney Character breakfast is worthwhile for the kids but be warned the quality of the food is on par with a 3 star hotel. The regular breakfast is of similar low quality offerings with less choice. We found the hotel not well designed for people with disabilities and young children in prams. Apart from the main entrance, all other exits are heavy swing doors, many of them quite narrow. there were also lots of stairs with no ramps or lifts nearby. The hotel has spent a lot of time thinking up fine details such as costumes for staff and mickey mouse motifs on carpets but has spent far too little time in training staff on how to meet the minimal standards of service. This is why the hotel was a let down.

Reviews.Title: “Over Priced Food”
Reviews.Author: megey
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hong Kong Disneyland Hotel for 4 nights in Januray at the end of a month long world trip as a treat for our 3 and 4 year old. The Hotel is clean, easy to reach from airport and also easy to access via public transport as per previous reviews. I do want to say that possibly for Australians the food offer is expensive on our exchange rate - AUD$100 for dinner buffet which is of RSL quality. Breakfast with the characters is great fun but the food is very poor quality - if a 3 and 4 year don't eat a donut with chocolate icing and sprinkles you know something is wrong with it! Children over 3 have to pay for all buffet meals even if 2 adults dining as well - which is a bit rich - they wanted to charge our 3 year old for the afternoon tea buffet when all she ate was half a buttered scone! For a hotel that caters for kids a few more kids deals would be appreciated.They bring out plastic Disney bowls and cutlery for young children - which is a nice touch. No dinner menu for kids - had to order a ham and cheese sandwich which cost AUD$20! Housekeeping is very efficient as is the Front Desk, Bell Desk and Valet but they really need to overhaul the Food and Beverage Department. Never saw a senior chef or manager patrolling the restaurant and observing the buffet and what people were eating. The food inside the park is disgusting - the burger patties are like saw dust so keep away from them! The Novotel Citigate which is very close on the MTR ( get off at Tung Chung) has a great buffet for half the price. I recommend heading there for a meal rather! Tung Chung is an outlet mall so there are a few other food outlets including a great food court which does a nice Korean BBQ. Dont feel trapped at the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in HK for kids”
Reviews.Author: MisterMannyMann
Reviews.Content: As one that had previously stayed in Disney park hotels in Disneyland Calif. and Walt Disney World, I was expecting to be disappointed, as usual, as both park hotels were really not up to par. But I must say, I was in for a surprise, as this was a great hotel and it is much, much better than I expected, and in contrast, was much better than other Disney-affiliated hotels several times over. I had a 4-year-old in my party, and in comparison to other HK hotels I had stayed in during my trip, I could easily say this was the best hotel to stay in with a child, not just for the duration for your stay in the resort, but as a "hub" in HK. Many would disagree, due to the long distance between Kowloon/HK Island and the resort, but the MTR's efficient enough to justify. Only about 15-20 minutes to Central. And, as the MTR's so efficient, my group went to the resort via train. And, literally, we got the Disney experience right at the start of our travels - the Disneyland Resort Line on the MTR has dedicated, purpose-built trains that was customised for that Disney look, including Disney windows, doors and decorations! That was a treat in itself! Getting to the hotel was a quick bus ride away from the station - shuttle buses are available for a useful means of transport - 10 mins between buses looping as the Park -> Disneyland Hotel -> Hollywood Hotel -> Park. Check-in was quick and efficient. As we were before check-in time, we were able to drop our bags and head to the park, which I really appreciated. The room in itself is a leap ahead than other hotels in the other Disney parks! They had much, much more attention to detail, with Disney personalisation everywhere, which I would want, because it's Disney. Spacious beds that you can sleep on (unlike other HK hotel beds!), a very decent bathroom, a spacious closet fitted with the typical robes/slippers (and what I found soooooo cute was there was a little bath robe specially for my 4-year-old!), and a plasma. I especially like this room because since I have indicated that I had a kid in my party, and they catered specifically for her. What they failed to realise though is that my 4-year-old is not a baby - while we were in the park, they had put in a crib, a potty, and other several baby-related items though. I could see why they got confused - my 4-year-old got her passport 4 years ago, so they would mistake her picture for a baby, and forgot to check the date of birth! That's OK, though, because I love that little gesture. Broadband Internet was available, like most good hotels, housekeeping attended all my needs, and, as an Australian, was excited to hear that Australia Network was actually available in a hotel! On the subject on TV, most channels are in Putonghua/Cantonese, except for about out of 20 channels. There were the typical Disney Channel and Playhouse Disney as you would expect, but they threw in a Bedtime Stories channel, which I found useful. What I didn't like, though, was that a 24-hour news channel, i.e. CNN or BBCWN, was not available, as one who keeps up with the news, but at least the Bloomberg & CNBC financial channels were available. Room service was efficient, but mediocre and expensive. But that's the norm for most hotels. As I had swapped my booking from the Disneyland Hollywood Hotel to the Disneyland Hotel I did not have a booking for breakfast at the hotel and only at Chef Mickey at the Hollywood Hotel, so I can't vouch for the restaurants at the hotel. But what was great that after eating at Chef Mickey, instead of catching the shuttle bus and going to the park then the hotel, complimentary vans were available to take you directly from the Hollywood Hotel to the Disneyland Hotel. You need to pay for use of the sauna, which is quite stupid. Also, there isn't much else to do at the hotel except go in their pool, which was closed for renovation, and go through their maze, which was small but nice. The Disney Princesses made an appearance by the lobby, whereas at the other Disney hotels I've stayed in only made character appearances at the Character Breakfasts. Check out efficient, as was able to split the bill easily (had booked 4 rooms). All in all, it is a decent hotel. But this is not a great hotel to stay in if you are just travelling with adults, but if you are with kids, this is the best hotel to stay in when in Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “More Pixie Dust Please...”
Reviews.Author: ryu0803
Reviews.Content: We are big fan of Disney. It is not about Mickey Mouse or the other kids' stuff, it is the Disney's idea of selling a storybook experience that we love so much. We had stayed at a number of other Disney resorts including the Grand Floridian, the Beach Club, the Polynesian, the Swan in Orlando, the Grand Califorian in LA, the Disneyland Hotel in Paris and both the Disney Magic and Wonder, the cruise ships. Although the Disney hotels do not have the sophistication of the other luxurious hotel brands, the Disney spirit always make up for what they fall short in any area. We stayed in this hotel several times before and this was our second time celebrating the new year here. We enjoyed our visit in the past but we were disappointed this time. Disney is selling fantasy. Their staff should keep in mind at all time that they are cast members and their jobs are to "perform". Quite a few members we met during our stay were not delivering, they were just doing their jobs like staff of a 3-star hotel. We had New Year's Eve dinner at the Crystal Lotus, the Chinese restaurant. There was set dinner for the night and also a la carte selection on the menu. We asked the waitress if we must order the set dinner. She answered "yes" immediately. We asked again why there was a la carte selection on the menu. Then she said if we were given a menu with the a la carte items, we could order that too and she walked away. What?! We stayed on the club floor so breakfast at the Kingdom Club was included. The time for breakfast was until 10:00am only. When we arrived at 9:15am, the club was filled with guests and there was a waiting list for table. We were asked to go back to our room and wait for their call and it was really annoying. Worst of all, the staff did not act apologetic at all. Obviously, it happened all the time. We were finally being seated at the Grand Salon at the lobby for breakfast. When we visited about a year ago, there was free mini-bar for rooms on the club floor. As I recalled, there were a bag of M&M's, a pack of Oreo and a few cans of soft drink. It was nice to have something to munch on while watching TV at night. A small treat contributed a lot to the enjoyment of guests. It was a bad move cancelling this small benefit. When we checked out, we met the same robotic girl who did our check in. Again, she finished the paperwork efficiently but she showed no concern at all about our stay. Other staff were also busy cleaning up the breakfast and they just walked by us without even a greeting or a smile. And it was the New Year Day!! I was prepared to write a great review before my visit. It was sad that my experience turned out to be a negative one. We hope the Disney management will strengthen the training and select people with more passion to deliver the Disney dream. Without the Disney Magic, this property is just a 4-star hotel in an amusement park.

Reviews.Title: “The happiest place on earth!”
Reviews.Author: TopazHorizon
Reviews.Content: My husband's parents celebrated their anniversary by bringing the entire clan to Hong Kong Disneyland. We stayed at the magical Hong Kong Disneyland Hotel. The architecture, the furnishings, the design were all Victorian-inspired so it was quite breathtaking. But it's the details that really made our jaws drop: glass slippers in the crystal chandeliers, Mickey Mouse on the tiles (and everywhere else actually), Donald and Goofy on the rug, Snow White and the Seven Dwarfs carved on the bathroom mirror frame, Alice in Wonderland characters on the cozy quilts! Amazing! The rooms were cozy but the bathrooms were large. Perfect! All the windows looked out onto a magnificent view--depending on where you are, you either get the hills or the sea. The air in the rooms were rather dry however. Maybe they need a humidifier... The food was fabulous. If there's one thing the Chinese are excellent at, it's food! The breakfast buffet had a cafeteria-like atmosphere though--noisy and chaotic. That's to be expected, with all the kids running around and getting frightened or excited by the Disney mascots walking about. The Disney mascots are great! We loved Cinderella and Sleeping Beauty best. Mickey Mouse, however, kissed me so I thought that was rather forward, especially with my husband and his family there! We had a wonderful time at Hong Kong Disneyland hotel. It was definitely a magical time and I can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Magnificent Stay”
Reviews.Author: WORLDTRAVELLER6
Reviews.Content: I choose this Hotel as I had previously stayed at the Disneyland Hollywood Hotel and not been very happy with my stay and decided that next time I would stay at this Hotel instead and organised my stay through the Hotel itself. It was the right decision for myself and my family as we were all delighted with the rooms we had been given and the helpfullness and friendliness of the staff who ensured our stay was a very special one. It was also my birthday during my stay and everyone was very kind and a little gift was left for me when I arrived we then had dinner in the chinese restaurant in the Hotel and they brought me out a cake and sang Happy Birthday which was lovely. It was my parents first visit to Hong Kong and they were so delighted with the Hotel. The view from the balcony was really lovely and peaceful and the the Hotel was immaculately cleaned both inside and outside. The granduer of the Hotel lobby is also lovely. I could not find one fault with the hotel or the rooms and we were really sad to leave after our stay of 4 nights. I most definately recommend this Hotel to anyone, the Kingdom Club is wonderful and you can see the fireworks in Disneyland of an evening from their balcony and the staff in there are really courteous and helpful. All in all I am very impressed with the Hotel and the staff and thank them for a wonderful stay. Most especially the Guest Service Manager who was exceptional.

Reviews.Title: “5 Star? Maybe in Price but that's about it...”
Reviews.Author: KimFamRep
Reviews.Content: If you've ever stayed at another 5-star Disneyland hotel then this will pale in comparison...a 4 star at best when it comes to the service and the "nickel and dime" treatment. There were some nice things like the Disney Princesses showing up in the hotel lobby (and not having to wait in long lines at the park), as well as the child's sized bathrobe and slippers in the rooms. The rooms were modest in size but at least the beds were comfortable (some hotels in Asia give you the equivalent of a box spring to sleep on; they're so firm). Here are some things we were a little "put off" by: There are no movies to watch in your room (i.e. when you put your little one down to sleep and stay in the room), not even pay-per-view. The "many" Disney channels they offer are actually a couple channels of repeat TV shows offered in several languages; the same thing on three channels but one in English, Cantonese, and Mandarin. Another irritant was that guests (who were already paying at least $300 USD per night), were asked to pay an additional fee to go into the locker room of the spa and use the whirlpool or sauna. Basically, I could work out in the gym or pool but had to go get cleaned up in my room. What?! I understand having to pay for services like massage, but these were more expensive (and fewer minutes) than anywhere I've found in Asia. Concerning prices, be prepared to spend a ridiculous amount of money on average food. The enticement for their buffet is that the Disney characters come greet you at your table (Mickey, Goofy, Daisy, Pluto...). It is admittedly fun for one meal, even worth the $30 USD per person for breakfast once, but the food was quite average. Dinner prices were $75 USD per person and also only average. This is more than double the money than at some of the very nice buffets at the Grand Californian at the LA Disneyland - where the food and service is much better. Concerning service, it is also passable but again not "5-star" and certainly not what westerners might be used to. There is definitely no "customer is always right" mentality or even close. I was given misinformation by hotel staff about the availability of suites, misinformation by my travel agent about the items including in our package (which the hotel could have accommodated very easily), and several other things. When I brought some of these things to the attention of management (Grace and Theresa I think), the answer I was given was, "I understand, but we've only been here a short time" (referring to the hotel only being in existence for a couple years). I was floored at the response and disappointed at the total disregard for my concerns and no attempt to "improve our stay" as they claim they will do. The only final things worth mentioning is that the hotel and park are in the middle of nowhere, so if you want to eat somewhere else, stop by a convenience store, etc. you have to travel pretty far. We felt a bit like prisoners and like we hadn't actually been to Hong Kong. The subway (MRT) is pretty convenient at least. Last but not least, everyone knows that this is the smallest of the Disneyland parks. Young children can enjoy the rides, but teens will likely find it difficult to stay entertained with the lack of adrenaline-inducing rides.

Reviews.Title: “Only for disney fans”
Reviews.Author: cendut
Reviews.Content: I know most people (if not all) that are staying in this hotel are doing it because they are going to see disneyland. And I know you have to be disney hardcore fans in order to stay in this hotel, because you are planning to visit the theme park at least two days in a row. As a disney fan, I think this is your cup of tea--disney toiletteries, a maze in the shape of mickey right outside your room, breakfast with disney characters, a disneyland gift shop at the lobby, etc. But since I'm no disney fan (at least not that much), reviewing this hotel from a 'neutral traveller' point of view brings out my gloomy side. The hotel itself is gloomy, the tiles and lighting and carpets looks old and dark, made worse by the always cloudy skies when I was staying there. The room service is dissapointing. This is China and even chinese food tasted bad. Not to mention expensive too! I guess me being in the middle of nowhere results in being overcharged for bad food. The breakfast at the enchanted garden/basement restaurant is very expensive by hk standards.. 250 HKD! and it's not that delicious either. The room is ok, in a victorian decor but again, it just feels old dark and... gloomy. Cmon, this is supposed to be the happiest place on earth! at least the tv is big, but they told me the hotel is an all twin bed hotel. the bed was also hard, and having a band playing disney tunes right outside your room well into 10 pm can be a little.. noisy. But again, I guess people staying at the hotel are into the disney stuff so they wouldn't and shouldn't mind.

Reviews.Title: “Magical Stay at the Disneyland Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kat33
Reviews.Content: My husband, two young kids and I had a great time at HK Disney and this was enhanced by our stay at the Hong Kong Disneyland Hotel. If you have a young child with you (I had my 2 year old), it's really worth it to stay near the park especially come afternoon nap time. We stayed on the Kingdom Club floor (7th floor) and were treated to cheerful, personalized service by the staff. At the lounge, we enjoyed a hassle free check in, all-day complimentary snacks and beverages (including a delicious breakfast buffet), video rentals and someone to assist us with everything we needed. The kids loved seeing the characters in the lobby, checking out the activities in the kids' play room, the garden maze and swimming in the huge pools (indoor and outdoor). Even simple things like hidden Mickeys and fairy tale characters in the carpet, bed spreads, mirrors, etc. were greatly appreciated by my kids. The only negative for me was the lack of places to eat at for dinner -- the food at the hotel restaurants was just average and quite pricey. Despite this, we had a great time. We will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mktraveller
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for one night on the 25 September. We travelled to the hotel from the airport by public transport, which was a bit of a pain. A bus, MTR and another bus. We took a cab back and it was HK$130 and well worth the extra. Check in was fine, swift and pleasant and we were able to buy our park tickets then. The room was comfortable and I loved the tiny kids robe in the wardrobe. The beds were comfortable and the air con efficient. The room was heavily carpeted and it was one of the quietest hotels I've stayed in. We arrived quite late, but we had to eat almost immediately as the restaurants closed at 11pm and there was no 24 hour coffee shop. We ate two dinners and a breakfast in the hotel and the food was good, plenty of it and the staff attentive. We loved the layout and old fashioned atmosphere of the hotel. A nice way to complete our holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Kids will always love the DH ..”
Reviews.Author: Bishan
Reviews.Content: A little less enjoyable in our 2nd visit here. We were given the seaview room - not sure why, but the air in the room we stayed in, was very dry. We missed having the balcony (even though it was garden view) in our 1st time. Still, it was an opportunity to check out the seaview this round, and the pool scene was not bad and it was not noisy. The kids' pool is very nice and clean for kids ; and they have a great indoor pool for adults. We wish they have a shower hose in the bathrooms; pillows were a little firmer ; and service could be a little more personalised. Did raise the issues with the management ; and they responded (through email) even before we arrived home, which was good. DH is a good choice if you like space and fun in a location for your juniors .. and yourselves.

Reviews.Title: “Magical Hong Kong Disneyland Hotel”
Reviews.Author: eeliechick
Reviews.Content: On our last trip to Hong Kong we visited Hong Kong Disneyland. The hotel was very comfortable, Victorian Style hotel, everything in the room was tailored to Disney including the toiletries, carpet, bedspread, bathroom mirror! The hotel caters well for children, offering nighttime movies and stories (Disney of course), a maze in the shape of Mickey, a pool, and many character sightings around the resort. The room was a garden view room which is the lead in which was very spacious & lovely we had a lovely balcony which looked out to the pool & the gardens I felt it was a lovely view. There was a Queen Bed & a sofa bed which converted to a Queen Bed so if you have a family of four there is plenty of room. You get complimentary slippers which mickey ears on them. The foyer was lovely & so were the bars around the hotel, there is even a merchandise store with very reasonably priced disney merchandise. Staff were very helpful & can even post things for you & hold your luggage in the store room. There is a shuttle which is very frequent to Disneyland. The next morning, we enjoyed the character breakfast in the enchanted garden restaurant, it was sumptuous & we even indulged in a chocolate mickey waffle. We met Mickey, Goofy, Daisy & Pluto it was a slow process but eventually we were able to get a photo with them all. We had a fantastic stay here and it was convenient to stay here on our last two days as we visisted Disneyland & Ngong Ping 360 & then we were close & convenient to the airport aswell. We just had the most fantastic time here & at Disneyland we are sure to return!

Reviews.Title: “Sleepless Nights - Hardest Beds in the world”
Reviews.Author: Diskdr
Reviews.Content: We stayed fr the last two days of our holiday on the 7th (Kingdom Floor) to take advantage of the lounge, and breakfast food and drinks throw in, as part of a 13 day stay in Hong Kong. Compared to the 5 star hotel we came from, the Grand Stanford DisneyLand Hotel is a grand 4 star at best. Yes they did the 5 star bit on booking in, but the louge -- well it was a pain to get a second drink and is was also like they were counting every thing we had - not 5 star by a long chalk. We took advange of advice from the Disney booking help desk (which I emailed) and book one annual pass, this gave you 15% discunt off the hotel and not only pays for itsself - but discounts the room nice. The room two beds - and the worse hardest matresses we have every encountered -- so much so my wife slept on the floor - on night two. Compared to Disney Florida, the park is a joke you can walk around it in 30 minutes. Space mountain a two seater rise is good. One other thing, the Chinese nation had not learned to queue and will fill any gap ahead of you with themseles. They are not being rude, its just the way they are, so keep you patience and yes tap them on the shoulder and barge ahead -- I would not stay at the hotel for more than 2 days - and the ticket is buy one day get the net free. Food -- try he swimming pool (excellent pool) bar the food comes out of the main kitchen. Taxi to the Airport is 120HK dollars, forget the train, and mega exspensive hotel cars... the taxi drivers in HK are fine. Finally -- we did the overpriced buffet -- and after the 15th hands over your eyes by a far to friendly character and pushy photographer, when they realised we had not brought the camera - major shock for them, and the birthday party noise nearby - with children who wanted to move my wife out the way every 2 minutes... we had had enough and left ---- if they put you in a table in the middle of a walkthorugh -- move. Two night and bring an airbed for sleeping on.

Reviews.Title: “Real Holiday Feeling”
Reviews.Author: George123R
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights. The service was excellent. Due to our flight being delayed, we only arrived at the early hours of the morning. The staff was very helpfull ad welcomed us on our names. The did everything possible to ensure checkin goes fast as they wanted us to get to our room asap. Breakfast at the Enchanted Garden was great. My son enjoyed the presence of the Disney characters. The children felt so special to meet their Disney stars. Food was great and cater for all groups. The rest of the restaurants were a bit of a dissapointment - very overprised. Please ensure you have enough cash as the Foreign Exchange office only exchange US Dollars, British Pounds & Euros, which was a bit of a dissapointment if you travel with another currency. Check out went very well. I must say the staff were very helpfull and friendly and always make time to make your child feel special. Will defenitely stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in a beautiful setting but....”
Reviews.Author: Disney_Mastermind
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on a recent trip to Hong Kong for 2 nights in a "Sea View with Balcony" room. The Hong Kong Disneyland Hotel is one of two hotels in the resort and is a very close walk to the park. Hong Kong Disneyland itself was very disappointing and much too small, but we did enjoy the hotel. The hotel is designed in a turn of the century, Victoria style design. The lobby is very elegant, with lots of seating and beautiful chandeliers. There is even a functional caged elevator that gives off a period feel. Large arched windows allowed lots of sunlight to fill this airy area. The pubic spaces in the hotel are very well themed and full of detail, a trademark of most Disney hotels. There were subtle Disney touches like Hidden Mickeys and other character motifs throughout the hotel. Our room was a fair size, with two double beds and a nice sitting area. Bathroom was quite nice, with a single sink and a small bathtub. Not too bad for the price we paid for the room (about $350). The balcony in the room was fairly small but we had a wonderful view of the South China Sea. Room itself was nothing too spectacular though. Beautiful, but pretty standard overall. Our major disappointment was with the restaurants. Food at the park was very poor and limited, but we expected better at the hotel. When we ordered room service, the food was only warm and rather tasteless. Dinner at their flagship restaurant Crystal Lotus was good but very overpriced. There are far better options in the city. The buffet at Enchanted Garden Restaurant was not particularly impressive, and the food was only so-so. The Disney characters were a very nice touch though, interacting with every table and such. Afternoon tea at the Grand Salon was very average. Definitely not in the same league as say, the Peninsula Hong Kong's but much cheaper. Overall, we had an enjoyable stay but were not amazed. The hotel is clearly meant to cater to families and as such, it would not be fair to compare it to a 5-star hotel or expect that level of luxury. That being said, I felt the dining options could be significantly improved upon. And the service, while friendly and generally welcoming, could be further polished. I would probably stay here again but will not make the mistake of dining at the hotel (or anywhere in the resort) in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Susanfan
Reviews.Content: The hotel was ok~ clean with a professional front desk and front door chauffers.... but overall a bit impersonal in my opinion. The restaurants were great~ although a little expensive, all the dishes tasted great, even the room service foods were good. The room was clean but no nitely turn-down service (which is kind of weird)...The lobby is very noisy and crowded and so was the pool.... one little complaint about the cartoon characters in the "Enchanted Garden" buffet restaurant... The nite that we ate there the "minnie mouse" was getting really obnoxious and rude, fooling around with his friends (employees taking photos) and my daughter got kind of sad because "minnie" completely ignored her!! All in all, i thought the hotel was average and nothing too bad about it, but just nothing too special.

Reviews.Title: “Happy Birthday”
Reviews.Author: bilibalahk
Reviews.Content: This is my second visit. Have been there last Dec, nice experience (though tripadvisor seems not like the review, it was not uploaded inspite of repeated tries...). Since it was for my birthday, my name was displayed on the screen of lobby TV. A small gift was also given. Last time I stayed with my family in a seaview balancy room overlooking the garden and sea. This time we choose the Kingdom Club room. Room size is a bit bigger and we are lucky enough to get similar nice view. The lounge in the Club floor provides snacks & light meal. Some fireworks of Disneyland can be viewed on the floor. There is also complimentary use of steam/ jacuzzi in the Spa. I made use of ALL these privileges of course, together with the gym and pool facilities. We go back in vew of last time's nice experience. In general, this visit is even better. I may try another room type in future (when there's promotion...).

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for Adults too”
Reviews.Author: Nicinici
Reviews.Content: I am a local Hong Kong people and booked a spa + stay package for our anniversary. The spa is perfect in all aspects. The spa room, the therapist, the staff, the amenities and the atmosphere are all with top standard. The hotel room is also clean and spacious. Completely sound proof. There should be kids running and playing around but we were not disturbed at all.

Reviews.Title: “a big wow !”
Reviews.Author: lamzai
Reviews.Content: was there 3 day and 2 nights with wife, 2 kids, maid and parents in law.Booked 2 adjoining kingdom club room but was upgraded to presidential suite. Totally unreal, with living room kitchen guest room balcony that runs the whole length. Wow! Once in a llifetime experience! Must go enchanted dinner, great variety of international offering of high quality, must also try the chinese restaurant for the beautiful ambience. Staff were very polite and friendly compared to our experience in Langham Mongkok which we stayed the day before which was more "cold" and less personal. Everything was child friendly, and atmosphere was so family oriented. Will visit again next year....during off peak for better service and extra attention!!!.

Reviews.Title: “A very lovely hotel!”
Reviews.Author: cutiela83
Reviews.Content: Compared to the other Disney Hotel in the same area with Hollywood theme, this one is significantly less crowded. The hotel is beautiful, the room is spacious and the service is excellent. I still remember one time we came back to our room when it was already dark outside to find the lights in our room had been turned on and in the bathroom sat a cute little ghost made out of white towel, what a lovely surprise and to me little charming things like that leave such lovely memories of the place. After all, it's Disneyland!

Reviews.Title: “magical place”
Reviews.Author: docviki
Reviews.Content: magical experience.......... freinds please take a annual pass for the park (appox hk$460 for a kid) it gives u 50% off on the room tariffs, my agent was taking me for a ride when i took over and made all bookings myself. sea view room for 2 adults & 2 kids for 3 nights with 2 day park pass cost me only hk$4500 (steal).......do vist the ngong ping cable car (train form mtr at park to tung chung station), the giant sitting budhha is great and cable car ride of 25 mins is breathtaking......also avial the 10% off on ocean park with cable ticket. back to the hotel ..what place .i did not want to leave ,my kids tooooo,everything is perfect the room ,view the pool the garden.dont misss this hotell

Reviews.Title: “Magical Disneyland Hotel”
Reviews.Author: gooz
Reviews.Content: Hi Disneyland ,everything you could wish for and more. Incredibly beautiful at night when lit up like a palace ,great service and luxury all around. I have stayed at many Hotels but would rate this as one of the best in the world.The breakfast at Enchanted Garden restaurant had about 100 choices and so was great value considering you were also entertained by the Disney Characters.It is not necessarily quiet as the children are so delighted to see Mickey etc. We booked using an Annual Disney Pass from the website and got the Hotel at half price plus food and gift discounts too. Fantastic value for the quality.We had drinks at the Hollywood Hotel and it was fun too but for the extra price Disneyland Hotel was more luxurious. Highly recommend Disneyland Hotel for any age and great as an alternative peaceful break. to hectic HongKong. Transport was quite easy although it did involve changes from bus to train but they link up so its just a case of going from one to the other.Enjoy your stay.

Reviews.Title: “A Splurge that was well worth it”
Reviews.Author: JackR46
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a fantasia room at the Hong Kong Disneyland for three nights. We would agree with all of the positive statements made by other reviewers. Spacious, deluxe room with all of the "Disney touches" (Sleepy "do not disturb" sign for door, Snow White and 7 dwarfs in bathroom mirror frame, etc). Luxorious bathroom with great dual shower spiquets and jaccuzi tub. Comfortable king-sized bed. Room immaculately clean. Great view of harbor and garden maze. Staff very courteous. Common rooms and rest of buildings - super design and furnishings. Great atmosphere for families and children, (even though there were just the two of us, we enjoyed these aspects too). Besides Disneyland itself, easy transfer by the special Disnelyand line to the main train line and from there only one stop to the cable car to see the "Big Buddha" . Spent another day in Hong Kong/Kowloon. Only took about 25 minutes on the metro system to get to downtown Hong Kong and Victoria peak station. (Go spend some time in the Hong Kong Historical Museum!) Easy taxi drive to and from airport. Cannot say anything negative about our stay here - except that we would have loved to have just stayed a few more days just to enjoy the hotel itself.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ilovediving
Reviews.Content: Our main aim was to go to Disneyland so it was either this hotel or the other pricier hotel. Hollywood did not disappoint. Check-in was at 2pm and my first impression was the friendly and courteous bellhops. The lobby was very posh and clean. The receptionists spoke excellent English. The room was very clean and my kids were thrilled by the Mickey Mouse logos around the room. It was so easy getting to Disneyland, there is a big shuttle bus that leaves every 10 minutes from the hotel to Disneyland. Disneyland was amazing, for us adults and for our kids. It was very clean (never saw any China tourists spitting) and you see cleaners everywhere swooping down to sweep and remove rubbish from the streets. I was very impressed by the cleanliness and I thought it was far better than Gold Coast's Movieworld. I was told the best time to visit Disneyland was during weekdays, where you don't get much of a crowd, it was true. We never queued more than 5 minutes for any of the rides and the weather was absolutely perfect, nice and warm in the afternoons but once 5pm hits, the temperature takes a dive and it's cool till morning. We absolutely loved the fireworks at 8pm nightly, we were there for the 2nd night in a row and it was still enchanting to see the fireworks display. What slightly disappointed me about the hotel was that no complimentary mineral water was given and we either had to drink from the tap or buy the mineral water from the hotel's coffee-shop. We only had 2 meals at the hotel, lunch on the 1st day and bk'fast on the 2nd day. The portions were absolutely huge, so I suggest you share the meal rather than go to waste. I thought prices were reasonable, not too expensive. For 2 adults and 2 children, we spent about HKG200 for 2 big plates of spaghetti, 1 plate of rice with pork cutlet & 2 bottles of mineral water. The next morning we had the local bk'fast of dim sum which was so filling as the portions were large. My 2nd disappointment was with 'Breakfast with Mickey' that we had the next day. While we were checking in on the 1st day, we decided to take the bk'fast with Mickey, I thought it would be nice and that the kids would enjoy it. We got the the restaurant at 9am, it was a fancy chinese restaurant and the food was really very good, we had like 4 'courses' of bk'fast. I was told that Mickey and his friends would come out and mingle with the kids. Imaging our disappointment that only 2 characters came out for 1 minute just for photos, it was 'Mulan' whom my children were not familiar with and of course Mickey Mouse, but dressed in a Chinese outfit. They just came out for a minute, stood there while we took photos of them and the kids, then disappeared into the kitchen. Our disappointment was however appeased by the fantastic breakfast! If you're not carrying much luggage and if you intend to go to Kowloon or Hong Kong Island from Disneyland, it's so convenient to take the MTR, which is at the doorstep of Disneyland. It's fantastic, it's so convenient and such a pleasant ride. The hotel grounds are huge and they have a huge well manicured garden which my kids played in on our last day. My family enjoyed ourselves tremendously and we intend to holiday here again in 2 years time!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel at a fantastic price”
Reviews.Author: Bromleyfamily
Reviews.Content: We stayed here after four days in Kowloon and it was an oasis of peace and quiet. We had booked the cheapest garden view but found we had been upgraded to a sea view which was a nice surprise. Mind you February is very much off peak season and the hotel was very quiet. As you would expect from Disney, the room was immaculate with lovely touches such as Snow White toiletries, gowns for the whole family, free slippers etc. We had a night flight the following day and so paid extra for a late check out - so pleased we did. It meant we had another whole day in the park, could get showered up, eat and check out at 9pm for the 15 minute taxi ride to the airport. For the techies out there, there was free broadband and a huge flat screen plasma TV. We decided to walk to the park - it took less than 10 minutes which may have been quicker than the shuttle bus but it is not signposted, so ask the bellman which way to go. It is a very pleasant walk. If you've done Disney before you will find this the smallest park ever but what it lacks in attractions it makes up for in friendly atmosphere. The staff are wonderful (they found us most amusing for going on Space Mountain four times in a row!) and we had a lovely day - you can do the whole park in about 4 hours. Unexpected warm weather meant we managed an hour in the outdoor pool - pleasantly landscaped with a small flume - and the changing rooms there have spectacular marble showers with free luxury toiletries ( a tip for those who don't like fixed head showers - head down to the pool areas and shower there!) Finally, we ate at the buffets at both the Disneyland Hotel and the Hollywood Hotel (to save the big trek back into Hong Kong). The food is similar but the Disneyland hotel is a character meal, so you will be able to meet Mickey, Minnie etc. Even my 19 and 14 year olds weren't too big to have their pictures taken! Overall, a beautiful hotel at very reasonable rates compared to USA and Paris Disney.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is GREAT!”
Reviews.Author: Skage
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for three night. Fantastic from one end to the other. Would love to go back here some time. We travelled with two children, one fiveyearold and one ten month old baby. Our daughter had stars in here eyes the whole weekend. The staff, the room, the food, the surroundings - everything was immaculate. The breakfast with the characters was fun but a bit stressfull- we didnt eat much! Fun food for the kids and lot of choices in beverages, fruits, cakes and hot food. The park and the maze outside the hotel is very nice. The hotel atmosphere is one of a kind. Disneymusic in the background in the elevator, in the hall, the staff with names like "Cupid", "Angel" and "Princess" and the decor of the hotel that makes you feel like a princess - or prince. Bus to the park from the front of the hotel. Not far from the airport either. Only twenty minutes.

Reviews.Title: “My children did not stop smiling”
Reviews.Author: Craig F
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay here. We checked in and Cinderella and Princess Aurora were in the check-in area letting children meet them – my 3 year old daughter’s eyes nearly popped out of her head and she was grinning like the Cheshire Cat. We stayed for 3 nights. The room was a nice size, the indoor pool was lovely, the location and shuttle service to Disneyland were excellent and the breakfast with Mickey Mouse, Pluto, Minnie Mouse and Goofy in the morning in the Enchanted Garden restaurant was a fantastic experience. It is not just a stay in a hotel, it is a unique experience and one our family of 4 will do again and highly recommend. The look of excitement and enjoyment on my 2 young children’s faces was a priceless experience. We took the MRT into Kowloon and it was quite quick and easy to do. If you do so I recommend buying a day tripper pass.

Reviews.Title: “Magical Disneyland Hotel”
Reviews.Author: korean_fevah
Reviews.Content: we stayed in this hotel for just a night (December 27, 2007).. on second thought, I would have loved to have stayed longer. Staying in it was like every person's fairytale come true... everything was 'magical'... the little touches that the management have added certainly added to the 'magical' feel of the hotel. One 'minor' flaw in our otherwise perfect stay was the fire alarm that went off in the early morning of the 28th. As I was watching TV, my mum was doing her 'morning ritual'... fire alarms suddenly went off. Lucky, that we had the robes provided in the hotel to cover our state of undress as we hurriedly gathered our bags with all our valuables e.g. passports, wallet, camera etc. We stayed outside for approximately 45 minutes, without a clue as to what was happening, the thing that pissed me off was there was nobody from the management to officially explain what triggered the fire alarm. If there was fire in any part of the hotel or, if it was already safe enough to return. We had to follow the trickle of guests who decided to go back in. It was a 'pleasant' enough stay.... ask me if I would go back, I would definitely say YES!

Reviews.Title: “We Will Be Back!”
Reviews.Author: culturevulture2
Reviews.Content: This is our first Disneyland Hotel stay and my 31/2 year old son enjoyed it immensely. He was so excited when the taxi drove into the hotel's driveway. He wanted to ask the bellhop if Mickey stays there. The hotel has all the typical Disney touches - bronze statues of Mickey and Minnie at the entrance of the main entrance. Because it was Christmas season, there was a huge Christmas tree and other festive decorations. Checking-in was stress free. There is a specially created corner near the check-in counter for children to watch Disney cartoons while we complete the necessarily procedure. We reserved the Garden View room. Although it was the same level as the lobby, the room was far from the maddening crowd. It was really huge by HK standards. The two single twin beds were sufficient for the three of us. There is even a specially made stool for my son to stand on to wash his hands by the sink. If the child needs a break from Disneyland, there are Disney channels, movies and activities organised by the hotel to keep him occupied. Disneyland Hotel provides a free shuttle to Disneyland at 10 minute interval. We found visiting the park very convenient because of this service. No visit to Disneyland Hotel is complete without buffet breakfast in the Enchanted Garden. Apart from the buffet section for children, the Disney characters coming for breakfast certainly make the day of any child or adult! We will stay at the Disneyland Hotel again but we will avoid weekends!

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kmgk
Reviews.Content: It was luxury! I felt that I was in a pretty little town because it has such an attractive lobby! Checking in was fast. The room was so pretty, it was unbelievable! Especially the bathrooms - you'd want to sleep in there! Room service was extremely fast. Hotel restaurant offered a wide array of food! There's just so much to do in the hotel! It's really a five star hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great Disney Hotel”
Reviews.Author: iancarpy
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Disneyland Hotel on the way back from Sydney, and had a great time. We have stayed in Disney properties in Orlando, Anheim and Paris and this hotel rates well along side them. It is a new hotel and as such in excellent condition. We had a sea-view room (not sure whether the upgrade is worth it though?) and it was excellent. Two large beds and a lovely bathroom. Great complimentary toiletries set with a Snow White theme. We ate at the hotel a number of times and the food was excellent. We had a character breakfast and dinner and both were great. The dinner buffet was superb with an amazing choice of food. One thing we did notice with this hotel (and the resort in general) was the staffs great willingness to take photographs for you. You never have to ask for a photo to be taken for you when the characters are around A great hotel and when we visit HK again we will spend more time here

Reviews.Title: “Exclusive Kingdom Club Experience”
Reviews.Author: thefongs
Reviews.Content: Initially booked 2 rooms @ Hollywood hotel. Didn't like the noisy & defening atmosphere there so transferred to Disneyland Hotel. Had a look @ Kingdom Club Suite with a connecting Kingdom Club room. That suited us as we had 4 children. Stayed 4 nights there. Huge rooms with gigantic bathrooms. Tons of wardrobe space. Ideal for us as we had spent 6 nights in a Kowloon hotel. Kingdom Club lounge was a mixed spread of mini buffet, lots of wine & drinks plus a nice table full of kiddy confectionary. We all enjoyed the splendor of this hotel & nice indoor, outdoor pools & jacuzzi. Enchanted Gardens had a huge international buffet, ideal for kids as disney characters made their rounds. The spa was run professionally.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Wonderful!!”
Reviews.Author: kcjayhawk11
Reviews.Content: This is the best hotel in which my husband and I have ever stayed. Everything was beautiful, clean, and top quality. My husband, two children, ages 3 and 5, and I stayed in an average room for three with a view of the water and the gardens. There were a lot of little details in the room that make a big difference. There were two adult robes and slippers as well as one child robe and slippers. There was a step stool in the bathroom, complimentary water and milk in the fridge, and a very nice amenity kit. The bed was very, very comfortable and the room-darkening curtains were exactly that. They were perfect. No light came through at all - very nice if you have children who need to nap in the middle of the day. The grounds were immaculate and so gorgeous. The restaurant food was pretty good. The service was always impeccable. On top of all that the price was amazing! I would recommend this hotel to anyone and everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: danicasey
Reviews.Content: An absolutely amazing hotel for all ages. Everything about this hotel is five star with a little bit more on top. The presentation is immaculate inside and out. I feel that the otside presentation is better than the USA Disneyland hotel. Would highly recommend this venue to those wishing to do the Disneyland thing. If using this venue as a touch base for other places in Hong Kong, you might find it a bit out of the way.

Reviews.Title: “amazing hotel”
Reviews.Author: CrawleyFamily
Reviews.Content: having just returned home after spending two nights at the Disneyland Hotel Hong Kong I just had to let you all know how fantastic it really was. We joined the Tung chung MTR line at Hong Kong Central (this also picks up in Kowloon 3 minutes later) and continued onto Sunny Bay Station where we changed train and joined the disneyline. How fab was it when the Disney train arrived every window on the train was the shape of Mickey Mouses head. Even once on board the hand rails were Mickey Mouse shaped too. from that moment we knew we were in for a terrific time. Within 30 mins of leaving Hong Kong Island we had arrived at Disney. Jumped on the free shuttle bus to the Disneyland Hotel. We stopped enroute to drop off passengers at the Hollywood Hotel but when we arrived at our Hotel we knew we had made the right choice. My Husband ,son (age 2) and myself had booked a Kingdom Club Room which we had a full sea view on the 7th floor and access to the lounge which served nibbles,breakfasts etc. The hotel rooms were truly wonderful worth every penny. On the first night we watched the fireworks from the balcony in the club lounge this was excellent.Powerful showers spotless everywhere flat screen tv even a small one in the bath room free mini bar. The first morning we had breakfast in the club lounge, but the second morning we had a character breakfast in the enchanted restaurant this is well worth doing and again worth every penny the choice of food was unreal. from english breakfast to chinese breakfast fresh fruit. Good choice for children. I only had one little grumble and that was the room service choice of the childrens menu of which i did mention to the staff on check out. We stayed at this hotel after Easter which turned out to be agood choice as it was very quiet. The service of the staff was superb and nothing was to much trouble. It was very sad to leave this truly luxurious hotel. Never mind we still have the memory. Two days at Disney theme park is plenty as this is the smallest park, and you can do and see everything within this time.

Reviews.Title: “Magical stay”
Reviews.Author: JanaliSydney
Reviews.Content: We had a fantastic stay in April 2006. Breakfast with the characters was special and being so close to the park meant we could go back to the room in the afternoon and return for the fireworks in the evening which should not be missed. A magical stay which would warrant a return if there were not so many places to visit in the world! Hotel quality overall was excellent, and the kids loved the Disney surprises in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Disneyland Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: Cher_711
Reviews.Content: Kids will simply adore this place... very family oriented too... each room comes with 2 queen-size beds.. and there are cartoon channels in both cantonese and English language.. Hotel is really an extension of the Disneyland nearby...

HotelInfo.Name: Hong Kong Disneyland Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Hong Kong Disneyland, Lantau Island,, Hong Kong, China
